sen.j: 西郷 隆盛（さいごう たかもり、文政10年12月7日 (旧暦)〈グレゴリオ暦1828年1月23日・ユリウス暦1828年1月11日〉 - 明治10年〈グレゴリオ暦1877年〉9月24日）は、日本の武士・薩摩藩士、軍人、政治家。
sen.e: Takamori SAIGO (December 27, 1828 (the old calendar) (January 23, 1828, on the Gregorian calendar/ January 1, 1828 on the Julian calendar) - (September 24, 1877 on the Gregorian calendar) was the Japanese Samurai, feudal retainer of Satsuma, military man and statesman.

Takamori SAIGO (December 27, 1828 according to the old calendar (Gregorian calendar: January 23, 1828; Julian calendar: January 1, 1828) - September 24, 1877 of the Gregorian calendar) was a Japanese samurai who served as a feudal retainer, soldier, and statesman of the Satsuma clan.
sen.cmt: IMPORTANT: In 20297 this is referred to as the lunar calendar.. Itshould be standardized (旧暦)
sen.e: Takamori SAIGO (December 27, 1828 according to the old calendar (Gregorian calendar: January 23, 1828; Julian calendar: January 1, 1828) - September 24, 1877 of the Gregorian calendar) was a Japanese samurai who served as a feudal retainer, soldier, and statesman of the Satsuma clan.

sen.j: 薩摩藩の盟友大久保利通、長州藩の木戸孝允（桂小五郎）と並び、「維新の三傑」と称される。
sen.e: Called 'Ishin no Sanketsu (three contributors of Meiji Restoration)' with sworn allies, Toshimichi OKUBO of the domain of Satsuma, and Takayoshi KIDO (Kogoro KATSURA) of the domain of Choshu.
sen.cmt: 薩摩藩→domain of Satsuma[http://100.yahoo.co.jp/detail/薩摩藩/]大久保利通→Toshimichi OKUBO[http://kotobank.jp/word/大久保利通]長州藩→domain of Choshu[http://100.yahoo.co.jp/detail/長州藩/]木戸孝允→Takayoshi KIDO[http://kotobank.jp/word/木戸孝允]桂小五郎→Kogoro KATSURA[http://kotobank.jp/word/桂小五郎]
sen.e: Takamori SAIGO was one of the 'Ishin no Sanketsu' (literally, "three heroes of the [Meiji} Restoration"), as were his sworn allies Toshimichi OKUBO of the Satsuma Domain and Takayoshi KIDO (also known as Kogoro KATSURA) of the Choshu Domain.

Takamori SAIGO was one of the 'Ishin no Sanketsu' (literally, three heroes of the Meiji Restoration), as were his sworn allies Toshimichi OKUBO of the Satsuma Domain and Takayoshi KIDO (also known as Kogoro KATSURA) of the Choshu Domain.

sen.j: 名（諱）は元服時には隆永（たかなが）、のちに武雄、隆盛（たかもり）と改めた。
sen.e: Named Takanaga when the ceremony of attaining manhood, and renamed Takeo then Takamori.
He was named Takanaga at the ceremony of attainment of manhood, and renamed Takeo then Takamori.
sen.cmt: NOTE: should this be "coming of age ceremony" ?
sen.e: He was named Takanaga at the coming of age ceremony, and renamed Takeo then Takamori.

sen.j: 西郷家の家長は吉兵衛と名乗り、西郷の本名は8代目西郷吉兵衛隆永と言う、初代は熊本より鹿児島に移り住む、幼名は小吉、通称 (仮名)は吉之介、善兵衛、吉之助と順次変えた。
sen.e: The head of family of Saigo family named Kichibei, and Saigo's real name is the eighth of Takanaga Kichibei SAIGO, the first generation was relocated from Kumamoto to Kagoshima and named the childhood name as Kokichi which known as Kichinosuke, and renamed Zenbei SAIGO then Kichinosuke SAIGO.

The head of the Saigo family was named Kichibei, and Saigo's real name is Takanaga Kichibei SAIGO the eighth, the first generation having relocated from Kumamoto to Kagoshima; and their childhood names were Kokichi who known as Kichinosuke, and he was renamed Zenbei SAIGO and then Kichinosuke SAIGO.
sen.cmt: numerous changes to make the parts of the sentence actually connect.
sen.e: The head of the Saigo family was named Kichibei, and Saigo's real name is Takanaga Kichibei SAIGO the eighth, the first generation having relocated from Kumamoto to Kagoshima; and their childhood names were Kokichi who known as Kichinosuke, and he was renamed Zenbei SAIGO and then Kichinosuke SAIGO.

sen.j: 号は南洲（なんしゅう）。
sen.e: Go is Nanshu.
SEND BACK TO TRANSLATOR
sen.cmt: We need a lot more here. We lack any semblance of context that would inform us of how we need to phrase this.
sen.e: Go (pen name) was Nanshu.

sen.j: 隆盛の名は父と同名であるが、これは王政復古 (日本)の章典で位階を授けられる際に親友の吉井友実が誤って父吉兵衛の名を届けたため、それ以後は父の名を名乗ったからである。
sen.e: Takamori's name was same as his father's name, but Tomozane YOSHII who was his best friend applied Kichibei which is father's name by mistake when he received the orders of Shoten bill of Restration of monarchy, after that he named himself his father's name.
sen.cmt: 吉井友実→Tomozane YOSHII[http://kotobank.jp/word/吉井友実]
sen.e: Takamori's name was the same as his father's name, but Tomozane YOSHII, who was his best friend, called him Kichibei, which was his father's name, by mistake when he received his orders from the Shoten Bill of Restoration of Monarchy, and after that he called himself by his father's name.
sen.cmt: applied -> called him Restration -> Restoration IMPORTANT: I capatalized this: Shoten Bill of Restoration of Monarchy but I am not sure exactly how SunFlare wants me to treat this.
sen.e: Takamori's name was the same as his father's name, but Tomozane YOSHII, who was his best friend, called him Kichibei, which was his father's name, by mistake when he received his orders from the Shoten Bill of Restoration of Monarchy, and after that he called himself by his father's name.

sen.j: 一時、西郷三助・菊池源吾・大島三右衛門などの変名も名乗った。
sen.e: At one time, he named himself as Sansuke SAIGO, Gengo KIKUCHI and Sanemon OSHIMA as changed names.
sen.cmt: 菊池源吾→Gengo KIKUCHI[http://www.pref.kagoshima.jp/reimeikan/josetsu/theme/gendai/toubaku/kgs04_s1_3.html]大島三右衛門→Sanemon OSHIMA[http://kotobank.jp/word/大島三右衛門]
sen.e: At various times, he have himself the assumed names Sansuke SAIGO, Gengo KIKUCHI, and Sanemon OSHIMA.
sen.cmt: changed names --> assumed names named-> gave
sen.e: At various times, he have himself the assumed names Sansuke SAIGO, Gengo KIKUCHI, and Sanemon OSHIMA.

sen.j: 次弟は戊辰戦争（北越戦争）で戦死した西郷吉二郎（隆廣）、三弟は明治政府の重鎮西郷従道（通称は信吾、号は竜庵）、四弟は西南戦争で戦死した西郷小兵衛（隆雄、隆武）。
sen.e: The second brother is Kichijito SAIGO who died at Boshin War (Hokuetsu War), the third brother is Tugumichi SAIGO who was the grand person of Meji government (known as Shingo, go is Ryuan) and the fourth brother is Kohei (Takakatsu, Takatake) SAIGO who died at Seinan War.
sen.cmt: 北越戦争→Hokuetsu War[http://kotobank.jp/word/北越戦争]西郷吉二郎（隆廣）→Kichijiro (Takahiro) SAIGO[http://kotobank.jp/word/西郷吉二郎]西郷従道→Tsugumichi SAIGO[http://kotobank.jp/word/西郷従道]信吾→Shingo[http://kotobank.jp/word/西郷従道,「朝日日本歴史人物事典」では「慎吾」でした。]
sen.e: His second brother was Kichijito SAIGO who died in the Boshin War (Hokuetsu War), his third brother was Tugumichi SAIGO, who was a central figure in the Meji government, (known as Shingo, go is Ryuan) and his fourth brother was Kohei (Takakatsu, Takatake) SAIGO who died in the Seinan War.
sen.cmt: many minor changes who was the grand person of Meji government -->who was a central figure in the Meji government corrected the tenses. IMPORTANT: I do not know what to do with "go is Ryuan)"
sen.e: His second brother was Kichijito SAIGO who died in the Boshin War (Hokuetsu War), his third brother was Tugumichi SAIGO, who was a central figure in the Meji government, (known as Shingo, go is Ryuan) and his fourth brother was Kohei (Takakatsu, Takatake) SAIGO who died in the Seinan War.

sen.j: 大山巌（弥助）は従弟、川村純義（与十郎）も親戚である。
sen.e: Iwao (Yasuke) OYAMA is cousin and Sumiyoshi (Yojuro) KAWAMURA is also the relative.
sen.cmt: 大山巌（弥助）→Iwao (Yasuke) OYAMA[http://kotobank.jp/word/大山巌]川村純義（与十郎）→Sumiyoshi (Yojuro) KAWAMURA[http://kotobank.jp/word/川村純義]
sen.e: Iwao (Yasuke) OYAMA was his cousin and Sumiyoshi (Yojuro) KAWAMURA was also also a relative of his.
Iwao (Yasuke) OYAMA was his cousin and Sumiyoshi (Yojuro) KAWAMURA was also also a relative of his.

sen.j: 薩摩藩の下級武士であったが、藩主の島津斉彬の目にとまり抜擢され、当代一の開明派大名であった斉彬の身近にあって、強い影響を受けた。
sen.e: He was a samurai in the lower grade, but Nariakira SHIMAZU who was the lord of domain found and selected him, and he stayed close with Nariakira SHIMAZU who was the greatest Daimyo of Kaimei Group alive, and he got strongly influenced by Nariakira
sen.cmt: 島津斉彬→Nariakira SHIMAZU[http://kotobank.jp/word/島津斉彬]
sen.e: He was a samurai in the lower grade, but Nariakira SHIMAZU, who was the lord of the domain, found and selected him, and he stayed close to Nariakira SHIMAZU, who was the greatest Daimyo of the Kaimei Group still living, and he was strongly influenced by Nariakira.
sen.cmt: "samurai in the lower grade" I looked through the standardization lists that SunFlare provided but I could not find the yougo for this term. I left it as is.
sen.e: He was a samurai in the lower grade, but Nariakira SHIMAZU, who was the lord of the domain, found and selected him, and he stayed close to Nariakira SHIMAZU, who was the greatest Daimyo of the Kaimei Group still living, and he was strongly influenced by Nariakira.

sen.j: 斉彬の急死で失脚し、奄美大島に流される。
sen.e: He lost his position by death of Nariakira, and got transportation to Amami-oshima island.
He lost his position due to the death of Nariakira, and travelled to Amami-oshima island.
sen.cmt: by -> due to the got transportation-> went
sen.e: He lost his position due to the death of Nariakira, and travelled to Amami-oshima island.

sen.j: 復帰するが、新藩主の実父で事実上の藩主の島津久光と折り合わず、再び、沖永良部島に流罪にあう。
sen.e: He came back but he didn't get along with his real father, who was the new actual lord of domain, and again he got transportation to Oki-no-erabujima island.
sen.cmt: 島津久光→Hisamitsu SHIMAZU[http://kotobank.jp/word/島津久光]
sen.e: Although he returned home he did not get along with his biological father, who was the new lord of the domain, and again he travelled, this time to Oki-no-erabujima island.
sen.cmt: real --> biological; several other important changes added "this time"
sen.e: Although he returned home he did not get along with his biological father, who was the new lord of the domain, and again he travelled, this time to Oki-no-erabujima island.

sen.j: しかし、家老小松清廉（帯刀）や大久保の後押しで復帰し、元治元年（1864年）の禁門の変以降に活躍し、薩長同盟の成立や王政復古 (日本)に成功し、戊辰戦争を巧みに主導した。
sen.e: But he came back supported by Kiyokado KOMATSU who was the chief retainer (to belt on a sward) and he worked hard after Kimmon no Hen in 1864, and succeed in formation of Satsuma-Choshu Alliance and Restoration of monarchy (Japan), and took the initiative in Boshin War.
sen.cmt: 小松清廉→Kiyokado KOMATSU[http://sakamoto-ryoma.biz/s-komatu.html]禁門の変→Kimmon no Hen (Conspiracy of Kimmon)[http://dic.yahoo.co.jp/dsearch?enc=UTF-8&p=禁門の変&dtype=0&dname=0na&stype=0&pagenum=1&index=05811604901900]
sen.e: But again he returned, supported by Kiyokado KOMATSU, who was the chief retainer (to belt on a sward) and after Kimmon no Hen (Conspiracy of Kimmon) in 1864, he was very active, and succeeded forming the Satsuma-Choshu Alliance and the Restoration of the Monarchy (Japan), and took initiative in the Boshin War.
sen.cmt: and Restoration of monarchy (Japan)-> Restoration of the Monarchy many minor changes
sen.e: But again he returned, supported by Kiyokado KOMATSU, who was the chief retainer (to belt on a sward) and after Kimmon no Hen (Conspiracy of Kimmon) in 1864, he was very active, and succeeded forming the Satsuma-Choshu Alliance and the Restoration of the Monarchy (Japan), and took initiative in the Boshin War.

sen.j: 勝海舟との降伏交渉に当たっては、新政府の後ろ盾となっていたイギリスが、江戸湾を拠点とした貿易に支障がでることを恐れて江戸総攻撃に反対したため、西郷隆盛をはじめとする新政府はイギリスの求めに応じ、江戸総攻撃を中止した（江戸無血開城）。
sen.e: England was backing of the new government and they were against the all-out assault of Edo, because they were afraid of trouble with trading which based on Edo Bay, because of that, Takamori SAIGO and the new government accepted the England's demand and stopped the all-out surrender of Edo (bloodless surrender of Edo).

England backed the new government and was against the all-out assault of Edo because she was afraid of disrupting trade in Edo Bay, and because of this Takamori SAIGO and the new government accepted England's demands and stopped the all-out surrender of Edo (bloodless surrender of Edo).
sen.cmt: was backing of->backed they -> she (country) I m not at all convinced that "demands" is the right word here.
sen.e: England backed the new government and was against the all-out assault of Edo because she was afraid of disrupting trade in Edo Bay, and because of this Takamori SAIGO and the new government accepted England's demands and stopped the all-out surrender of Edo (bloodless surrender of Edo).

sen.j: その後、薩摩へ帰郷したが、明治4年（1871年）に参議として新政府に復職。
sen.e: After that, he returned to Satsuma, and comeback as a councilor of the new government in 1871.
After that, he returned to Satsuma, and resumed office as a councilor of the new government in 1871.
After that, he returned to Satsuma, and resumed office as a councilor of the new government in 1871.

sen.j: さらにその後には陸軍大将・近衛都督を兼務し、大久保、木戸ら岩倉使節団の外遊中には留守政府を主導した。
sen.e: And after that, he held the post of the full general and the Konoe-totoku (regulator of Konoefu), and took the lead of Rusu-seifu (government while heads of government are away) when Okubo and Kido went to the official travel of Iwakura Mission.

And after that, he held the posts of full general and Konoe-totoku (regulator of Konoefu), and he took charge of the Rusu-seifu (a temporary government while the permanent officials are away) when Okubo and Kido went to the official travel of Iwakura Mission.
sen.cmt: overnment while heads of government are away -> a temporary government while the permanent officials are away other minor changes
sen.e: And after that, he held the posts of full general and Konoe-totoku (regulator of Konoefu), and he took charge of the Rusu-seifu (a temporary government while the permanent officials are away) when Okubo and Kido went to the official travel of Iwakura Mission.

sen.j: 朝鮮との国交回復問題では李氏朝鮮開国を勧める遣韓使節として自らが朝鮮に赴くことを提案し、一旦大使に任命されたが、帰国した大久保らと対立する。
sen.e: He proposed to going to Korea himself as a Kenkan Shisetsu (Japanese official diplomatic delegations sent to Korea) himself to suggest to open Yi Dynasty Korea for restoring relations problem with Korea, then he was appointed as an ambassador at once, and then had an antagonism between Okubo who came back to Japan.

He proposed to going to Korea himself as a Kenkan Shisetsu (Japanese official diplomatic delegate sent to Korea) himself to attempt to restore relations with the Yi Dynasty Korea due to problems there, and he was appointed as an ambassador at once, which resulted in the antagonism of Okubo who came back to Japan.

He proposed to going to Korea himself as a Kenkan Shisetsu (Japanese official diplomatic delegate sent to Korea) himself to attempt to restore relations with the Yi Dynasty Korea due to problems there, and he was appointed as an ambassador at once, which resulted in the antagonism of Okubo who came back to Japan.

sen.j: 明治6年（1873年）の明治六年政変で江藤新平、板垣退助らとともに下野、再び鹿児島に戻り、私学校で教育に専念する。
sen.e: In 1873, he once more returned to Kagoshima with Shimpei ETO and Taisuke ITAGAKI by Meiji roku-nen no Seihen (Coups of 1873), and concentrate on the education for Shigakko (school mainly for warriors).

In 1873, he once more returned to Kagoshima with Shimpei ETO and Taisuke ITAGAKI for the Meiji roku-nen no Seihen (Coups of 1873), and concentrated on the education at Shigakko (a school mainly for warriors).

In 1873, he once more returned to Kagoshima with Shimpei ETO and Taisuke ITAGAKI for the Meiji roku-nen no Seihen (Coups of 1873), and concentrated on the education at Shigakko (a school mainly for warriors).

sen.j: 佐賀の乱、神風連の乱、秋月の乱、萩の乱など士族の反乱が続く中で、明治10年（1877年）に私学校生徒の暴動から起こった西南戦争の指導者となるが、敗れて城山で自刃した。
sen.e: While continuing the Shizoku-no-Hanran (rebellion of warrior class) that is Saga-no-ran War (turmoil of Saga), Shimpuren-no-ran War (turmoil of Shimpuren, dissatisfied warrior group), Akizuki-no-ran War (turmoil of Akizuki) and Hagi-no-ran War (turmoil of dissatisfied warriors at Hagi), he became a leader of Seinan War which started from students of Shigakko in 1887, but he lost at Shiroyama and suicides by the sword.
sen.cmt: 神風連の乱→Shimpuren-no-ran War (turmoil of Shimpuren, dissatisfied warrior group)[http://kotobank.jp/word/神風連の乱]秋月の乱→Akizuki-no-ran War (turmoil of Akizuki)[http://kotobank.jp/word/秋月の乱]萩の乱→Hagi-no-ran War (turmoil of dissatisfied warriors at Hagi)[http://kotobank.jp/word/萩の乱]
sen.e: While the Shizoku-no-Hanran (rebellion of warrior class), Saga-no-ran War (turmoil of Saga), Shimpuren-no-ran War (turmoil of Shimpuren, a dissatisfied warrior group), Akizuki-no-ran War (turmoil of Akizuki), and Hagi-no-ran War (turmoil of dissatisfied warriors at Hagi) were going on, he became a leader in the Seinan War, which started due to students of Shigakko in 1887, but he lost at Shiroyama and committed suicide.

sen.j: 位階は正三位。
sen.e: His court rank was Shosammi rank.
His court rank was Shosanmi (Senior third rank).
His court rank was Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank).

sen.j: 功により、継嗣の西郷寅太郎に侯爵を賜る。

sen.j: 以下、本項では、年・月・日は、明治5年12月2日までは旧暦（太陰太陽暦）である天保暦、明治6年1月1日以後は新暦（太陽暦）であるグレゴリオ暦を用い、和暦を先に、その後ろの（）内にグレゴリオ暦を書く。
sen.e: As follows, this article uses Tempo calendar which is the old calendar (lunar-solar calendar) until December 2, 1872 as year/ month/ day, after January 1, 1873, uses the New calendar (solar calendar)which is the Gregorian calendar, writes the Japanese calendar in front, and the Gregorian calendar is last, inside of ().

Below, the Tempo calendar, which is the old calendar, (lunar-solar calendar) will be used for dates up to December 2, 1872 in year/ month/ day format; after January 1, 1873, the New calendar (solar calendar), which is the Gregorian calendar, will be used, and date according to the Japanese calendar will be written in front, and with the date according to the Gregorian calendar following, inside parentheses.
sen.cmt: Numerous changes to help the sentence flow.
sen.e: Below, the Tempo calendar, which is the old calendar, (lunar-solar calendar) will be used for dates up to December 2, 1872 in year/ month/ day format; after January 1, 1873, the New calendar (solar calendar), which is the Gregorian calendar, will be used, and date according to the Japanese calendar will be written in front, and with the date according to the Gregorian calendar following, inside parentheses.

sen.j: 文政10年（1827年）12月7日、薩摩国鹿児島城下加治屋町山之口馬場（下加治屋町方限）で、御勘定方小頭の西郷九郎隆盛（のち西郷吉兵衛に改名、禄47石余）の第一子として生まれる。
sen.e: On December 7, 1827, born in Yamanoguchi Baba, Shitakajiya-cho (Hogiri, Shitakajiya-cho), Kagoshima-jo, Satsuma-no-kuni, as the first child of Takamori Kuro SAIGO who was the Go-kanjokata-kogashira (chief of finance department) (renamed Kichibei SAIGO later, salary was about 27 seki)

On December 7, 1827, he was born in Yamanoguchi Baba, Shitakajiya-cho (Hogiri, Shitakajiya-cho), Kagoshima-jo, Satsuma-no-kuni, as the first child of Takamori Kuro SAIGO who was the Go-kanjokata-kogashira (chief of the finance department) (who was renamed Kichibei SAIGO later, and whose salary was about 27 seki).
sen.cmt: minor changes consider adding English equivalents for cho, seki, etc. …or else the readers will probably not know this refers to areas of increasing geographical size, etc
sen.e: On December 7, 1827, he was born in Yamanoguchi Baba, Shitakajiya-cho (Hogiri, Shitakajiya-cho), Kagoshima-jo, Satsuma Province, as the first child of Takamori Kuro SAIGO who was the Go-kanjokata-kogashira (chief of the finance department) (who was renamed Kichibei SAIGO later, and whose salary was about 27 seki).

sen.j: 西郷家の家格は御小姓与であり、下から二番目の身分である下級藩士であった。
sen.e: Saigo family's Kakaku was Okoshogumi family rank, lower ranked feudal retainer which is the second lowest rank.
The Saigo family's Kakaku (family rank) was Okoshogumi, (lower ranked feudal retainer) which was the second lowest rank.
sen.cmt: tense, phrasing, helped make it sound natural with the Jse. Words mixed in.
sen.e: The Saigo family's Kakaku (family rank) was Okoshogumi, (lower ranked feudal retainer) which was the second lowest rank.

sen.j: 本姓は藤原氏（系譜参照）を称する。
sen.e: Main name is Fujiwara clan.
Their main name was the Fujiwara clan.

sen.j: 先祖は肥後の菊池家の家臣で、江戸時代の元禄時代に薩摩の島津家家臣になる。
sen.e: The ancestor was the vassal of Kikuchi family in Higo, and became the vassal of Shimazu Family in Satuma, in Genroku era of Edo era.
Their ancestor was the vassal of the Kikuchi family in Higo, and became the vassal of the Shimazu Family in Satuma in the Genroku period of the Edo era.
sen.cmt: added article era--:> period to draw a distinction and avoid redundancy.
sen.e: Their ancestor was the vassal of the Kikuchi family in Higo, and became the vassal of the Shimazu Family in Satuma in the Genroku era of the Edo period.
sen.cmt: Genroku period of the Edo era→Genroku era of the Edo periodに変更しました。

sen.j: 天保10年（1839年)、郷中仲間と月例のお宮参りに行った際、他の郷中と友人とが喧嘩しその仲裁に入るが、上組の郷中が抜いた刀が西郷の右腕内側の神経を切ってしまう。
sen.e: In 1839, when he went to monthly shrine visit with friends of Goju (Satsuma's education organization), he arbitrated the fight between friends and other Goju, the Kamigumi Goju took a knife and cut SAIGO's nerve of inside of right arm.

In 1839, on a monthly visit to a shrine with friends he had in Goju (Satsuma's educational organization), he tried to intervene in a fight between some of his friends and other Goju, and the Kamigumi Goju took a knife and cut the nerve inside SAIGO's right arm.
sen.cmt: phrasing, as usual.. And improved word choice --> arbitrated --> intervene.. IMPORTANT --> what is the kamigumi goju? It may or may not need an article.
sen.e: In 1839, on a monthly visit to a shrine with friends he had in Goju (Satsuma's educational organization), he tried to intervene in a fight between some of his friends and other Goju, and the Kamigumi Goju took a knife and cut the nerve inside Saigo's right arm.

sen.j: 西郷は三日間高熱にうなされたものの一命は取り留めたが、刀を握れなくなったため武術を諦め、学問で身を立てようと志した。
sen.e: Saigo was saved even had a high fever for three days, but he reconciled the Bujutu because he couldn't hold the sword, and decided to live with education.
SAIGO survived even though he had a high fever for three days, but he gave up Bujutsu (martial arts) because he couldn't hold a sword, and decided to pursue scholarship.
Saigo survived even though he had a high fever for three days, but he gave up Bujutsu (martial arts) because he couldn't hold a sword, and decided to pursue scholarship.

sen.j: 天保12年（1841年）、元服し吉之介隆永と名乗る。
sen.e: In 1841, renamed Takanaga YOSHINOSUKE for the coming-of-age.
In 1841, he was renamed Takanaga YOSHINOSUKE when he came-of-age.
sen.cmt: changed phrasing for natural sounding sentence.
sen.e: In 1841, he was renamed Takanaga YOSHINOSUKE when he came-of-age.

sen.j: この頃に下加治屋町郷中（したかじやまちごじゅう）の二才組（にせこ）に昇進。
sen.e: At this time, he had promoted to Niseko of Shitakajiyamachi-goju.
At this time, he was promoted to Niseko of Shitakajiyamachi-goju.
At this time, he was promoted to Niseko of Shitakajiyamachi-goju.

sen.j: これを機に、西郷の身辺警護を中村半次郎（後の桐野利秋）が務め始める。
sen.e: For this opportunity, Hanjiro NAKAMURA (later became Toshiaki KIRINO) was guarding around SAIGO.
sen.cmt: 中村半次郎→Hanjiro NAKAMURA[http://kotobank.jp/word/中村半次郎]桐野利秋→Toshiaki KIRINO[http://kotobank.jp/word/桐野利秋]
sen.e: Using this as an opportunity, Hanjiro NAKAMURA (later, Toshiaki KIRINO) came to guard SAIGO.
Using this as an opportunity, Hanjiro NAKAMURA (later, Toshiaki KIRINO) came to guard Saigo.

tit.e: Korikata-kakiyaku (government clerical of rice customs) time
The Korikata-kakiyaku (government cleric of rice customs) era
The Korikata-kakiyaku (government cleric of rice customs) era

sen.j: 弘化元年（1844年）、郡奉行迫田利済配下となり、郡方書役助をつとめ、御小姓与（一番組小与八番）に編入された。
sen.e: In 1884, became a magistrate of a county of Toshinari SAKOTA and work as Korikata-kakiyakusuke (government clerical of rice customs), and transferred to Okoshogumi family rank (Ichiban-gumi, Koyo Hachiban)

In 1884, he became a magistrate of a county under Toshinari SAKOTA and worked as Korikata-kakiyakusuke (government cleric of rice customs), then was elevated to the family rank of Okoshogumi (Ichiban-gumi, Koyo Hachiban).
sen.cmt: Many of these are left with no period.
sen.e: In 1844, he became a magistrate of a county under Toshinari SAKOTA and worked as Korikata-kakiyakusuke (government cleric of rice customs), then was elevated to the family rank of Okoshogumi (Ichiban-gumi, Koyo Hachiban).

sen.j: 弘化4年（1847年）、郷中の二才頭となった。
sen.e: In 1847, became the Nito-Gashira.
In 1847, he became the Nito-Gashira.
In 1847, he became the Nito-Gashira.

sen.j: 嘉永3年（1850年）、高崎崩れ（お由羅騒動）で赤山靭負（ゆきえ）が切腹し、赤山の御用人をしていた父から切腹の様子を聞き、血衣を見せられた。
sen.e: In 1850, Yukie AKAYAMA did Seppuku (hara-kiri) for Takasaki-Kuzure (the family feud of Satsuma domain); his father who was a Go-yonin (officer handling domestic economy) of AMAYAMA told him about Seppuku (hara-kiri), and showed him bloodstained clothes.
sen.cmt: お由羅騒動→Oyura-sodo (family feud over Narioki SHIMAZU's heir)[http://kotobank.jp/word/お由羅騒動]
sen.e: In 1850, Yukie AKAYAMA committed Seppuku (hara-kiri, or ritual suicide) for Takasaki-Kuzure (the family feud of Satsuma domain); his father who was a Go-yonin (officer handling domestic economy) of AMAYAMA told him about this act of Seppuku (hara-kiri), and showed him bloodstained clothes.
sen.cmt: might be wise to find a succinct way to describe salient features of seppuku instead of just saying hara-kiri, which no one will understand.
sen.e: In 1850, Yukie AKAYAMA committed Seppuku (hara-kiri, or ritual suicide) for Takasaki-Kuzure (the family feud of Satsuma domain); his father who was a Goyonin (officer handling domestic economy) of Akayama told him about this act of Seppuku (hara-kiri), and showed him bloodstained clothes.

sen.j: これ以後、世子島津斉彬の襲封を願うようになった。
sen.e: After that he wished to inhabitation of the territories of heir of Nariakira SHIMIZU.
After that he wished to live in the territories of the heir of Nariakira SHIMIZU.
After that he wished to live in the territories of the heir of Nariakira SHIMIZU.

sen.j: 伊藤茂右衛門に陽明学、福昌寺 (鹿児島市)（現在鹿児島市立玉龍高等学校があるところにあった島津家の菩提寺）の無参和尚に禅を学ぶ。
sen.e: He learned Yomeigaku neo-Confucianism from Moemon ITO and Zen from Musan-osho Priest of Fukusho-ji Temple (Kaoshima City) (Satsuma Family's family temple was located at the place where the Kagoshima Municipal Gyokuryu High School is located now).

He learned Yomeigaku neo-Confucianism from Moemon ITO and Zen from Musan-osho Priest of Fukusho-ji Temple (Kagoshima City) (a family temple of the Satsuma Family's was located at the place where the Kagoshima Municipal Gyokuryu High School is located now).

He learned Yomeigaku neo-Confucianism from Moemon ITO and Zen from Musan-osho Priest of Fukusho-ji Temple (Kagoshima City) (a family temple of the Satsuma Family's was located at the place where the Kagoshima Municipal Gyokuryu High School is located now).

sen.j: この年、赤山らの遺志を継ぐために、秩父崩れの秩父季保愛読の『近思録』を輪読する会を大久保利通（利通）・吉井友実（友実）・伊地知正治（正治）・有村俊斎（海江田信義）らとつくった（このメンバーが精忠組のもとになった）。
sen.e: This year, he made the reading club "Kinshiroku, a book of Chinese thought" which is the book Sueyasu CHICHIBU of Chichibu-Kuzure (a family feud of Satsuma domain) used to prefer to read, with Toshimichi OKUBO (Toshiimichi), Tomomi YOSHII (Tomomi), Masaharu IJICHI (Masaharu) and Shunsai ARIMURA (Nobuyoshi KAIEDA) to succeed to AKASAKA and other's last wish.
sen.cmt: 近思録→"Kinshiroku, a book of Chinese thought"[http://kotobank.jp/word/近思録]伊地知正治（正治）→Masaharu IJICHI[http://kotobank.jp/word/伊地知正治]有村俊斎→Shunsai ARIMURA[http://kotobank.jp/word/有村俊斎]
sen.e: This year, he formed a reading club around "Kinshiroku, a book of Chinese thought" which is a book Sueyasu CHICHIBU of Chichibu-Kuzure (a family feud of Satsuma domain) used to enjoy reading, with Toshimichi OKUBO (Toshiimichi), Tomomi YOSHII (Tomomi), Masaharu IJICHI (Masaharu) and Shunsai ARIMURA (Nobuyoshi KAIEDA) to advance in the will of AKASAKA and others.
sen.cmt: 赤山 interesting that it is read AKASAKA and not AKAYAMA several minor changes

sen.j: 嘉永4年（1851年）2月2日、島津斉興が隠居し、島津斉彬が薩摩藩主になった。
sen.e: On February 2, 1851, Narioki Shimazu retired and Nariakira SHIMAZU became the lord of the Satsuma domain.
sen.cmt: 島津斉興→Narioki SHIMAZU[http://kotobank.jp/word/島津斉興]薩摩藩主→the lord of the Satsuma domain
sen.e: On February 2, 1851, Narioki Shimazu retired, and Nariakira SHIMAZU became lord of the Satsuma domain.
On February 2, 1851, Narioki Shimazu retired, and Nariakira SHIMAZU became lord of the Satsuma Domain.

sen.j: 嘉永5年（1852年）、父母の勧めで伊集院兼寛の姉伊集院須賀（敏（敏子）であったとも云われる）と結婚したが、7月に祖父遊山、9月に父吉兵衛、11月に母マサが相次いで死去し、一人で一家を支えなければならなくなった。
sen.e: In 1852, he married with Suga IJUIN (it is said "Toshi (Toshiko)" as well) who was Kanehiro IJUIN's sister by parents recommendation, but grandfather Yuzan died in July, father Yoshibee died in September and mother Masa died in November one after another, he had to support a family by himself.
sen.cmt: 伊集院兼寛→Kanehiro IJUIN[http://kotobank.jp/word/伊集院兼寛]伊集院須賀（敏（敏子）であったとも云われる）→Suga IJUIN (it is said "Toshi (Toshiko)" as well)遊山→Yuzan (遊山)[定訳不明]マサ→Masa
sen.e: In 1852, he married Suga IJUIN (who was called "Toshi (Toshiko)" as well) who was Kanehiro IJUIN's sister on his parents recommendation, but his grandfather Yuzan died in July, his father Yoshibee died in September and his mother Masa died in November one after another, so he had to support a family by himself.
sen.cmt: added who was, added "his" changed phrasing for natural sounding sentence.

sen.j: 嘉永6年（1853年）2月、家督相続を許可されたが、役は郡方書役助と変わらず、禄は減少して41石余であった。
sen.e: In February 1853, he got a permission of succession to a family but, the position was not different from Korikata-kakiyakusuke (government clerical of rice customs), and salary went down to about forty one seki.

In February 1853, he got an order of permission of succession to a family, but the position was not different from Korikata-kakiyakusuke (government cleric of rice customs), and his salary decreased to about forty one seki.
sen.cmt: consider revising "order of permission" went down is too casual --> decreased.
sen.e: In February 1853, he got an order of permission of succession to a family, but the position was not different from Korikata-kakiyakusuke (government cleric of rice customs), and his salary decreased to about forty one seki.

sen.j: この頃に通称を吉之介から善兵衛に改めた。
sen.e: Around this time, changed the name from Kichinosuke to Zenbei.
Around this time, he changed his name from Kichinosuke to Zenbei.
sen.cmt: changed phrasing for natural sounding sentence.
sen.e: Around this time, he changed his name from Kichinosuke to Zenbei.

sen.j: 12月、マシュー・ペリーが浦賀に来航し、攘夷問題が起き始めた。
sen.e: In December, Matthew Perry came to Japan, and it began to have a problem of Joi (principle of excluding foreigners).
sen.cmt: マシュー・ペリー→Perry, Matthew Calbraith[http://kotobank.jp/word/ペリー]
sen.e: In December, Matthew Perry came to Japan, and the issue of Joi (the principle of excluding foreigners) arose.
In December, Matthew Perry came to Japan, and the issue of Joi (the principle of excluding foreigners) arose.

sen.j: 安政元年（1854年）、上書が認められ、斉彬の江戸参勤に際し、中御小姓・定御供・江戸詰に任ぜられ、江戸に赴いた。
sen.e: In 1854, the memorial to the throne was approved, on the occasion of Edo-sankin (daimyo's alternate-year residence in Edo), he was appointed Chuo-kosho job to do miscellaneous work, Jo-otomo (attendant on a steady basis) and retainer working in Edo, and went to Edo.

In 1854, the memorial to the throne was approved, and on the occasion of Edo-sankin (daimyo's alternate-year residence in Edo), he was appointed to the positions of Chuo-kosho to fulfill general duties, Jo-otomo (permanent attendant), and retainer in Edo, and went to Edo.
sen.cmt: I do not know what the first phrase has to do with the rest of the sentence. "to fulfill general duties" sounds better
sen.e: In 1854, the memorial to the throne was approved, and on the occasion of Edo-sankin (daimyo's alternate-year residence in Edo), he was appointed to the positions of Chuo-kosho to fulfill general duties, Jo-otomo (permanent attendant), and retainer in Edo, and went to Edo.

sen.j: 4月、庭方役となり、当代一の開明派大名であった斉彬から直接教えを受けるようになり、またぜひ会いたいと思っていた碩学藤田東湖にも会い、国事について教えを受けた。
sen.e: In April, he became Niwakata-yaku gardener, and he had learned from Saiakira who was the greatest Daimyo of Kaimei Group alive directly, and he had met the great scholar Toko who was the person that he was wishing to see, and took a lecture about national affairs.
sen.cmt: 藤田東湖→Toko FUJITA[http://kotobank.jp/word/藤田東湖]
sen.e: In April, he became Niwakata-yaku gardener, and he studied under Saiakira, who was the greatest Daimyo of Kaimei Group living, and also he met the great scholar Toko, who was the person that he most wished to meet, and took a lecture about national affairs from him.

In April, he became Niwakata-yaku gardener, and he studied under Saiakira, who was the greatest Daimyo of Kaimei Group living, and also he met the great scholar Toko, who was the person that he most wished to meet, and took a lecture about national affairs from him.

sen.j: 鹿児島では11月に、貧窮の苦労を見かねた妻の実家、伊集院家が西郷家から須賀を引き取ってしまい、以後、二弟の吉二郎が一家の面倒を見ることになった。
sen.e: In November in Kagoshima, the wife's parent's family took Suga from Saigo family because it was hard to see the hardship by poverty, after that, the second brother; Kichijiro took care of the family.

In November in Kagoshima, his wife's parents family took Suga from Saigo's family because it was hard to see her in the hardships of poverty, and after that, Kichijiro, the second eldest brother; took care of the family.

In November in Kagoshima, his wife's parents family took Suga from Saigo's family because it was hard to see her in the hardships of poverty, and after that, Kichijiro, the second eldest brother; took care of the family.

sen.j: 安政2年（1855年）、西郷家の家督を継ぎ、善兵衛から吉兵衛へ改める（8代目吉兵衛）。
sen.e: In 1855, he had succeeded to the headship of Saigo family and changed the name from Yoshibei to Kichibei (The eighth Kichibei)
In 1855, he succeeded to the position of head of the Saigo family, and changed his name from Yoshibei to Kichibei (The eighth Kichibei)
sen.cmt: changed tense (don't need pluperfect) added "his" etc. to make it flow.
sen.e: In 1855, he succeeded to the position of head of the Saigo family, and changed his name from Yoshibei to Kichibei (The eighth Kichibei)

sen.j: 12月、越前藩士橋本左内が来訪し、国事を話し合い、その博識に驚く。
sen.e: In December, the feudal retainer of Echizen, Sanai HASHIMOTO came to visit him and talk about national affairs, and he was surprised about HASHIMOTO's extensive knowledge.
In December, the feudal retainer of Echizen, Sanai HASHIMOTO, came to visit him and to talk about national affairs, and he was surprised at HASHIMOTO's extensive knowledge.
In December, the feudal retainer of Echizen, Sanai HASHIMOTO, came to visit him and to talk about national affairs, and he was surprised at Hashimoto's extensive knowledge.

sen.j: この頃から政治活動資金を時々、斉彬の命で賜るようになる。
sen.e: Around this time, he received the political donation by Saiakira's name.
Around this time, he received a political donation from Saiakira.
Around this time, he received a political donation from Saiakira.

sen.j: 安政3年（1856年）5月、武田耕雲斎と会う。
sen.e: In May 1856, he met Kousai TAKEDA.
In May 1856, he met Kousai TAKEDA.
In May 1856, he met Kousai TAKEDA.

sen.j: 7月、斉彬の密書を水戸の徳川斉昭に持って行く。
sen.e: In July, he brought a secret letter of Saiakira to Nariaki TOKUNAGA in Mito.
sen.cmt: 徳川斉昭→Nariaki TOKUGAWA[http://kotobank.jp/word/徳川斉昭]
sen.e: In July, he brought a secret letter of Saiakira to Nariaki TOKUNAGA in Mito.
In July, he brought a secret letter of Saiakira to Nariaki TOKUNAGA in Mito.

sen.j: 12月、第13代将軍徳川家定と斉彬の養女天璋院（敬子、将軍正室）が結婚。
sen.e: In December, the thirteenth Shogun Iesada TOKUNAGA married Tenhoin (Keiko, Shogun's legal wife) who was an adopted daughter of Saiakira.
sen.cmt: 徳川家定→Iesada TOKUGAWA[http://kotobank.jp/word/徳川家定]
sen.e: In December, the thirteenth Shogun Iesada TOKUNAGA married Tenhoin (Keiko, Shogun's legal wife) who was an adopted daughter of Saiakira.
In December, the thirteenth Shogun Iesada TOKUNAGA married Tenhoin (Keiko, Shogun's legal wife) who was an adopted daughter of Saiakira.

sen.j: この頃の斉彬の考え方は、将軍正室を通じて一橋家の徳川慶喜を第14代将軍にし、賢侯の協力と公武親和によって幕府を中心とした中央集権体制を作り、開国して富国強兵をはかって露英仏など諸外国に対処しようとするもので、日中韓同盟をも視野にいれた壮大な計画であった。
sen.e: At that time, Saiakira's thought was make Yoshinobu TOKUGAWA to be the fourteenth Shogun through the legal wife of Shogun, and makes the system of gathering power in the center of the shogunate by corporate with active Daimyo Feudal Lord, and makes the prosperous country and making strong army for opening a country to deal with foreign countries like Russia, Great Britain and France, it was the magnificent plan including the outlook for alliance of Japan, China and Korea.
sen.cmt: 徳川慶喜→Yoshinobu TOKUGAWA[http://dic.yahoo.co.jp/dsearch?enc=UTF-8&p=徳川慶喜&stype=0&dtype=0], 富国強兵→prosperous country and strong army[英辞郎 on the WEB]
sen.e: At that time, Saiakira thought to make Yoshinobu TOKUGAWA the fourteenth Shogun through the legal wife of the Shogun, and to make the system in which power was centralized with the active Daimyo Feudal Lord, and to make the country prosperous and build a strong army, so that the country could be opened up and deal with foreign countries like Russia, Great Britain and France, and it was a magnificent plan that included a contingency for alliance with Japan, China and Korea.

At that time, Saiakira thought to make Yoshinobu TOKUGAWA the fourteenth Shogun through the legal wife of the Shogun, and to make the system in which power was centralized with the active Daimyo Feudal Lord, and to make the country prosperous and build a strong army, so that the country could be opened up and deal with foreign countries like Russia, Great Britain and France, and it was a magnificent plan that included a contingency for alliance with Japan, China and Korea.

sen.j: 西郷はその手足となって活動したのである。
sen.e: He worked for it hand and foot.
He worked extremely hard on this plan.
sen.cmt: changed phrasing for natural sounding sentence.
sen.e: He worked extremely hard on this plan.

sen.j: 安政4年（1857年）4月、参勤交代の帰途に肥後国熊本藩の長岡監物、津田山三郎と会い、国事を話し合った。
sen.e: In April 1857, he met Sanzaburo TSUDA who was the Nagaoka Kambutsu duty of the domain of Kumamoto on the way home of Sankin-kotai (daimyo's alternate-year residence in Edo), and talked about national affairs.

In April 1857, he met Sanzaburo TSUDA who had the position of Nagaoka Kambutsu in the domain of Kumamoto on the way home from Sankin-kotai (the daimyo's alternate-year residence in Edo), and they talked about national affairs.

In April 1857, he met Sanzaburo TSUDA who had the position of Nagaoka Kanbutsu in the domain of Kumamoto on the way home from Sankin-kotai (the daimyo's alternate-year residence in Edo), and they talked about national affairs.

sen.j: 5月、帰藩。
sen.e: Returned to the domain in May.
He returned to the domain in May.
He returned to the domain in May.

sen.j: 次弟吉二郎が御勘定所書役、三弟信吾が表茶坊主に任ぜられた。
sen.e: The second brother Kichijiro was appointed Go-kanjosho-shoyaku (clerical of finance ministry), and the third brother Shingo was appointed Omote Chabozu (tea-server who taking care of Daimyo).

His second eldest brother Kichijiro was appointed Go-kanjosho-shoyaku (cleric of finance ministry), and the third eldest brother Shingo was appointed Omote Chabozu (tea-server and caregiver to the Daimyo).
