sen.e: His second eldest brother Kichijiro was appointed Go-kanjosho-shoyaku (cleric of finance ministry), and the third eldest brother Shingo was appointed Omote Chabozu (tea-server and caregiver to the Daimyo).

sen.j: 10月、徒目付・鳥預の兼務を命ぜられた（親友大久保利通（正助）も徒目付になった）。
sen.e: He was appointed Kachi-metsuke title (job to do night duty and inspection) and Tori-azukari in October (the best friend Toshimichi (Shosuke) OKUBO also became Kachi-metsuke title (job to do night duty and inspection)).
He was appointed to the post of Kachi-metsuke (a position entailing night duty and inspection) and Tori-azukari in October his best friend Toshimichi (Shosuke) OKUBO also became Kachi-metsuke.
sen.cmt: no need to restate "job to do night duty and inspection."
sen.e: He was appointed to the post of Kachi-metsuke (a position entailing night duty and inspection) and Tori-azukari in October his best friend Toshimichi (Shosuke) OKUBO also became Kachi-metsuke.

sen.j: 11月、藍玉の高値に困っていた下関の白石正一郎に薩摩の藍玉_(染料)購入の斡旋をし、以後、白石宅は薩摩人の活動拠点の一つになった。
sen.e: In November, he mediated the purchase of indigo (dye) ball to Shoichiro SHIRAISHI of Satuma who was perplexed about high price of indigo ball, after that, Shiraishi residence became one of the base for Satuma-jin (Satsuma citizen).
sen.cmt: 白石正一郎→Shoichiro SHIRAISHI[http://kotobank.jp/word/白石正一郎]
sen.e: In November, he mediated the purchase of an indigo (dye) ball by Shoichiro SHIRAISHI of Satsuma, who was perplexed about high price of an indigo ball, after that, Shiraishi residence became one of the bases for Satsuma-jin (Satsuma citizens).
sen.cmt: I think that this sentence means that the ball was purchased BY shiraishi, please verify this. "citizenS" implies some degree of enfranchisments usually, I am not sure if it is the word we are looking for
sen.e: In November, he mediated the purchase of an indigo (dye) ball by Shoichiro SHIRAISHI of Satsuma, who was perplexed about high price of an indigo ball, after that, Shiraishi residence became one of the bases for Satsuma-jin (Satsuma citizens).

sen.j: 12月、江戸に着き、将軍継嗣に関する斉彬の密書を越前藩主松平慶永に持って行き、この月内、橋本左内らと一橋慶喜擁立について協議を重ねた。
sen.e: In December, he arrived in Edo, and was brought a secret letter of Saiakira about Shogun Yoshitsugu to Yoshinaga MATSUDAIRA of the lord of the Echizen domain, in this month, he discussed about enthroning Yoshinobu HITOTSUBASHI with Sanai HASHIMOTO.
sen.cmt: 松平慶永→Yoshinaga MATSUDAIRA[http://kotobank.jp/word/松平慶永]橋本左内→Sanai HASHIMOTO[http://kotobank.jp/word/橋本左内]一橋慶喜→Yoshinobu HITOTSUBASHI[http://kotobank.jp/word/一橋慶喜]
sen.e: In December, he arrived in Edo, and was took a secret letter of Saiakira's relating to Shogun Yoshitsugu to Yoshinaga MATSUDAIRA the lord of the Echizen domain, and in this month, he discussed enthroning Yoshinobu HITOTSUBASHI with Sanai HASHIMOTO.
sen.cmt: clarified the relation between the parties involved with the letter.
sen.e: In December, he arrived in Edo, and was took a secret letter of Saiakira's relating to Shogun Yoshitsugu to Yoshinaga MATSUDAIRA the lord of the Echizen Domain, and in this month, he discussed enthroning Yoshinobu HITOTSUBASHI with Sanai HASHIMOTO.

sen.j: 安政5年（1858年）1、2月、橋本左内・梅田雲浜らと書簡を交わし、中根雪江が来訪するなど情報交換し、3月には将軍正室から近衛忠煕への書簡を携えて京都に赴き、僧月照らの協力で慶喜継嗣のための内勅降下をはかったが失敗した。
sen.e: In January and February of 1858, he was exchanging letters with Sanai HASHIMOTO and Unpin UMEDA and exchanged the information about visiting of Yukie NAKANE, and, in March, he went to Kyoto with a letter from Shogun's legal wife to Tadahiro KONOE, and tried to issue an secret Imperial command of Yoshinobu's heir by the support from priest Gessho, but he failed it.
sen.cmt: 梅田雲浜→Unpin UMEDA[http://kotobank.jp/word/梅田雲浜]中根雪江→Yukie NAKANE[http://kotobank.jp/word/中根雪江]近衛忠煕→Tadahiro KONOE[http://kotobank.jp/word/近衛忠煕]
sen.e: In January and February of 1858, he was exchanging letters with Sanai HASHIMOTO and Unpin UMEDA, and he exchanged information about the visiting of Yukie NAKANE, and, in March, he went to Kyoto with a letter from the Shogun's legal wife to Tadahiro KONOE, and tried to obtain issuance of an secret Imperial command of Yoshinobu's heir using the support of the priest Gessho, but he failed to receive it.

In January and February of 1858, he was exchanging letters with Sanai HASHIMOTO and Unpin UMEDA, and he exchanged information about the visiting of Yukie NAKANE, and, in March, he went to Kyoto with a letter from the Shogun's legal wife to Tadahiro KONOE, and tried to obtain issuance of an secret Imperial command of Yoshinobu's heir using the support of the priest Gessho, but he failed to receive it.

sen.j: 5月、彦根藩主井伊直弼が大老となった。
sen.e: In May, Naosuke II of the lord of the Hikone domain became Tairo (chief minister).
sen.cmt: 井伊直弼→Naosuke II[http://kotobank.jp/word/井伊直弼]
sen.e: In May, Naosuke II of the lord of the Hikone domain became Tairo (chief minister).
In May, Naosuke II of the lord of the Hikone Domain became Tairo (chief minister).

sen.j: 井伊は、6月に日米修好通商条約に調印し、次いで紀伊藩主徳川慶福を将軍継嗣に決定した。
sen.e: In June, II signed a treaty of amity and commerce with America, and then decided to make Yoshitomi TOKUNAGA of the lord of the Kii domain to be Shogun Yoshitsugu.
sen.cmt: 徳川慶福→Yoshitomi TOKUGAWA[http://kotobank.jp/word/徳川慶福]
sen.e: In June, Ii signed a treaty of amity and commerce with America, and then decided to make Yoshitomi TOKUNAGA, the lord of the Kii domain, the Shogun Yoshitsugu.
In June, Ii signed a treaty of amity and commerce with America, and then decided to make Yoshitomi TOKUNAGA, the lord of the Kii Domain, the Shogun Yoshitsugu.

sen.j: 7月には不時登城を理由に徳川斉昭に謹慎、松平慶永に謹慎・隠居、徳川慶喜に登城禁止を命じ、まず一橋派への弾圧から強権を振るい始めた（広義の安政の大獄開始）。
sen.e: In July, Nariaki TOKUGAWA was ordered to be put on his best behavior from the reason of going to the Castle untimely, Yoshinaga MATSUDAIRA was ordered to be put on his best behavior and retirement, and Yoshinobu TOKUGAWA was ordered to banning to go to the castle, at first, they started to exercise their authority to oppress the Hitotsubashi group (beginning of Ansei no Taigoku of Hiroyoshi (suppression of Sonjo group by Naosuke).

In July, Nariaki TOKUGAWA was ordered to be on his best behavior for the reason that he went to the Castle in an untimely manner, Yoshinaga MATSUDAIRA was ordered to be on his best behavior and made to retire, and Yoshinobu TOKUGAWA was ordered to be banned and to go to the castle; at first, they started to exercise their authority to oppress the Hitotsubashi group (this was the beginning of the Ansei no Taigoku of Hiroyoshi (suppression of Sonjo group by Naosuke).
sen.cmt: The relationship between the two main clauses is not clear. This could easily be separated into 2 sentences..
sen.e: In July, Nariaki TOKUGAWA was ordered to be on his best behavior for the reason that he went to the Castle in an untimely manner, Yoshinaga MATSUDAIRA was ordered to be on his best behavior and made to retire, and Yoshinobu TOKUGAWA was ordered to be banned and to go to the castle; at first, they started to exercise their authority to oppress the Hitotsubashi group (this was the beginning of the Ansei no Taigoku (suppression of Sonjo group by Naosuke) in extensive interpretation).
sen.cmt: 「広義の(こうぎの）」は「広い意味で」のことだと思います。)補足

sen.j: この間、西郷は6月に鹿児島へ帰り、松平慶永からの江戸・京都情勢を記した書簡を斉彬にもたらし、すぐに上京し、梁川星巌・春日潜庵らと情報交換した。
sen.e: While this time, SAIGO returned to Kagoshima, with a letter about situations of Kyoto to Yoshinaga MATSUDAIRA, and went to Kyoto to exchange the information with Seigan YANAGAWA and Sen'an KASUGA.
sen.cmt: 梁川星巌→Seigan YANAGAWA[http://kotobank.jp/word/梁川星巌]春日潜庵→Sen'an KASUGA[http://kotobank.jp/word/春日潜庵]
sen.e: During this time, SAIGO returned to Kagoshima with a letter about the situation of Kyoto to Yoshinaga MATSUDAIRA, and went to Kyoto to exchange information with Seigan YANAGAWA and Sen'an KASUGA.
During this time, Saigo returned to Kagoshima with a letter about the situation of Kyoto to Yoshinaga MATSUDAIRA, and went to Kyoto to exchange information with Seigan YANAGAWA and Senan KASUGA.

sen.j: 7月8日、斉彬は鹿児島城下天保山で薩軍の大軍事調練を実施した（兵を率いて東上するつもりであったともいわれる）が、7月16日、急逝した。
sen.e: On July 8, Saiakira operated large-scale military training for Satsu-gun (Satsuma Army) at Mt. Tempo near the Kagoshima Castle (also said, he was going to the east capital, Tokyo with army) but, he died on July 16th.

On July 8, Saiakira operated a large-scale military training grounds for Satsu-gun (Satsuma Army) at Mt. Tempo near Kagoshima Castle (it is also said that he was going to the east capital, Tokyo, with an army), but he died on July 16th.

On July 8, Saiakira operated a large-scale military training grounds for Satsu-gun (Satsuma Army) at Mt. Tempo near Kagoshima Castle (it is also said that he was going to the east capital, Tokyo, with an army), but he died on July 16th.

sen.j: 7月19日、斉彬の弟島津久光の子島津忠義が家督相続し、久光が後見人となったが、藩の実権は斉彬の父斉興が握った。
sen.e: On July 19, brother of Saiakira, child of Hisamitu SIMAZU was succeeded to a family, and Hisamitu became a guardian but, Noriaki who is a father of Saiakira hold the real power of domain.
sen.cmt: 島津忠義→Tadayoshi SHIMAZU[http://kotobank.jp/word/島津忠義]
sen.e: On July 19, the brother of Saiakira, and child of Hisamitu SIMAZU succeeded to a family, and Hisamitu became his guardian, but Noriaki, who was a father of Saiakira's, held the real power in the domain.
sen.cmt: as above, comma BEFORE coordinating conjuction. IMPORTANT: does this mean that he had more than one adoptive father in the clan system, or should it say THE father of Saiakira…?
sen.e: On July 19, the brother of Saiakira, and child of Hisamitu SIMAZU succeeded to a family, and Hisamitu became his guardian, but Noriaki, who was the father of Saiakira, held the real power in the domain.
sen.cmt: a father of Saiakira's→the father of Saiakira

sen.j: 安政5年7月27日、京都で斉彬の訃報を聞き、殉死しようとしたが、月照らに説得されて、斉彬の遺志を継ぐことを決意した。
sen.e: On July 27, 1858, he heard about Saiakira's death, and tried to follow Saiakira to the grave, but Gessho persuaded him and decided to succeed the wish of Saiakira.
On July 27, 1858, he heard about Saiakira's death, and tried to follow Saiakira to the grave, but Gessho persuaded him against it, and he decided to follow Saiakira's advice.
sen.cmt: changed phrasing (significantly) viz. "he decided to follow Saiakira's advice." articles, grammar added natural phrases like "against it"
sen.e: On July 27, 1858, he heard about Saiakira's death, and tried to follow Saiakira to the grave, but Gessho persuaded him against it, and he decided to follow Saiakira's advice.

sen.j: 8月、近衛家から託された孝明天皇の内勅を水戸藩・尾張藩に渡すため江戸に赴いたが、できずに京都へ帰った。
sen.e: In August, he went to Edo to bring a secret Imperial command of Emperor Komei to domain of Mito and domain of Owari, which was entrusted from Konoe Family, but he couldn't do it and returned to Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 孝明天皇→Emperor Komei [http://spysee.jp/孝明天皇], 水戸藩→Domain of Mito[http://100.yahoo.co.jp/detail/水戸藩/], 尾張藩→domain of Owari[http://100.yahoo.co.jp/detail/尾張藩/]
sen.e: In August, he went to Edo to bring a secret Imperial command of Emperor Komei to the domain of Mito and the domain of Owari, which was entrusted to the Konoe Family, but he was unable to do so and returned to Kyoto.
sen.cmt: unsure of the preposition that should be used.. "by"? "from" --> to the
sen.e: In August, he went to Edo to bring a secret Imperial command of Emperor Komei to the domain of Mito and the domain of Owari, which was entrusted to the Konoe Family, but he was unable to do so and returned to Kyoto.

sen.j: 以後9月中旬頃まで諸藩の有志および有馬新七・有村俊斎・伊地知正治らと大老井伊直弼を排斥し、それによって幕政の改革をしようとはかった。
sen.e: After that until middle of September, he rejected Naosuke II of chief minister with volunteers of many domains, Shinshichi ARIMA and Masaharu IJICH, and tried to reform Bakufu feudal government.
sen.cmt: 有馬新七→Shinshichi ARIMA[http://kotobank.jp/word/有馬新七]伊地知正治→Masaharu IJICHI[http://kotobank.jp/word/伊地知正治]
sen.e: After that until middle of September, he ignored Naosuke II of chief minister with volunteers of many domains, Shinshichi ARIMA and Masaharu IJICH, and tried to reform Bakufu feudal government.
sen.cmt: Once again, unsure of what to do with "of" here as the relationship between Naosuke and the chief minister is unclear to me
sen.e: After that until middle of September, he ignored Naosuke II of chief minister with volunteers of many domains, Shinshichi ARIMA and Masaharu IJICH, and tried to reform Bakufu feudal government.

sen.j: しかし、9月9日に梅田雲浜が捕縛され、尊攘派に危機が迫ったので、近衛家から保護を依頼された月照を伴って伏見へ脱出し、伏見からは有村俊斎らに月照を託し、大坂を経て鹿児島へ送らせた。
sen.e: But on September 9, Unpin UMEDA was arrested, and the crisis was coming close to the group of advocating reverence for the Emperor and the expulsion of foreigners, he escaped with Gessho who had entrusted the protection from Konei family, after Fushimi, he entrusted Gessho to Shunsai ARIMURA and sent them from Osaka to Kagoshima.

But on September 9, Unpin UMEDA was arrested, and the crisis was coming to a head for the group advocating reverence for the Emperor and the expulsion of foreigners, and he escaped with Gessho who had been entrusted with protection by Konei family; after Fushimi, he entrusted Gessho to Shunsai ARIMURA and sent them from Osaka to Kagoshima.
sen.cmt: coming to a close is inaccurate given the political situation. Added "and" (coordinating conjunction) etc.
sen.e: But on September 9, Unpin UMEDA was arrested, and the crisis was coming to a head for the group advocating reverence for the Emperor and the expulsion of foreigners, and he escaped with Gessho who had been entrusted with protection by Konei family; after Fushimi, he entrusted Gessho to Shunsai ARIMURA and sent them from Osaka to Kagoshima.

sen.j: 9月16日、再び上京して諸志士らと挙兵をはかったが、捕吏の追及が厳しいため、9月24日に大坂を出航し、下関経由で10月6日に鹿児島へ帰った。
sen.e: On September 16, he came to Kyoto again and tried to raise an army with men of noble ideals, but the investigation from Hori (officer to capture a criminal) was very strict, so they left Osaka in September 24, and returned to Kagoshima on October 6, via Simonoseki.

On September 16, he came to Kyoto again and tried to raise an army with other men of noble ideals, but the investigations of the Hori (officers who capture criminals) was very strict, so they left Osaka in September 24, and returned to Kagoshima on October 6, via Simonoseki.
sen.cmt: not sure if Hori is a group or man.
sen.e: On September 16, he came to Kyoto again and tried to raise an army with other men of noble ideals, but the investigations of the Hori (officers who capture criminals) was very strict, so they left Osaka in September 24, and returned to Kagoshima on October 6, via Simonoseki.

sen.j: 捕吏の目を誤魔化すために藩命で西郷三助と改名させられた。
sen.e: He had to change his name to Sansuke SAIGO to cheat on the officer of prisoner for command of domain.
He had to change his name to Sansuke SAIGO to deceive the officer of prisoners for command of the domain.
sen.cmt: cheat on --> deceive. Prisoner --> prisoners added "the" consider changing officer of prisoners.
sen.e: He had to change his name to Sansuke SAIGO to deceive the officer of prisoners for command of the domain.

sen.j: 11月、平野国臣に伴われて月照が鹿児島に来たが、幕府の追及を恐れた藩当局は月照らを東目（日向国）へ追放すること（これは道中での切り捨てを意味していた）に決定した。
sen.e: In November, Gessho came to Kagoshima with Kuniomi HIRANO, but the domain authorities that was afraid of investigation from government decided to banish Gessho and others to Higashime (Hyuga-no-kuni) (it means they deserted on the way)
sen.cmt: 平野国臣→Kuniomi HIRANO[http://kotobank.jp/word/平野国臣]
sen.e: In November, Gessho came to Kagoshima with Kuniomi HIRANO, but the domain authorities that were afraid of investigation by the government decided to banish Gessho and others to Higashime (Hyuga-no-kuni) (this means they were deserted in the middle).
sen.cmt: from --> by the on the way --> in the middle … consider "betrayed" instead of deserted.
sen.e: In November, Gessho came to Kagoshima with Kuniomi HIRANO, but the domain authorities that were afraid of investigation by the government decided to banish Gessho and others to Higashime (Hyuga Province) (this means they were deserted in the middle).

sen.j: 月照・平野らとともに乗船したが、前途を悲観して、16日夜半、竜ヶ水沖で月照とともに入水した。
sen.e: He got on the boat with Gesshu and Hirano but, he was pessimistic about future, late night in 16th, he drowns himself into ocean with Gesshu at Ryugamizu-oki offing.
He got on the boat with Gesshu and Hirano but, he was pessimistic about his future, and late at night on the 16th, he drowned himself in ocean with Gesshu at an offing in Ryugamizu-oki.
sen.cmt: this makes more clear what an offing is.
sen.e: He got on the boat with Gesshu and Hirano but, he was pessimistic about his future, and late at night on the 16th, he drowned himself in ocean with Gesshu at an offing in Ryugamizu-oki.

sen.j: すぐに平野らが救助したが、月照は死亡し、西郷は運良く蘇生したが、回復に一ヶ月近くかかった。
sen.e: Hirano rescued them quickly but Gesshu was dead, Saigo was survived luckily but it took a month to recover.
Hirano rescued them quickly, but Gesshu had already died; luckily Saigo survived but it took him a month to recover.
sen.cmt: was survived luckily --> X just survived, phrasing, etc.
sen.e: Hirano rescued them quickly, but Gesshu had already died; luckily Saigo survived but it took him a month to recover.

sen.j: 藩当局は死んだものとして扱い、幕府の捕吏に西郷と月照の墓を見せたので、捕吏は月照の下僕重助を連れて引き上げた。
sen.e: The authorities of domain settled as death, and showed the graves for Saigo and Gesshu to the officer of prisoner, the officer of prisoner took footman and Jusuke of Gesshu and left.

The authorities of the domain treated them as dead, and showed them the graves of Saigo and Gesshu to the officer of prisoners, and the officer of prisoners took the footman and Jusuke of Gesshu, and left.
sen.cmt: changed the unintelligible bits to good English, e.g. "settled as death" --> X
sen.e: The authorities of the domain treated them as dead, and showed them the graves of Saigo and Gesshu to the officer of prisoners, and the officer of prisoners took the footman and Jusuke of Gesshu, and left.

sen.j: 12月、藩当局は、幕府の目から隠すために西郷の職を免じ、奄美大島に潜居させることにした、12月末日、菊池源吾（熊本の菊池氏を祖としていたので、吾が源は菊池なりという意で付けたと云われる。
sen.e: In December, the authorities of domain ordered to Saigo to stay in Amamioshima to avoid from government's eyes, and end of December, Gengo KIKUCHI named himself and it means, my origin is the Kikuchi, because he had a forefather Mr. Kikuchi.

In December, the authorities of domain ordered to Saigo to stay in Amamioshima to avoid the government's notice, and at the end of December, he named himself Gengo KIKUCHI, which means 'my origin is the Kikuchi,' because he had a forefather named Kikuchi.

In December, the authorities of domain ordered to Saigo to stay in Amamioshima to avoid the government's notice, and at the end of December, he named himself Gengo KIKUCHI, which means 'my origin is the Kikuchi,' because he had a forefather of the Kikuchi clan in Kumamoto.

sen.j: 公式には西郷三助）と変名して、鹿児島から山川郷へ出航した。
sen.e: Renamed Sansuke Saigo officially, and left from Kagoshima to Yamagawa-go.
He was officially renamed Sansuke Saigo, and left Kagoshima to go to Yamagawa port.
He was officially renamed Sansuke SAIGO, and left Kagoshima to go to Yamagawa port.

sen.j: 安政6年（1859年）1月4日、伊地知正治・大久保利通・伊地知貞馨等に後事を託して山川港を出航し、七島灘を乗り切り、名瀬を経て、1月12日に潜居地の奄美大島龍郷村阿丹崎に着いた。
sen.e: January 4, 1859, he entrusted Masaharu IJICHI, Toshimichi OKUBO and Sadaka ICHIJI with future affairs, and left Yamagawa port then rode out Shichito-nada ocean area through Naze and arrived at the place of refuge Atansaki, Tatsugo-mura, Amamioshima.
sen.cmt: 伊地知貞馨→Sadaka IJICHI[http://kotobank.jp/word/伊地知貞馨]
sen.e: January 4, 1859, he entrusted Masaharu IJICHI, Toshimichi OKUBO and Sadaka ICHIJI with future affairs, and left Yamagawa port, then rode out to the Shichito-nada ocean area through Naze and arrived at the place of refuge called Atansaki, Tatsugo-mura, Amamioshima.

January 4, 1859, he entrusted Masaharu IJICHI, Toshimichi OKUBO and Sadaka IJICHI with future affairs, and left Yamagawa port, then rode out to the Shichito-nada ocean area through Naze and arrived at the place of refuge called Atansaki, Tatsugo-mura, Amamioshima on January, 12.

sen.j: 島では美玉新行の空家を借り、自炊した。
sen.e: He rented an empty house at Shingyo, MITAYA, and cooked his own food.
sen.cmt: 美玉新行→Shingyo MITAMA (美玉新行)[定訳不明]
sen.e: He rented an empty house at Shingyo, MITAYA, and cooked his own food.
He rented an empty house at Shingyo MITAYA, and cooked his own food.

sen.j: 間もなく重野安繹の慰問を受け、以後、大久保利通・税所篤（喜三左衛門）・吉井友実・有村俊斎・堀仲左衛門らからの書簡や慰問品が何度も送られ、西郷も返書を出して情報入手につとめた。
sen.e: And soon, Yasutsugu SHIGENO visited him, after that, Toshimichi OKUBO, Atsushi (Kizaemon) SAISHO, Tomomi YOSHII, Shunsai ARIMURA and Chuzaemon HORI sent him letters and comforts many times, also Saigo replayed letter to them to try to get information.

And soon, Yasutsugu SHIGENO visited him, after that, Toshimichi OKUBO, Atsushi (Kizaemon) SAISHO, Tomomi YOSHII, Shunsai ARIMURA and Chuzaemon HORI sent him letters and comforts many times, also Saigo sent letters replying to them to try to get information.

And soon, Yasutsugu SHIGENO visited him, after that, Toshimichi OKUBO, Atsushi (Kizaemon) SAISHO, Tomomi YOSHII, Shunsai ARIMURA and Chuzaemon HORI sent him letters and comforts many times, also Saigo sent letters replying to them to try to get information.

sen.j: この間、11月、龍家の一族、佐栄志の娘とま（のち愛加那と改める）を島妻とした。
sen.e: While that time, in November, The Ryu family clan, Toma who is a daughter of Saeishi became his wife in island.
sen.cmt: 佐栄志→Saeishi (佐栄志)[定訳不明]
sen.e: At that time, in November, Toma of the The Ryu family clan, who was a daughter of Saeishi, became his wife on the island.
sen.cmt: verb tenses, added "of" … capitalization, set off relative clause with commas.
sen.e: At that time, in November, Toma (later changed Aikana) of the the Ryu family clan, who was a daughter of Saeishi, became his wife on the island.
sen.cmt: The→the愛加那→Aikana 「（のち愛加那と改める）」訳抜け。

sen.j: 当初、扶持米は6石であったが、万延元年には12石に加増された。
sen.e: At that time his Fuchimai (salary rice) was six seki, but in 1860, it increased to twelve seki.
At that time his Fuchimai (salary paid in rice) was six seki, but in 1860, it increased to twelve seki.
sen.cmt: salary paid in rice is better
sen.e: At that time his Fuchimai (salary paid in rice) was six seki, but in 1860, it increased to twelve seki.

sen.j: また留守家族にも家計補助のために藩主から下賜金が与えられた。
sen.e: Also he received imperial donation to absent family from the chief of domain for supporting family budget.
Also he received imperial monies paid to those lacking a family from the chief of the domain as a support to the family budget.
sen.cmt: for --> as a.. To donation --> monies, other phrasing and diction changes.
sen.e: Also he received imperial monies paid to those lacking a family from the chief of the domain as a support to the family budget.

sen.j: 来島当初は流人としての扱いを受け、孤独に苦しんだ。
sen.e: When he arrived at island, people treated him as an exile, he was distressed by loneliness.
When he arrived at island, people treated him as an exile, he was suffered due to his loneliness.
sen.cmt: distressed by loneliness --> suffered due to his loneliness
sen.e: When he arrived at island, people treated him as an exile, he was suffered due to his loneliness.

sen.j: しかし、島の子供3人の教育を依頼され、間切横目藤長から親切を受け、島妻を娶るにつれ、徐々に島での生活になじみ、万延元年（1860年）11月2日には西郷菊次郎が誕生した。
sen.e: But, he was asked to educate three kids in the island, also Fujinaga, Magiri-yokome's (officer for province) was kind to him, and having a wife, he became familiar to island's life, in November 2, 1860, Kikujiro SAIGO was born.
sen.cmt: 西郷菊次郎→Kikujiro SAIGO[http://kotobank.jp/word/西郷菊次郎]
sen.e: However, he was asked to educate three kids on the island, also Fujinaga, Magiri-yokome's (officer of the province) was kind to him, and having a wife, he became accustomed to life on the island, and on November 2, 1860, Kikujiro SAIGO was born.
sen.cmt: but--> however, made the phrasing better "to island's life" etc. is clearly wrong.
sen.e: However, he was asked to educate three kids on the island, also Fujinaga, Magiri-yokome's (officer of the province) was kind to him, and having a wife, he became accustomed to life on the island, and on November 2, 1860, Kikujiro SAIGO was born.

sen.j: 文久元年（1861年）9月、三弟の竜庵が表茶坊主から還俗して信吾と名乗った。
sen.e: In September, 1861, the third brother Ryuan returned to secular life from Omote Chabozu (tea-server who taking cares of Daimyo) and named Shingo.
In September, 1861, the third brother Ryuan returned to secular life from his post as Omote Chabozu (a tea-server who takes care of a Daimyo) and was named Shingo.
sen.cmt: changed grammar, phrasing of parenthetical statement; added "was"
sen.e: In September, 1861, the third brother Ryuan returned to secular life from his post as Omote Chabozu (a tea-server who takes care of a Daimyo) and was named Shingo.

sen.j: 11月、見聞役木場伝内と知り合った（のち木場は大坂留守居役・京都留守居役となり、西郷を助けた）。
sen.e: In November, he met Dennai KOBA who had a job to see and hear things (later, KOBA helped SAIGO as Osaka Rusui-yaku officer/ Kyoto Rusui-yaku officer.
In November, he met Dennai KOBA whose duty it was to stay informed (later, KOBA helped SAIGO as Osaka Rusui-yaku officer/ Kyoto Rusui-yaku officer.
sen.cmt: see and hear things --> X http://eow.alc.co.jp/見聞/UTF-8/
sen.e: In November, he met Dennai KOBA whose duty it was to stay informed (later, Koba helped Saigo as Osaka Rusui-yaku officer/ Kyoto Rusui-yaku officer.

tit.e: Around the time of Teradaya-sodo (oppression of Sonjo group)
Around the time of the Teradaya-sodo (oppression of Sonjo group)
Around the time of the Teradaya-sodo (oppression of Sonjo group)

sen.j: 文久元年10月、久光は公武周旋に乗り出す決意をして要路重臣の更迭を行ったが、京都での手づるがなく、小納戸役の大久保・堀次郎らの進言で西郷に召還状を出した。
sen.e: In October, 1861, Hisamatsu decided to go into procurement of court noble and Samurai and reshuffled the main retainers on important roads, but it was no connection in Kyoto, so Okubo and Horijiro who were the Konando-yaku (job to do shogun's personal care) advised sent a letter of recall to Saigo.

In October, 1861, Hisamatsu decided to attempt to procure a position as a court noble or Samurai and reorganized the retainers in important ways, but he lacked a connection in Kyoto, so Okubo and Horijiro who were the Konando-yaku (the position charged with the shogun's personal care) advised sending a letter of recall to Saigo.
sen.cmt: Quite bad translation so hard to make sense of. Please verify my corrections
sen.e: In October, 1861, Hisamatsu decided to attempt to procure a position as a court noble or Samurai and reorganized the retainers in important ways, but he lacked a connection in Kyoto, so Okubo and Horijiro who were the Konando-yaku (the position charged with the shogun's personal care) advised sending a letter of recall to Saigo.

sen.j: 西郷は11月21日に召還状を受け取ると、世話になった人々への挨拶を済ませ、愛加那の生活が立つようにしたのち、文久2年（1862年）1月14日に阿丹崎を出帆し、口永良部島・枕崎を経て2月12日に鹿児島へ着いた。
sen.e: After Saigo received a letter of recall, he went to the greeting to the people who took care of him, and after get ready for the life of Aigana, he sailed from Adanzaki went through Kuichi-no-Erabu-jima/ Makurazaki and arrived to Kagoshima on February 2.
sen.cmt: 口永良部島→Kuchi-no-Erabu-jima island[http://kotobank.jp/word/口永良部島]
sen.e: After Saigo received this letter of recall, he went to the greet the people who took care of him, and after getting ready for the life in Aigana, he sailed from Adanzaki went through Kuichi-no-Erabu-jima/ Makurazaki and arrived to Kagoshima on February 2.
sen.cmt: I am pretty sure Aigana is a place to which he went.. Thus IN
sen.e: After Saigo received this letter of recall, he went to the greet the people who took care of him, and after getting ready for the life of Aikana, he sailed from Adanzaki went through Kuichi-no-Erabu-jima/ Makurazaki and arrived to Kagoshima on February 12.
sen.cmt: in Aigana→of Aikana [is the name of Saigo's wife, not a place... ]February 2→February 12

sen.j: 2月15日、生きていることが幕府に発覚しないように西郷三助から大島三右衛門（大島に三年住んでいたという洒落）と改名した。
sen.e: On February 15, he changed his name from Sansuke SAIGO to Sanemon OSHIMA to avoid the discovery from the government.
On February 15, he changed his name from Sansuke SAIGO to Sanemon OSHIMA to avoid discovery by the government.
On February 15, he changed his name from Sansuke SAIGO to Sanemon OSHIMA to avoid discovery by the government.

sen.j: 同日、久光に召されたが、久光が無官で、斉彬ほどの人望が無いことを理由に上京すべきでないと主張したので、久光の不興を買った。
sen.e: Same day, he had called up from Hisamitsu but, Hisamatsu doesn't have good position and doesn't have popularity like Saiakira, these of the reason, he shouldn't come to Kyoto, so Hisamatsu was indignant at him.

That same day, he had been called on by Hisamitsu, but Hisamatsu did not have good position or popularity like Saiakira, and for these reasons, he did not go to Kyoto, so Hisamatsu became indignant to him.
sen.cmt: contraction is too colloquial..(NOTE EVERY CONTRACTION WAS REMOVED, BUT NOT ALWAYS MARKED.) improved phrasin (these of reason, etc. clearly wrong)
sen.e: That same day, he had been called on by Hisamitsu, but Hisamatsu did not have good position or popularity like Saiakira, and for these reasons, he did not go to Kyoto, so Hisamatsu became indignant to him.

sen.j: 一旦は同行を断ったが、大久保の説得で上京を承諾し、旧役に復した。
sen.e: Once he declined to coming with but, Okubo persuaded him and agreed to coming Kyoto and he came back to the former position.
At first he declined the invitation, but Okubo persuaded him and he agreed to go to Kyoto, and he resumed his former position.
sen.cmt: "declined to coming with" --> XX "declind the invitation" phrasing, grammar.
sen.e: At first he declined the invitation, but Okubo persuaded him and he agreed to go to Kyoto, and he resumed his former position.

sen.j: 3月13日、下関で待機する命を受けて、村田新八を伴って先発した。
sen.e: On March 3, he received an order to go to Shimonoseki with Shinpachi MURATA and started first.
sen.cmt: 村田新八→Shimpachi MURATA[http://kotobank.jp/word/村田新八]
sen.e: On March 3, he received an order to go to Shimonoseki with Shinpachi MURATA, and made his first departure.
sen.cmt: 先発した。->made his first departure. Not sure if this is the best way to translate this.
sen.e: On March 13, he received an order to go to Shimonoseki with Shinpachi MURATA, and made his first departure.

sen.j: 下関の白石正一郎宅で平野国臣から京大坂の緊迫した情勢を聞いた西郷は、3月22日、村田新八・森山新蔵を伴い大坂へ向けて出航し、29日に伏見に着き、激派志士たちの京都焼き討ち・挙兵の企てを止めようと試みた。
sen.e: Saigo heard about tense situation in Kyo-Osaka from Kuniomi HIRANO at residence of Ichiro SHIRAISHI in Shimonoseki, on March 22, he left a port to Osaka with Shinpachi MURATA and Shinzo MORIYAMA, and arrived at Fushimi on 29th, and they tried to stop the plan of the extremist patriot which burns Kyoto and raising an army.
sen.cmt: 森山新蔵→Shinzo MORIYAMA[http://kotobank.jp/word/森山新蔵]
sen.e: Saigo heard about the tense situation in Kyo-Osaka from Kuniomi HIRANO at the residence of Ichiro SHIRAISHI in Shimonoseki, and on March 22, he left via port to Osaka with Shinpachi MURATA and Shinzo MORIYAMA, and arrived at Fushimi on 29th, and they tried to stop the plans of extremist patriots who were to burn Kyoto and were raising an army.
sen.cmt: I am not sure if Kyoto actually burned based on this sentence. If it did, please alter to who burned Kyoto
sen.e: Saigo heard about the tense situation in Kyo-Osaka from Kuniomi HIRANO at the residence of Ichiro SHIRAISHI in Shimonoseki, and on March 22, he left via port to Osaka with Shinpachi MURATA and Shinzo MORIYAMA, and arrived at Fushimi on 29th, and they tried to stop the plans of extremist patriots who were to burn Kyoto and were raising an army.

sen.j: しかし、4月6日、姫路に着いた久光は、西郷が待機命令を破ったこと、堀次郎・海江田信義から西郷が志士を煽動していると報告を受けたことから激怒し、西郷・村田・森山に捕縛命令を出した。
sen.e: But on April 6, Hisamitsu who arrived at Himeji was enraged that Saigo broke the standing order and also heard Saigo stirred up the patriots from Horijiro and Nobuyoshi KAIEDA, and gave Saigo, Murata and Morimura the order of command of capture.

But on April 6, Hisamitsu who arrived at Himeji, was enraged that Saigo disobeyed the standing order given to him, and also heard Saigo stirred up the patriots from Horijiro and Nobuyoshi KAIEDA, and ordered the capture of Saigo, Murata and Morimura.

But on April 6, Hisamitsu who arrived at Himeji, was enraged that Saigo disobeyed the standing order given to him, and also heard Saigo stirred up the patriots from Horijiro and Nobuyoshi KAIEDA, and ordered the capture of Saigo, Murata and Morimura.

sen.j: 捕縛された西郷らは10日、鹿児島へ向けて船で護送された。
sen.e: Saigo and others who was captured transported to Kagoshima on 10th.
Saigo and others who were captured were transported to Kagoshima on the 10th.
Saigo and others who were captured were transported to Kagoshima on the 10th.

sen.j: 一方、浪士鎮撫の朝旨を受けた久光は、伏見の寺田屋に集結している真木保臣・有馬新七らの激派志士を鎮撫するため、4月23日に奈良原繁・大山格之助（大山綱良）らを寺田屋に派遣した。
sen.e: Otherwise, Hisamitsu who received the Imperial palace's command to suppress master less samurai sent Shigeru NARA and Kakunosuke OYAMA (Tsunayoshi OYAMA) to Teradaya on April 23, to quell the extremist patriot, Yasuomi MAKI, and Sinshichi ARIMA and others who gathered in Teradaya in Fushimi.
sen.cmt: 真木保臣→Yasuomi MAKI[http://kotobank.jp/word/真木保臣]奈良原繁→Shigeru NARA[http://kotobank.jp/word/奈良原繁]→Shigeru NARAHARA[http://kotobank.jp/word/奈良原繁]大山格之助（大山綱良）→Kakunosuke OYAMA (Tsunayoshi OYAMA)[http://kotobank.jp/word/大山綱良]
sen.e: Otherwise, Hisamitsu who received the Imperial palace's command to suppress masterless samurai sent Shigeru NARA and Kakunosuke OYAMA (Tsunayoshi OYAMA) to Teradaya on April 23, to quell the extremist patriots, such as Yasuomi MAKI, and Sinshichi ARIMA and others who gathered in Teradaya in Fushimi.

Otherwise, Hisamitsu who received the Imperial Palace's command to suppress masterless samurai sent Shigeru NARAHARA and Kakunosuke OYAMA (Tsunayoshi OYAMA) to Teradaya on April 23, to quell the extremist patriots, such as Yasuomi MAKI, and Sinshichi ARIMA and others who gathered in Teradaya in Fushimi.

sen.j: 奈良原らは激派を説得したが聞かれず、やむなく有馬新七ら8名を上意討ちにした（寺田屋騒動）。
sen.e: Naraoka and others persuaded the extremist patriot but they didn't listen, so they reluctantly killed eight offenders including Shinshichi ARIMA. (Terakoya riot)
Naraoka and others attempted to persuade the extremist patriots, but they did not yield, so they reluctantly killed eight of the offenders including Shinshichi ARIMA. (Terakoya riot)
Narahara and others attempted to persuade the extremist patriots, but they did not yield, so they reluctantly killed eight of the offenders including Shinshichi ARIMA. (Terakoya riot)

sen.j: この時に挙兵を企て、寺田屋、その他に分宿していた激派の中には三弟の信吾、従弟の大山巌（弥助）の外に篠原国幹・永山弥一郎なども含まれていた。
sen.e: At this time, they planed raise an army, and the third brother Shingo and cousin Iwao OYAMA (Yasuke) and also Kunimoto SHINOHARA and Yaichiro NAGAYAMA were the member of the extremist patriot who was stayed at Terakoya and other place.
sen.cmt: 篠原国幹→Kunimoto SHINOHARA[http://kotobank.jp/word/篠原国幹]永山弥一郎→Yaichiro NAGAYAMA[http://kotobank.jp/word/永山弥一郎]
sen.e: At this time, they planned to raise an army, and his third eldest brother Shingo and cousin Iwao OYAMA (Yasuke) along with Kunimoto SHINOHARA and Yaichiro NAGAYAMA were members of the extremist patriot group who stayed at Terakoya and other places.
sen.cmt: spacing, e phrasing altered to make it make sense.. Removed the, etc.
sen.e: At this time, they planned to raise an army, and his third eldest brother Shingo and cousin Iwao OYAMA (Yasuke) along with Kunimoto SHINOHARA and Yaichiro NAGAYAMA were members of the extremist patriot group who stayed at Terakoya and other places.

sen.j: 護送され山川港で待命中の6月6日、西郷は大島吉之助に改名させられ、徳之島へ遠島、村田新八は喜界島（鬼界ヶ島即ち薩摩硫黄島ではない。
sen.e: On June 6, when he was staying at Yamakwa port after the transport, Saigo had to renamed Kichinosuke OSHIMA and also was exiled to Tokuno-shima island, and Shinpachi MURATA was exiled to Kikai-jima island (it is not Kikai-ga-shima island, namely Satsuma Io-jima island).
sen.cmt: 喜界島→Kikai-jima island[http://kotobank.jp/word/喜界島]鬼界ヶ島→Kikai-ga-shima island[http://kotobank.jp/word/鬼界ヶ島]
sen.e: On June 6, when he was staying at Yamakawa port after the transport, Saigo had to be renamed Kichinosuke OSHIMA and also was exiled to Tokuno-shima island, and Shinpachi MURATA was exiled to Kikai-jima island (it is not Kikai-ga-shima island, namely Satsuma Io-jima island).
sen.cmt: kwa -> kawa I would just write "Tokuno island,"
sen.e: On June 6, when he was staying at Yamakawa port after the transport, Saigo had to be renamed Kichinosuke OSHIMA and also was exiled to Tokuno-shima island, and Shinpachi MURATA was exiled to Kikai-jima island (it is not Kikai-ga-shima island, namely Satsuma Io-jima island).

sen.j: 村田新八「宇留満乃日記」参照）へ遠島が命ぜられた。
sen.e: Shinpachi MURATA (refer to 'Uruma no Nikki Diary') received the order of distant island.
sen.cmt: 宇留満乃日記→Uruma no Nikki Diary[http://www.pref.kagoshima.jp/reimeikan/josetsu/theme/gendai/toubaku/kgs04_s1_2.html]
sen.e: Shinpachi MURATA (refer to 'Uruma no Nikki Diary') was exiled to a distant island.
sen.cmt: added "exiled" etc. to make it natural
sen.e: Shinpachi MURATA (refer to 'Uruma no Nikki Diary') was exiled to a distant island.

sen.j: 未処分の森山新蔵は船中で自刃した。
sen.e: Shinzo MORIYAMA who didn't get punishment suicides with a sword.
Shinzo MORIYAMA was not punished, but committed suicide (with his sword).
sen.cmt: There is no way to include the sword without it sounding odd in English, but it is important in Japan, so I left it in there
sen.e: Shinzo MORIYAMA was not punished, but committed suicide (with his sword).

tit.j: 徳之島・沖永良部島遠流
tit.e: Onru (to be exiled to the farthest distant island) of Tokunoshima/ Okierabu-jima island
Onru (to be exiled to the farthest distant island) of Tokunoshima/ Okierabu-jima island
Onru (to be exiled to the farthest distant island) of Tokunoshima and Oki-no-erabujima island

sen.j: 文久2年6月11日、西郷は山川を出帆し、村田も遅れて出帆したが、向かい風で風待ちのために屋久島一湊で出会い、7、8日程風待ちをし、ともに一湊を出航、奄美へ向かった。
sen.e: On June 11, 1862, Saigo sailed from Yamakawa, and Murata also sailed after that, but they met at Isso, Yakushima for waiting for the wind by against a headwind, they waited for the wind for 7, 8 days and sailed from Isso together toward to Amami.

On June 11, 1862, Saigo sailed from Yamakawa, and Murata also sailed thereafter, but they met at Isso, Yakushima because they had to wait 7 to 8 days for the cessation of a headwind, and then sailed from Isso together toward Amami.
sen.cmt: for waiting for the wind, etc. other basic errors corrected.
sen.e: On June 11, 1862, Saigo sailed from Yamakawa, and Murata also sailed thereafter, but they met at Isso, Yakushima because they had to wait 7 to 8 days for the cessation of a headwind, and then sailed from Isso together toward Amami.

sen.j: 七島灘で漂流し、奄美を経て（以上は「宇留満乃日記」に詳しい）、やっと7月2日に西郷は徳之島湾仁屋に到着した。
sen.e: They drifted at Shichitonan, via Amami (details in 'Urumano diary'), and finally arrived at Jinya, Tokunoshima bay on July 2.
They sailed at Shichitonan via Amami (details are found in the 'Urumano diary'), and finally arrived at Jinya, Tokunoshima bay on July 2nd.
sen.cmt: 2 --> 2nd (THIS IS DONE MANY TIMES THROUGHOUT THE FILE) drifted --> sailed
sen.e: They sailed at Shichitonan via Amami (details are found in the 'Urumano diary'), and finally arrived at Jinya, Tokunoshima bay on July 2.

sen.j: 偶然にも、この渡海中の7月2日に愛加那が菊草（菊子）を生んだ。
sen.e: Incidentally, Akana delivered Kikuso (Kikuko) while sailing on July 2.
Incidentally, Akana delivered Kikuso (Kikuko) while sailing on July 2.
Incidentally, Akana delivered Kikuso (Kikuko) while sailing on July 2.

sen.j: 徳之島岡前の勝伝宅で落ち着いていた8月26日、徳之島来島を知らされた愛加那が大島から子供2人を連れて西郷のもとを訪れた。
sen.e: When he was relaxing at residence of Shoden of Okazen, Tokunoshima on August 26, Akana who heard about visiting Tokuno-shima Island visited Saigo with two children.
sen.cmt: 勝伝宅→residence of Shoden (勝伝)[定訳不明]
sen.e: When he was relaxing at the residence of Shoden of Okazen (on Tokunoshima) on August 26, Akana, who heard of their visit to Tokuno-shima Island, visited Saigo with two children.
sen.cmt: changed punctuation, etc., to decrease probability that sentence is misread; changed phrasing a bit.
sen.e: When he was relaxing at the residence of Shoden of Okazen (on Tokunoshima) on August 26, Akana, who heard of their visit to Tokuno-shima Island, visited Saigo with two children.

sen.j: 久しぶりの親子対面を喜んでから数日後、さらに追い打ちをかけるように沖永良部島へ遠島する命令が届いた。
sen.e: He was glad to be able to meet with his children after a long silence, and after several days of that, the order of the distance island to Okierabu-jima island was delivered that was like attacking him one after another.

He was glad to be able to meet his children after a long time apart and after several days together, the order that he be sent to the distant island of Okierabu-jima island was delivered was even more devastating to him.
sen.cmt: improved phrasing to make it sound more natural; wording, grammar.
sen.e: He was glad to be able to meet his children after a long time apart and after several days together, the order that he be sent to the distant island of Oki-no-erabujima island was delivered was even more devastating to him.

sen.j: これより前の7月下旬、鹿児島では二弟吉二郎、三弟信吾、四弟小兵衛が遠慮・謹慎などの処分を受け、西郷家の知行・家財が没収され、最悪の状態に追い込まれていた。
sen.e: Before end of July after that, the second brother Jiro, the third brother Shingo and the fourth brother Koheibei received punishment of Enryo (punishment to put on one's best behavior) and behaving himself, and his Chigyo fief and property was confiscated, it forced into serious situation.

Before the end of the next July, his second eldest brother Jiro, his third eldest brother Shingo and his fourth eldest brother Koheibei received the punishment of Enryo (the punishment of being put on one's best behavior), and the Chigyo fief and property of the SAIGO family was confiscated, and this forced them into a very serious situation.
sen.cmt: not sure what to do with this: "and behaving himself"
sen.e: Before the end of the next July, his second eldest brother Jiro, his third eldest brother Shingo and his fourth eldest brother Koheibei received the punishment of Enryo (the punishment of being put on one's best behavior), and the Chigyo fief and property of the Saigo family was confiscated, and this forced them into a very serious situation.

sen.j: 藩命で舟牢に入れられて、閏8月初め、徳之島岡前を出発し、14日に沖永良部島伊延（旧：ゆぬび・現：いのべ）に着いた。
sen.e: He was arrested by command of domain, intercalary beginning of August, he left Okazen, Tokunoshima, and arrived at Inobe (former "Yunubi"), Oki-no-erabujima island on 14th.
He was arrested by command of the domain, and at the beginning of August, he left Okazen, Tokunoshima, and arrived at Inobe (formerly "Yunubi"), Oki-no-erabujima island on 14th.
sen.cmt: in English we would probably drop "tokunoshima" the second time. We don't say atlanta, GA, every time, we say it once then just say altanta. Consider changing. Phrasing.
sen.e: He was arrested by command of the domain, and at the beginning of August, he left Okazen, Tokunoshima, and arrived at Inobe (formerly "Yunubi"), Oki-no-erabujima island on 14th.

sen.j: 当初、牢が貧弱で風雨にさらされたので、健康を害した。

At first, his health was ruined by exposure to the wind and rain under the poor conditions of the prison.
At first, his health was ruined by exposure to the wind and rain under the poor conditions of the prison.

sen.j: しかし、10月、間切横目土持政照が代官の許可を得て、自費で座敷牢を作ってくれたので、そこに移り住み、やっと健康を取り戻した。
sen.e: But in October, Masateru TSUCHIMOCHI of Magiri-yokome (officer for province) got an approval from local governor, and made zashikiro (room for confining criminals) by his money, then moved to there, finally he got back the health.

But in October, Masateru TSUCHIMOCHI of Magiri-yokome (officer for province) got approval from the local governor, and made a zashikiro (room for confining criminals) with his money, then moved him there, and he finally recovered his health.
sen.cmt: got back --> recovered. Is "officer for province" really yougo? No article?
sen.e: But in October, Masateru TSUCHIMOCHI of Magiri-yokome (officer for province) got approval from the local governor, and made a zashikiro (room for confining criminals) with his money, then moved him there, and he finally recovered his health.

sen.j: また、土持政照と一緒に酒を飲んでいる様子がこの島のサイサイ節という民謡に歌われている。

sen.j: この頃、本土では、薩摩の意見も取り入れ、文久2年（1862年）7月に松平慶永が政事総裁職、徳川慶喜が将軍後見職となり（文久の幕政改革）、閏8月に会津藩主松平容保が京都守護職、桑名藩主松平定敬が京都所司代となって、幕権に回復傾向が見られる一方、文久3年（1863年）5月に長州藩の米艦砲撃事件、8月に奈良五条の天誅組の乱と長州への七卿落ち（八月十八日の政変）、10月に生野の変など、開港に反対する攘夷急進派が種々の抵抗をして、幕権の失墜をはかっていた。
sen.e: At this time, in July 1862, Yoshinaga MATSUDAIRA became the president of political affairs, and Yoshinobu TOKUGAWA became the Shogun-kokenshoku office (reformation of shogunate administration in Bunkyu) that took in Satsuma's opinion also, in the main island, an intercalary year on August, Katamori MATSUDAIRA of the lord of the Aizu domain became Kyoto Shugoshoku Title and Sada'aki MATSUDAIRA of the lord of the Kuwana domain became Kyoto Shoshidai (local governor of Kyoto) athe power of Bakufu feudal government was showing a tendency to reconstruction,on the other hand, in May 1863, Choshu domain caused incident of gunfire to the North America's ship, and the Tenchugumi-no-ran War at Nara Gojo, and the seven nobles outrunning to Choshu (Coups of August eighteenth) were occurred on August, and Ikuno-no-Hen (Conspiracy of Ikuno) occurred on October, the radical Joi (principle of excluding foreigners) group who was against the open port put up several resistance to plan the blunder of the domain.
sen.cmt: 会津藩主→the lord of the Aizu domain[http://kotobank.jp/word/会津藩]松平容保→Katamori MATSUDAIRA[http://kotobank.jp/word/松平容保]京都守護職→Kyoto Shugoshoku Title[http://dic.yahoo.co.jp/dsearch?enc=UTF-8&p=京都守護職&dtype=0&dname=0na&stype=0&pagenum=1&index=05524404624700]松平定敬→Sada'aki MATSUDAIRA[http://kotobank.jp/word/松平定敬]八月十八日の政変→Coups of August eighteenth[http://kotobank.jp/word/8月18日の政変]生野の変→Ikuno-no-Hen (Conspiracy of Ikuno)[http://kotobank.jp/word/生野の変]
sen.e: At this time, in July 1862, Yoshinaga MATSUDAIRA became the president of political affairs, and Yoshinobu TOKUGAWA became the Shogun-kokenshoku officer (reformation of shogunate administration in Bunkyu) that took in Satsuma's opinion; also, on the main island, in an intercalary year on August, Katamori MATSUDAIRA of the lord of the Aizu domain attained the title of Kyoto Shugoshoku, and Sada'aki MATSUDAIRA of the lord of the Kuwana domain became Kyoto Shoshidai (the local governor of Kyoto), and the power of the Bakufu (feudal government) was showing an inclination to reconstruction, however in May 1863, the Choshu domain caused an incident in that gunfire at a North American ship was discharged and the Tenchugumi-no-ran War at Nara Gojo, and the seven nobles outrunning to Choshu (Coups of August eighteenth) occurred in August, and Ikuno-no-Hen (Conspiracy of Ikuno) occurred in October, and also the radical Joi (those who held to the principle of excluding foreigners) group, which was against opening the port, provided resistance several times to thward the plans of the domain.
sen.cmt: Mostly minor changes until the last clause, but consider changing "the seven nobles outrunning to Choshu" the word "outrunning" is not used correctly.
sen.e: At this time, in July 1862, Yoshinaga MATSUDAIRA became the president of political affairs, and Yoshinobu TOKUGAWA became the Shogun-kokenshoku officer (reformation of shogunate administration in Bunkyu) that took in Satsuma's opinion; also, on the main island, in an intercalary year on August, Katamori MATSUDAIRA of the lord of the Aizu domain attained the title of Kyoto Shugoshoku, and Sadaaki MATSUDAIRA of the lord of the Kuwana domain became Kyoto Shoshidai (the local governor of Kyoto), and the power of the Bakufu (feudal government) was showing an inclination to reconstruction, however in May 1863, the Choshu domain caused an incident in that gunfire at a North American ship was discharged and the Tenchugumi-no-ran War at Nara Gojo, and the seven nobles outrunning to Choshu (Coups of August eighteenth) occurred in August, and Ikuno-no-Hen (Conspiracy of Ikuno) occurred in October, and also the radical Joi (those who held to the principle of excluding foreigners) group, which was against opening the port, provided resistance several times to thward the plans of the domain.

sen.j: この情勢を量ると、秤は幕府・薩摩方に傾き、長州藩を中心とする反幕攘夷派勢力は徐々に軽くなりつつあったといえよう。
sen.e: As seen of this situation, the balance was tilted to the government/ Satuma, the radical Joi (principle of excluding foreigners) group that Choshu domain is the center was getting lighter gradually.

sen.e: All of this information shows that the balance of power was tilted in favor of the government/Satsuma, and the radical Joi (principle of excluding foreigners) group central to the Choshu domain was gradually decreasing in influence.

sen.j: もともと公武合体派とはいっても、天皇のもとに賢侯を集めての中央集権をめざす薩摩の思惑と将軍中心の中央集権をめざす幕府の思惑は違っていたが、薩英戦争で活躍した旧精忠組の発言力の増大と守旧派の失脚を背景に、薩摩流の公武周旋をやり直そうとした久光にとっては、京大坂での薩摩藩の世評の悪化と公武周旋に動く人材の不足が最大の問題であった。
sen.e: Even called the supporter for coalition of court noble and Samurai originally, but it was different from the thought of Satsuma which toward to the power into the center which gathered sages to the Emperor, and Hidemistu who tried to reorganized the procurement of court noble and Samurai as Satsuma style, as background of increasing influential voice of former Seichu-gumi organization which worked well at Satuei War and the downfall of old-guard crony, but the biggest problem was bad reputation of Satsuma domain, and short of people who work with procurement of court noble and Samurai,

It was even called the supporter of the coalition of court nobles and Samurai originally, but it was different from the thought of Satsuma which centralized power by gathering sages to the Emperor, and Hidemitsu, who tried to reorganize the procurement of court nobles and Samurai in the style of Satsuma used as background the increasingly influential voice of the former Seichu-gumi organization, which worked well at the Satsuei War and during the downfall of the old-guard cronies, but the biggest problems were the bad reputation of Satsuma domain, and being short of people who could work to procure court nobles and Samurai,

sen.e: It was even called the supporter of the coalition of court nobles and Samurai originally, but it was different from the thought of Satsuma which centralized power by gathering sages to the Emperor, and Hidemitsu, who tried to reorganize the procurement of court nobles and Samurai in the style of Satsuma used as background the increasingly influential voice of the former Seichu-gumi organization, which worked well at the Satsuei War and during the downfall of the old-guard cronies, but the biggest problems were the bad reputation of Satsuma domain, and being short of people who could work to procure court nobles and Samurai.

On March 4, he sailed from Kagoshima with Shinpachi MURATA, arrived to Kyoto on 14th, and he was appointed Gunbu-yaku commander on 19th.

sen.j: 京都に着いた西郷は薩摩が佐幕・攘夷派双方から非難されており、攘夷派志士だけではなく、世評も極めて悪いのに驚いた。
sen.e: Saigo was arrived Kyoto and blamed from both group which is Sabaku and Joi group (group of adherence to the shogunate and expulsion of the foreigners), and he was surprised that his reputation is extremely bad, not only from the patriot of Joi (principle of excluding foreigners) group.

Saigo arrived in Kyoto and was condemned by both the Sabaku and the Joi group (group of adherence to the shogunate and expulsion of the foreigners), and he was surprised that his reputation was very bad with both groups, not only with the patriot of Joi (principle of excluding foreigners) group.

Saigo arrived in Kyoto and was condemned by both the Sabaku and the Joi group (group of adherence to the shogunate and expulsion of the foreigners), and he was surprised that his reputation was very bad with both groups, not only with the patriot of Joi (principle of excluding foreigners) group.

sen.j: そこで、藩の行動原則を朝旨に遵（したが）った行動と単純化し、攘夷派と悪評への緩和策を採ることで、この難局を乗り越えようとした。
sen.e: There, he made it a rule to stay active, by the intention of Imperial court and more simply, and made a plan to moderate the bad reputation and patriot of Joi (principle of excluding foreigners) group to try to get over the difficulties.

And, he made it a rule to stay active due to the intention of Imperial court, and he made a plan to moderate his bad reputation and persuade the patriots of Joi (principle of excluding foreigners) group to try to get over their difficulties.

sen.e: And, he made it a rule to stay active due to the intention of Imperial court, and he made a plan to moderate his bad reputation and persuade the patriots of Joi (principle of excluding foreigners) group to try to get over their difficulties.

sen.j: この当時、攘夷派および世人から最も悪評を浴びていたのが、薩摩藩と外夷との密貿易であった。
sen.e: At that time, the worst reputation from Joi group and also people in general was smuggling with Satsuma domain and foreigner.
At that time, the point of greatest contention for the Joi group and also people in general was smuggling between the Satsuma domain and foreigners.
sen.cmt: phrasing … "point of greatest contention", etc; phrasing and diction.
sen.e: At that time, the point of greatest contention for the Joi group and also people in general was smuggling between the Satsuma Domain and foreigners.

sen.j: 文久3年（1863年）半ばに、米国南北戦争（1861年-1865年）により欧州の綿・茶が不足となり、日本綿・茶の買い付けが盛んに行なわれた結果、両品の日本からの輸出量が極端に増加した。
sen.e: In the middle of 1863, cotton and tea from Europe was insufficient by the Civil War (1861-1865), the result of purchasing of Japanese cotton and tea was prospered, both items export was extremely increased.

In the middle of 1863, cotton and tea from Europe was insufficient due to the American Civil War (1861-1865), and the result was that sales of Japanese cotton and tea was soared, and exportation of both items increased drastically.
sen.cmt: had to add a lot and rearragned to make this into an understandable sentence.
sen.e: In the middle of 1863, cotton and tea from Europe was insufficient due to the American Civil War (1861 - 1865), and the result was that sales of Japanese cotton and tea was soared, and exportation of both items increased drastically.

sen.j: このことから日本中の綿・茶値段は高騰し、薩摩藩の外夷との通商が物価高騰の原因であるとする風評ができたのである。
sen.e: That was the reason, Japanese cotton and tea price was raised and the rumor was caused from the trading with Satuma domain and foreigner.
Although this was the true reason for the high price of Japanese cotton and tea, the rumor was that it was caused by trading between Satsuma domain and foreigners.
Although this was the true reason for the high price of Japanese cotton and tea, the rumor was that it was caused by trading between Satsuma Domain and foreigners.

sen.j: 世人は物価の高騰を怒ったのであるが、攘夷派は攘夷と唱えながら外夷と通商していること自体を怒ったのである。
sen.e: People in general got angry about raising prices, but Joi group was angry about the trading itself with foreigner, even they said the exclusion of foreigners.
Most people were simply angry that the prices were higher, but the Joi group was angry about the trading with foreigners itself, they even suggested excluding foreigners as a rule.
sen.cmt: changed phrasing to make it sound natural, not broken englishy
sen.e: Most people were simply angry that the prices were higher, but the Joi group was angry about the trading with foreigners itself, they even suggested excluding foreigners as a rule.

sen.j: その結果、長州藩による薩摩藩傭船長崎丸撃沈事件、加徳丸事件が起きた。
sen.e: For that result, the incident of torpedoing Nagasakimaru, chartered ship of the Satsuma domain was occurred by Choshu domain, and occurred the incident of Katokumaru ship
For that reason, the incident of torpedoing the Nagasakimaru, a chartered ship of the Satsuma domain was perpetrated by the Choshu domain, and also the the incident of the Katokumaru ship occurred.
sen.cmt: for that result --> for that reason; occurred is good word choice; perpertrated has the connotation necessary, etc.
sen.e: For that reason, the incident of torpedoing the Nagasakimaru, a chartered ship of the Satsuma Domain was perpetrated by the Choshu Domain, and also the the incident of the Katokumaru ship occurred.

sen.j: こうして形成された薩摩藩への悪評（世論も大きな影響を持っていた）は薩摩藩の京都・大坂での活動に大きな支障となったので、西郷は6月11日に大坂留守居木場伝内に上坂中の薩摩商人の取締りを命じ、往来手形を持参していない商人らにも帰国するよう命じ、併せて藩内での取締りも強化し、藩命を以て大商人らを上坂させぬように処置した。
sen.e: The bad reputation which built up like that was the big interruption of activities of Satsuma domain in Kyoto and Osaka, Saigo was ordered Dennai KOBA of Osaka Rusui to regulated the merchant of Satsuma who is in Osaka on June 11, and he gave the order to merchants who doesn't have Orai-tegata (travel permit) have to go back also made the regulation strictly in the domain, and took measures to merchant not coming to Osaka by command of domain.

The bad reputation that the Satsuma domain had rested on things like this, and caused them no small interruption of their activities in Kyoto and Osaka. Saigo was ordered by Dennai KOBA of Osaka Rusui to regulate the activeity of the merchant of Satsuma who is in Osaka on June 11, and he gave the order to merchants who did not have Orai-tegata (travel permit) to go return to their points of origin, and also made strict regulations in the domain, and took measures against merchants coming to Osaka by command of domain.

The bad reputation that the Satsuma Domain had rested on things like this, and caused them no small interruption of their activities in Kyoto and Osaka, Saigo was ordered by Dennai KOBA of Osaka Rusui to regulate the activeity of the merchant of Satsuma who is in Osaka on June 11, and he gave the order to merchants who did not have Orai-tegata (travel permit) to go return to their points of origin, and also made strict regulations in the domain, and took measures against merchants coming to Osaka by command of domain.
sen.cmt: domain→Domain一原文一訳文のルールに従って、.→,スペース削除

sen.j: 4月、西郷は御小納戸頭取・一代小番に任命された。
sen.e: In April, Saigo was appointed to be O-konando-todori (chief of konandoshu, aside of Shogun)/ personal-to-a-person Koban, post (not inherited).
In April, Saigo was appointed to be O-konando-todori (chief of konandoshu, aside of Shogun)/ personal-to-a-person Koban, post (not inherited).
sen.cmt: here we have aside instead of aide, which I changed once above (in section 33). Since it appears here, to, it is prboably intentional. My purpose here is only to note this, but it should be changed either here or in 33. "personal-to-a-person" does not make grammatical sense.
sen.e: In April, Saigo was appointed to be O-konando-todori (chief of konandoshu, aside of Shogun)/ personal-to-a-person Koban, post (not inherited).

sen.j: 池田屋事件からまもない6月27日、朝議で七卿赦免の請願を名目とする長州兵の入京が許可された。
sen.e: In June 27, few days after incident of Ikedaya, the coming to capital of Choshu soldiers was approved at Imperial court that was the pretext of petition for the discharge of seven nobles.
On June 27, few days after the Ikedaya incident the Imperial court approved the Choshu soldiers coming to the capital, and that was the pretext for the petition of the discharge of the seven nobles.
sen.cmt: IMPORTANT--> the translator always says "in June XXth" etc; every instance of this has been changed. improved phrasing to make it sound more natural.
sen.e: On June 27, few days after the Ikedaya incident the Imperial Court approved the Choshu soldiers coming to the capital, and that was the pretext for the petition of the discharge of the seven nobles.

sen.j: これに対し、西郷は薩摩は中立して皇居守護に専念すべしとし、7月8日の徳川慶喜の出兵命令を小松清廉と相談のうえで断った。
sen.e: Against that, Saigo concentrated on guarding the Imperial Palace as a neutral position, and declined the offer of being a soldier of July 8, from Yshinobu TOKUGAWA by advice from Kiyokado KOMATSU.
Against that, Saigo concentrated on guarding the Imperial Palace as a neutral position, and declined the offer of a military post on July 8, from Yoshinobu TOKUGAWA by advice from Kiyokado KOMATSU.
sen.cmt: improved phrasing to make it sound more natural.
sen.e: Against that, Saigo concentrated on guarding the Imperial Palace as a neutral position, and declined the offer of a military post on July 8, from Yoshinobu TOKUGAWA by advice from Kiyokado KOMATSU.

sen.j: しかし、18日、長州勢（長門国・因幡国・備前国・浪人志士）が伏見・嵯峨・山崎の三方から京都に押し寄せ、皇居諸門で幕軍と衝突すると、西郷・伊地知正治らは乾御門で長州勢を撃退したばかりでなく、諸所の救援に薩摩兵を派遣して、長州勢を撃退した（禁門の変）。
sen.e: But, the Kyushu force (Nagato-no-kuni/ Inaba-no-kuni/ Bizen-no-kuni/ Ronin-shishi) surging to Kyoto from three different place which is Fushimi, Saga and Yamazaki on 18th, and collided with domain army at Imperial Palace gate, Saigo, Masaharu IJICHI and others repulsed Choshu force and also sent Satsuma army for rescue and repulsed Choshu force at many places. (Kimmon no Hen (Conspiracy of Kimmon)).
sen.cmt: 因幡国→Inaba-no-kuni[http://kotobank.jp/word/因幡国]備前国→Bizen-no-kuni[http://100.yahoo.co.jp/detail/備前国/]山崎→Yamazaki[http://dic.yahoo.co.jp/dsearch?enc=UTF-8&p=山崎&dtype=0&dname=0na&stype=0&pagenum=1&index=21646718565200]
sen.e: But, the Kyushu force (Nagato-no-kuni/ Inaba-no-kuni/ Bizen-no-kuni/ Ronin-shishi) surged to Kyoto from three different places, namely Fushimi, Saga and Yamazaki on the 18th, and met the domain army at the Imperial Palace gate, whereupon Saigo, Masaharu IJICHI and others repulsed the Choshu force and also sent Satsuma army for rescue operations and further repulsed Choshu force at many places. (Kimmon no Hen (Conspiracy of Kimmon)).
sen.cmt: again, many different stylistic changes, etc.
sen.e: But, the Choshu force (Nagato, Inaba and Bizen Province and Ronin-shishi) surged to Kyoto from three different places, namely Fushimi, Saga and Yamazaki on the 18th, and met the domain army at the Imperial Palace gate, whereupon Saigo, Masaharu IJICHI and others repulsed the Choshu force and also sent Satsuma army for rescue operations and further repulsed Choshu force at many places. (Kimmon no Hen (Conspiracy of Kimmon)).

sen.j: このとき、西郷は銃弾を受けて軽傷を負った。
sen.e: At that time, Saigo got injured hit by a bullet.
At that time, Saigo was injured hit by a bullet.
At that time, Saigo was injured hit by a bullet.

sen.j: この事変で西郷らがとった中立の方針は、長州や幕府が朝廷を独占するのを防ぎ、朝廷をも中立の立場に導いたのであるが、長州勢からは来島又兵衛・久坂玄瑞・真木和泉ら多く犠牲者が出て、長州の薩摩嫌いを助長し、「薩奸会賊」と呼ばれるようになった。
sen.e: The plan of neutral position that Saigo and others took for this incident was defend the exclusive possession of Imperial court from Choshu and government, and gave guidance to Imperial court to the neutral position, but it caused many casualties that was Matabe KIJIMA, Genzui KUSAKA and Izumi MAKI from Choshu force, that made Choshu aggravated dislike of Satsuma, and called 'Satsukan-kaizoku (to retaliate Satsuma and Aizu Domains)'.
sen.cmt: 来島又兵衛→Matabe KIJIMA[http://kotobank.jp/word/来島又兵衛]久坂玄瑞→Genzui KUSAKA[http://kotobank.jp/word/久坂玄瑞]
sen.e: The neutral stance that Saigo and others took during this incident was only to defend the Imperial court from exclusive possession by the Choshu, and gave guidance to Imperial court to the neutral position, but it caused many casualties in the Choshu force, and among them were Matabe KIJIMA, Genzui KUSAKA and Izumi MAKI, and this aggravated the Choshu dislike of the Satsuma, and caused the events known as the 'Satsukan-kaizoku (retaliation against the Satsuma and Aizu Domains)'.
sen.cmt: "and gave guidance to Imperial court to the neutral position," I do not understand the relation of this clause to the rest of the sentence.
sen.e: The neutral stance that Saigo and others took during this incident was only to defend the Imperial Court from exclusive possession by the Choshu, and gave guidance to Imperial Court to the neutral position, but it caused many casualties in the Choshu force, and among them were Matabe KIJIMA, Genzui KUSAKA and Izumi MAKI, and this aggravated the Choshu dislike of the Satsuma, and caused the events known as the 'Satsukan-kaizoku (retaliation against the Satsuma and Aizu Domains)'.

tit.e: Around the First conquest of Choshu
Around the time of the First conquest of Choshu
Around the time of the First conquest of Choshu

sen.j: 元治元年7月23日に長州藩追討の朝命（第一次長州征伐）が出、24日に徳川慶喜が西国21藩に出兵を命じると、この機に乗じて薩摩藩勢力の伸張をはかるべく、それに応じた。
sen.e: In July 23, 1864, the order of Imperial court (First conquest of Choshu) of attack Choshu was issued, and on 24th, Yoshinobu TOKUNAGA commanded to twenty-one domains of Saikoku for sending troops, and for this opportunity, planed to extend the power of Satsuma, and respond to that.

On July 23, 1864, the order of the Imperial court (First conquest of Choshu) to attack Choshu was issued, and on 24th, Yoshinobu TOKUNAGA commanded twenty-one domains of Saikoku to send troops, and Satsuma planned to respond to this order and extend its power.
sen.cmt: in --> on improved phrasing to make it sound more natural. Grammar
sen.e: On July 23, 1864, the order of the Imperial Court (First conquest of Choshu) to attack Choshu was issued, and on 24th, Yoshinobu TOKUNAGA commanded twenty-one domains of Saikoku to send troops, and Satsuma planned to respond to this order and extend its power.

sen.j: 8月、四国連合艦隊下関砲撃事件が起きた。
sen.e: In August, the Incident of gunfire at Shimonoseki of the four countries' combined fleet occurred.
In August, the Incident of gunfire at Shimonoseki of the four countries' combined fleet occurred.
In August, the Incident of gunfire at Shimonoseki of the four countries' combined fleet occurred.

sen.j: 次いで長州と四国連合艦隊の講和条約が結ばれ、幕府と四国代表との間にも賠償約定調印が交わされた。
sen.e: After that, Choshu and the four countries' combined fleet concluded a peace treaty, and government and representative of Shikoku had signed an indemnity contract.
After that, Choshu and the four countries' combined fleet concluded a peace treaty, and the government and a representative of Shikoku signed an indemnity contract.
After that, Choshu and the four countries' combined fleet concluded a peace treaty, and the government and a representative of Shikoku signed an indemnity contract.

sen.j: この間の9月中旬、西郷は大坂で勝海舟と会い、勝の意見を参考にして、長州に対して強硬策をとるのを止め、緩和策で臨むことにした。
sen.e: While this middle of September, Saigo met Kaishu in Osaka, he stopped taking strong measure against Choshu, and tried to moderate measure from referred to Kai's advice.
During the middle of September, Saigo met Kaishu in Osaka, he stopped strong measures from being taken against Choshu, and tried to implement moderate measures according to Kai's advice.
sen.cmt: totally changed the grammar to avoid misconstrual "topped taking strong measure against Choshu"
sen.e: During the middle of September, Saigo met Kaishu KATSU in Osaka, he stopped strong measures from being taken against Choshu, and tried to implement moderate measures according to Katsu's advice.

sen.j: 10月初旬、御側役・代々小番となり、大島吉之助（『詳説西郷隆盛年譜』によれば、この名は沖永良部島在島以来らしい）から西郷吉之助に改めた。
sen.e: In beginning of October, he became the O-sobayaku aside/ the Daidai-koban (successive title of koban army), and renamed Kichinosuke SAIGO from "Explication of Takamori SAIGO's chronicle" by Kichinosuke OSHIMA (this name was since stayed at Okierabu-jima island).

In the beginning of October, he became the O-sobayaku aside/ the Daidai-koban (successive title of koban army), and was renamed Kichinosuke SAIGO according to the "Explication of Takamori SAIGO's chronicle" by Kichinosuke OSHIMA (it seems he kept this name from his time on Okierabu-jima island forward).
sen.cmt: not sure if "successive title of the koban army" is right. Lots of minor changes.
sen.e: In the beginning of October, he became the O-sobayaku aside snd the Daidai-koban (successive title of koban army), and was renamed Kichinosuke SAIGO according to the "Explication of Takamori SAIGO's chronicle" by Kichinosuke OSHIMA (it seems he kept this name from his time on Oki-no-erabujima island forward).

sen.j: 10月12日、西郷は征長軍参謀に任命された。
sen.e: In October 12, he was appointed the Sambo of Seicho-gun (conquering army of Choshu).
In October 12, he was appointed the Sambo of Seicho-gun (conquering army of Choshu).
On October 12, he was appointed the Sanbo (staff officer) of Seicho-gun (conquering army of Choshu).
sen.cmt: In→On注釈補足Sambo→Sanboに変更しました。

sen.j: 24日、大坂で征長総督徳川慶勝にお目見えし、意見を具申したところ、長州処分を委任された。
sen.e: On 24th, he met Yoshikatsu TOKUNAGA of Sotoku of Seicho (governor conquering of Choshu), and he was entrusted of the punishment of Choshu because he gave an opinion.
sen.cmt: 徳川慶勝→Yoshikatsu TOKUGAWA[http://kotobank.jp/word/徳川慶勝]
sen.e: On the 24th, he met Yoshikatsu TOKUNAGA of Sotoku of Seicho (governor conquering of Choshu), and he was entrusted with the punishment of Choshu because he had expressed his opinion.
sen.cmt: gave --> expressed his of --> with; phrasing word choice prpositions, etc.
sen.e: On the 24th, he met Yoshikatsu TOKUNAGA of Sotoku of Seicho (governor conquering of Choshu), and he was entrusted with the punishment of Choshu because he had expressed his opinion.

sen.j: そこで、吉井友実・税所篤を伴い、岩国で長州方代表吉川監物と会い、長州藩三家老の処分を申し入れた。
sen.e: And he met Kenmotsu KIKKAWA who was representative of Choshu in Iwakuni with Tomomi YOSHII and Atsushi SAISHO, and proposed the punishment of three chief retainers of Choshu domain.
sen.cmt: 吉川監物→Yoshikawa Kambutsu duty→Kenmotsu KIKKAWA www.page.sannet.ne.jp/ytsubu/syougai5.htm
sen.e: Then he met Kenmotsu KIKKAWA, who was a representative of Choshu in Iwakuni, with Tomomi YOSHII and Atsushi SAISHO, and proposed the punishment of three chief retainers of the Choshu domain.
Then he met Kenmotsu KIKKAWA, who was a representative of Choshu in Iwakuni, with Tomomi YOSHII and Atsushi SAISHO, and proposed the punishment of three chief retainers of the Choshu Domain.

sen.j: 引き返して徳川慶勝に経過報告をしたのち、小倉に赴き、副総督松平茂昭に長州処分案と経過を述べ、薩摩藩総督島津久明にも経過を報告した。
sen.e: He returned and after reported the progress to Yoshikatsu TOKUGAWA, and went to Kokura to talk the plan of punishment of Choshu and progress to lieutenant governor Mochiaki MATSUDAIRA, and reported the progress to the governor of Satsuma domain Hisaaki SHIMAZU.
sen.cmt: 松平茂昭→Mochiaki MATSUDAIRA[http://kotobank.jp/word/松平茂昭]
sen.e: He returned and reported the progress to Yoshikatsu TOKUGAWA immediately thereafter, and went to Kokura to discuss the plan of punishment of Choshu, report the progress made to lieutenant governor Mochiaki MATSUDAIRA, and report the progress to the governor of Satsuma domain Hisaaki SHIMAZU.

He returned and reported the progress to Yoshikatsu TOKUGAWA immediately thereafter, and went to Kokura to discuss the plan of punishment of Choshu, report the progress made to lieutenant governor Mochiaki MATSUDAIRA, and report the progress to the governor of Satsuma Domain Hisaaki SHIMAZU.

sen.j: 結局、西郷の妥協案に沿って収拾がはかられ、12月27日、征長総督が出兵諸軍に撤兵を命じ、この度の征討行動は終わった。
sen.e: After all, the situation was controlled by Saigo's compromise plan, in December 27, the governor conquering of Choshu was commanded soldiers withdrew to sending troops, then finished conquest.
RETRANSLATE
sen.cmt: To correct this I would effectively have to retranslate it.
sen.e: After all, the situation was controlled by Saigo's compromise plan, on December 27, the governor conquering of Choshu was commanded soldiers withdrew to sending troops, then finished conquest.

sen.j: 収拾案中に含まれていた五卿処分も、中岡慎太郎らの奔走で、西郷の妥協案に従い、慶応元年（1865年）初頭に福岡藩の周旋で九州5藩に分移させるまで福岡で預かることで一応決着した。
sen.e: The action of five nobles which was included in control plan also follow to Saigo's compromise plan by effort from Shintaro NAKAOKA, in beginning of 1865, it was tentatively concluded to keep them in Fukuoka until sending them separately to five domains of Kyushu from mediation of domain of Fukuoka."

The action of five nobles, which was included in the control plan to follow Saigo's compromise plan stemmed from effort of Shintaro NAKAOKA, and in the beginning of 1865 it was tentatively concluded to keep the five nobles in Fukuoka until they were sent separately to five domains of Kyushu from by way of mediation of the domain of Fukuoka."
sen.cmt: tried to clarify what is going on as much as possible.
sen.e: The action of five nobles, which was included in the control plan to follow Saigo's compromise plan stemmed from effort of Shintaro NAKAOKA, and in the beginning of 1865 it was tentatively concluded to keep the five nobles in Fukuoka until they were sent separately to five domains of Kyushu from by way of mediation of the domain of Fukuoka."

tit.j: 第二次長州征伐と薩長同盟
tit.e: Second conquest of Choshu and Satsuma-Choshu Alliance
Second conquest of Choshu and the Satsuma-Choshu Alliance
Second conquest of Choshu and the Satsuma-Choshu Alliance

sen.j: 慶応元年1月中旬に鹿児島へ帰って藩主父子に報告を済ますと、人の勧めもあって、1月28日に家老座書役岩山八太郎直温の二女イト（絲子）と結婚した。
sen.e: In middle of January 1865, he returned to Kagoshima and finished report to father and child of the lord of domain, he married Ito (Itoko) who is the second daughter of Naoatsu (Yataro) IWAYAMA, the clerical of chief retainer's office on January 28 from people's suggestion.

In the middle of January 1865, he returned to Kagoshima and finished his report to the father and child of the lord of the domain, and he married Ito (Itoko) who was the second daughter of Naoatsu (Yataro) IWAYAMA, the cleric of the chief retainer's office, on January 28th on the suggestion of various people.

In the middle of January 1865, he returned to Kagoshima and finished his report to the father and child of the lord of the domain, and he married Ito (Itoko) who was the second daughter of Naoatsu (Yataro) IWAYAMA, the cleric of the chief retainer's office, on January 28th on the suggestion of various people.

sen.j: この後、前年から紛糾していた五卿移転とその待遇問題を周旋して、2月23日に待遇を改善したうえで太宰府天満宮の延寿王院に落ち着かせることでやっと収束させた。
sen.e: After that he mediated the removal of five nobles which was entangled since last year and the problem of treatment for that, on February 23, improved the treatment and settled at Enjuoin in Temmangu, Dazaifu and finally it was concluded.

After that he mediated the removal of the five nobles, which had been an arduous problem since the previous year, and worked on problems relating to their treatment, and on February 23 he improved their treatment and settled the matter at Enjuoin in Temmangu, Dazaifu and finally it was concluded.

After that he mediated the removal of the five nobles, which had been an arduous problem since the previous year, and worked on problems relating to their treatment, and on February 23 he improved their treatment and settled the matter at Enjuoin in Temmangu, Dazaifu and finally it was concluded.

sen.j: これと平行して大久保・吉井らとともに九州諸藩連合のために久留米藩・福岡藩などを遊説していたが、3月中旬に上京した。
sen.e: Equally with this, he canvassed to domain of Kurume and domain of Fukuoka for the alliance of Kyushu domains with Okubo and Yoshii, but came to Kyoto in middle of March.
Equally with this, he campaigned for the alliance of Kyushu domains with Okubo and Yoshii, to the domain of Kurume and the domain of Fukuoka, but went to Kyoto in middle of March.
Equally with this, he campaigned for the alliance of Kyushu domains with Okubo and Yoshii, to the domain of Kurume and the domain of Fukuoka, but went to Kyoto in middle of March.

sen.j: この頃幕府は武力で勅命を出させ、長州藩主父子の出府、五卿の江戸への差し立て、参勤交代の復活の3事を実現させるために、2老中に4大隊と砲を率いて上京させ、強引に諸藩の宮門警備を幕府軍に交替させようとしていたが、それを拒否する勅書と伝奏が所司代に下され、逆に至急将軍を入洛させるようにとの命が下された。
sen.e: At that time, the shogunate ordered the Imperial command by force, going to the capital of the father and son of domain of Choshu and sending five nobles to Edo, and sent two councilors to Kyoto with for battalions with guns to realize that revival of three things of Sankin-kotai (daimyo's alternate-year residence in Edo), and they forced to exchange the security of the Imperial Palace's gates of domain to shogunate army, but Shoshidai (local governor) ordered the bull and Denso (job title to relay messages of court's people to Emperor) to reject that, instead of that the order which sending general on urgent was issued.

At that time, the shogunate ordered an Imperial command by force, to go to the capital of the father and son of the domain of Choshu and to send five nobles to Edo, and sent two councilors to Kyoto with four battalions with guns to realize that revival of three things of Sankin-kotai (daimyo's alternate-year residence in Edo), and they were forced to exchange the security of the Imperial Palace's gates of domain to shogunate army, but Shoshidai (local governor) ordered the bull and Denso (job title referring to one who relays messages of court's people to Emperor) to reject that, instead of that an urgent order sent to the general was urgent.
sen.cmt: RETURN TO TRANSLATOR Mostly needs retranslation … most native speakers of English would find this only slightly intelligible
sen.e: At that time, the shogunate ordered an Imperial command by force, to go to the capital of the father and son of the domain of Choshu and to send five nobles to Edo, and sent two councilors to Kyoto with four battalions with guns to realize that revival of three things of Sankin-kotai (daimyo's alternate-year residence in Edo), and they were forced to exchange the security of the Imperial Palace's gates of domain to shogunate army, but Shoshidai (local governor) ordered the bull and Denso (job title referring to one who relays messages of court's people to Emperor) to reject that, instead of that an urgent order sent to the general was urgent.

sen.j: これらは幕権の回復を望まない西郷・大久保らの公卿工作によるものであった。
sen.e: These were the maneuvering of nobles from Saigo, Okubo and other's that doesn't desire restore the power of Bakufu feudal government.
These were the maneuvering of nobles like Saigo, Okubo and others that did not desire the restoration of power of the Bakufu (feudal government).
These were the maneuvering of nobles like Saigo, Okubo and others that did not desire the restoration of power of the Bakufu (feudal government).

sen.j: 5月1日に西郷は坂本龍馬を同行して鹿児島に帰り、京都情勢を藩首脳に報告した。
sen.e: In May 1, Saigo returned to Kagoshima with Ryoma SAKAMOTO, and reported about situation of Kyoto to the executives of domain.
In May 1, Saigo returned to Kagoshima with Ryoma SAKAMOTO, and reported Kyoto's situation to the executives of the domain.
In May 1, Saigo returned to Kagoshima with Ryoma SAKAMOTO, and reported Kyoto's situation to the executives of the domain.

sen.j: その後、幕府の征長出兵命令を拒否すべしと説いて藩論をまとめた。
sen.e: After that, reported the domain argument that explained to decline the order of the Seicho troops of shogunate.
After that, he reported the domain's argument that explained why the order of the Seicho troops of shogunate was refused.
After that, he reported the domain's argument that explained why the order of the Seicho troops of shogunate was refused.

sen.j: 9日に大番頭・一身家老組に任命された。
sen.e: On 9th, he was appointed to a head clerk/ personal-to-a-person Karo, chief retainer post (not inherited).
On the 9th, he was appointed to the position of head clerk/ personal-to-a-person Karo, chief retainer (not inherited).
sen.cmt: "personal to a person sounds odd".. Consider changing. Added "to the position of" etc.
sen.e: On the 9th, he was appointed to the position of head clerk and personal-to-a-person Karo, chief retainer (not inherited).

sen.j: この頃、将軍徳川家茂は、勅書を無視して、総督紀州藩主徳川茂承以下16藩の兵約6万を率いて西下を開始し、兵を大坂に駐屯させたのち、閏5月22日に京都に入った。
sen.e: At that time, Shogun Iemochi TOKUGAWA was started to going west with governor conquering of the lord of the Kishu domain and sixteen domains with sixty thousand soldiers with disregard of Imperial command, and after soldiers were stationed in Osaka, and intercalary May 22, arrived Kyoto.

sen.j: 翌23日、家茂は参内して武力を背景に長州再征を奏上したが、許可されなかった。
sen.e: Next day, 23rd, Iemochi visited to the Imperial Palace with military power as background to report the attacks Choshu again, but it was not approved.

sen.j: 6月、鹿児島入りした中岡慎太郎は、西郷に薩長の協力と和親を説き、下関で桂小五郎（木戸孝允）と会うことを約束させた。
sen.e: In June, Shintaro NAKAOKA went to Kagoshima and talked about Saccho's corporation and peace to Saigo, and promised to meet Kogoro KATSURA (Takayoshi KIDO) in Shimonoseki.
