sen.j: しかし、西郷は大久保から緊迫した書簡を受け取ったので、下関寄港を取りやめ、急ぎ上京した。
sen.e: But Saigo received tensioned letter from Okuno, so canceled to Shimonoseki port call and hurried to Kyoto.
But Saigo received an important letter from Okuno, so he cancelled his plans to go to Shimonoseki port and hurried to Kyoto.

sen.j: この間、京大坂滞在中の幕府幹部は兵6万の武力を背景に一層強気になり、長州再征等のことを朝廷へ迫った。
sen.e: Among this time, the executives of shogunate who stayed in Kyo-Osaka became more aggressive with background of sixty thousands of power of soldiers, and they demanded that Imperial court about the punitive re-expedition to Choshu.

Among this time, the executives of the shogunate who stayed in Kyo-Osaka became more aggressive based on the power of the sixty thousands soldiers there, and they pressed the Imperial court regarding the punitive re-expedition to Choshu.

sen.e: Among this time, the executives of the shogunate who stayed in Kyo-Osaka became more aggressive based on the power of the sixty thousands soldiers there, and they pressed the Imperial Court regarding the punitive re-expedition to Choshu.

sen.j: これに対し、西郷は幕府の脅しに屈せず、6月11日、幕府の長州再征に協力しないように大久保に伝え、そのための朝廷工作を進めさせた。
sen.e: Against this, Saigo didn't yield to the threats from shogunate, on June 11, he told Okubo not to help shogunate for the punitive re-expedition to Choshu, and proceeded to maneuver of Imperial court for that.

Saigo did not yield to these threats from the shogunate, and on June 11, he told Okubo not to help shogunate with the punitive re-expedition to Choshu, and proceeded to maneuver within the Imperial court to that end.

sen.j: それに加え、24日には京都で坂本龍馬と会い、長州が欲している武器・艦船の購入を薩摩名義で行うこと承諾し、薩長和親の実績をつくった。
sen.e: And added, on 24th, he met Ryoma SAKAMOTO in Kyoto and approved to purchase of weapon and ship that Choshu wanted which named by Satsuma, and made an achievements of Saccho peace.
Additionally, on the 24th, he met Ryoma SAKAMOTO in Kyoto and approved the purchase of weapons and ships that Choshu wanted, which represented an actual achievement of Saccho piece with Satsuma.

sen.j: また、幕府の兵力に対抗する必要を感じ、10月初旬に鹿児島へ帰り、15日に小松とともに兵を率いて上京した。
sen.e: Also, he felt the necessity for competition of military power of shogunate, and returned to Kagoshima in middle of October, and came to Kyoto with Komatsu and soldiers on 15th.
Also, he felt the necessity to stand up against the military power of shogunate, and he returned to Kagoshima in the middle of October, and came to Kyoto with Komatsu and soldiers on the 15th.

sen.j: この頃長州から兵糧米を購入することを龍馬に依頼したが、これもまた薩長和親の実績づくりであった。
sen.e: Around this time, he requested for purchasing of rice for military to Ryoma from Choshu, but it was also for making an achievement of Saccho peace.
Around this time, he requested the purchase of rice for the military to Ryoma from Choshu, but an important motive in this was to solidify the achievement of Saccho peace.

sen.j: この間、黒田清隆（了介）を長州へ往還させ薩長同盟の工作も重ねさせた。
sen.e: At this time, he sent Kiyotaka (Ryosuke) KURODA to Choshu and brought him back, and maneuvered for the Satsuma-Choshu alliance.

sen.j: 9月16日、英・仏・米・蘭四国の軍艦9隻が兵庫沖に碇泊し、兵庫開港を迫った。
sen.e: In September 16, The nine warships of Four countries, England, France, America and Holland arrived and stayed at Hyogo-oki offing to approach opening Hyogo port.
In September 16, The nine warships of Four countries, England, France, America and Holland, arrived and stayed at Hyogo-oki offing to try to open Hyogo port.
In September 16, The nine warships of Four countries, England, France, America and Holland, arrived and stayed at Hyogo-oki offing to try to open Hyogo port.

sen.j: 一方、京都では、武力を背景にした脅迫にひるみ、9月21日、朝廷は幕府に長州再征の勅許を下した。
sen.e: On the other hand, the intimidation of background of military power was hesitated, and in September 21, the Imperial court approved Imperial sanction of the punitive re-expedition to Choshu to shogunate in Kyoto.

On the other hand, the intimidation resulting from the presence of the military power resulted in the Imperial court approving the Imperial sanction of the punitive re-expedition to Choshu to the shogunate in Kyoto on September 21.

sen.j: また、10月1日に前尾張藩主徳川慶勝から出された条約の勅許と兵庫開港勅許の奏請も、一旦は拒否したが、将軍辞職をほのめかしと朝廷への武力行使も辞さないとの幕府及び徳川慶喜の脅迫に屈して、条約は勅許するが、兵庫開港は不許可という内容の勅書を下した。
sen.e: Also on October 1, they refused the matter for Imperial approval which is the Imperial sanction of the treaty from the former load of domain of Owari, Yoshikatsu TOKUGAWA and the Imperial sanction of the opening of Hyogo port, but they yielded to shogunate and Yoshinobu TOKUGAWA who insinuated that resigning of general, and to resort to force, then treated the Imperial approval, but they issued the Imperial approval that the opening of Hyogo port was not approved.

Also on October 1, they refused granting Imperial approval to sanction the treaty from the former lord of the domain of Owari, Yoshikatsu TOKUGAWA, nor did they approve an Imperial sanction of the opening of Hyogo port, but they yielded to the shogunate and Yoshinobu TOKUGAWA when he insinuated that he would resign of general and to resort to force, finally, they did they issue Imperial approval to open Hyogo port.

sen.j: これは強制されたものであったとはいえ、安政以来の幕府の念願の実現であり、国是の変更という意味でも歴史上の大きな決定であった。
sen.e: Even it was compulsion, it was the realization of desire since Ansei for shogunate, it was historical big decision meaning as the changing national policy.

Although it was the result of compulsion, the decision was the realization of the desire that the Shogunate had had since Ansei, and historically it was a very important decision inasmuch as it represented a shift in national policy.

Although it was the result of compulsion, the decision was the realization of the desire that the Shogunate had had since Ansei, and historically it was a very important decision inasmuch as it represented a shift in national policy.

sen.j: 慶応2年（1866年）1月8日、西郷は村田新八・大山成美（通称は彦八、大山巌の兄）を伴って、上京してきた桂小五郎（木戸）を伏見に出迎え、翌9日、京都に帰って二本松藩邸に入った。
sen.e: In January 8, 1866, Saigo went to welcome to Kogoro KATSURA (Kido) to Fushimi with Shinpachi MURATA and Narumi Oyama (nickname, Hikohachi, older brother of Iwao Oyama), next day on 9th, he went back to Kyoto and stayed in Nihommatsu-Hantei (Nihommatsu domain's residence maintained by a daimyo in Edo).
sen.cmt: 大山成美→Narumi Oyama (大山成美)[定訳不明]彦八→Hikohachi (彦八)[定訳不明]
sen.e: On January 8, 1866, Saigo went to welcome to Kogoro KATSURA (Kido) to Fushimi with Shinpachi MURATA and Narumi Oyama (nickname, Hikohachi, older brother of Iwao Oyama), and on the following day, the 9th, he went back to Kyoto and stayed in Nihommatsu-Hantei (Nihommatsu domain's residence, which was maintained by a daimyo in Edo).

On January 8, 1866, Saigo went to welcome to Kogoro KATSURA (Kido) to Fushimi with Shinpachi MURATA and Narumi OYAMA (nickname, Hikohachi, older brother of Iwao OYAMA), and on the following day, the 9th, he went back to Kyoto and stayed in Nihommatsu-Hantei (Nihommatsu domain's residence, which was maintained by a daimyo in Edo).

sen.j: 21日（22日という説もある）、西郷は小松帯刀邸で桂小五郎と薩長提携六ヶ条を密約し、坂本龍馬がその提携書に裏書きをした（薩長同盟）。
sen.e: 21st (it has a rumor that was actually on 22nd), Saigo made a secret agreement of the Saccho Teikei Rokkajo (six articles of partnership between Satsuma and Choshu) with Kogoro KATSURA at Tatewaki KOMATSU's residence, Ryoma SAKAMOTO endorsed a corporate document (Satsuma-Choshu Alliance)

On the 21st (although rumored to have actually been on 22nd), Saigo made a secret agreement with the Saccho Teikei Rokkajo (six articles of partnership between Satsuma and Choshu) with Kogoro KATSURA at Tatewaki KOMATSU's residence, and Ryoma SAKAMOTO endorsed a corporate document (Satsuma-Choshu Alliance)
sen.cmt: very unnatural phrasing; added words for clarity
sen.e: On the 21st (although rumored to have in fact been on 22nd), Saigo made a secret agreement with the Saccho Teikei Rokkajo (six articles of partnership between Satsuma and Choshu) with Kogoro KATSURA at Tatewaki KOMATSU's residence, and Ryoma SAKAMOTO endorsed a corporate document (Satsuma-Choshu Alliance).
sen.cmt: ピリオドactually→in factに変更しました。

sen.j: その直後、龍馬が京都の寺田屋で幕吏に襲撃されると、西郷の指示で、薩摩藩邸が龍馬を保護した。
sen.e: Right after that, Ryoma was attacked by man of shogunate at Teradaya, Satsuma-Hantei (Satsuma domain's residence maintained by a daimyo in Edo) protected Ryoma by Saigo's indication.

Immediately thereafter, Ryoma was attacked by a man of the shogunate at Teradaya, Satsuma-Hantei (the Satsuma domain's residence maintained by a daimyo in Edo) and at Saigo's indication Ryoma was protected.

sen.j: その後、3月4日に小松清廉・桂久武・吉井友実・坂本龍馬夫妻（西郷が仲人をした）らと大坂を出航し、11日に鹿児島へ着いた。
sen.e: After that, Kiyokado KOMATSU, Hisatake KATSURA, Tomomi YOSHII and Mr. and Mrs. Ryoma SAKAMOTO (Saigo was a matchmaker) sailed from Osaka and arrived to Kagoshima on 11th.
After that, Kiyokado KOMATSU, Hisatake KATSURA, Tomomi YOSHII and Mr. and Mrs. Ryoma SAKAMOTO (Saigo was the matchmaker) sailed from Osaka and arrived in Kagoshima on 11th.

sen.j: 4月、藩政改革と陸海軍の拡張を進言し、それが入れられると、5月1日から小松・桂らと藩政改革にあたった。
sen.e: In April, he was counseled about expanding of reformation of domain duties and, military and navy, after these counsel was approved, he worked for reformation of domain duties with Komatsu and Katsura.

In April, he was counseled about increasing the reformation of the domain duties and the military and navy, and after these suggestions were approved, he worked for reformation of domain duties with Komatsu and Katsura.

sen.j: 第二次長州征伐は、6月7日の幕府軍艦による上ノ関砲撃から始まった。
sen.e: The second conquest of Choshu started from bombardment of Kaminoseki by a battleship of shogunate on June 7.
The second conquest of Choshu started with the bombardment of Kaminoseki by a battleship of the shogunate on June 7.
The second conquest of Choshu started with the bombardment of Kaminoseki by a battleship of the shogunate on June 7.

sen.j: 大島口・芸州口・山陰口・小倉口の四方面で戦闘が行われ、芸州口は膠着したが、大村益次郎が指揮した山陰口は奇兵隊を中心とする諸隊の活躍で連戦連勝し、大島口・小倉口も高杉晋作の電撃作戦で勝利し、幕府軍は惨敗続きであった。
sen.e: The battle was started from four different directions that is from Oshima-guchi, Geishu-guchi, Sanin-guchi and Kokura-guchi, Geishu-guchi was deadlocked, but Sanin-guchi which direct by Masujiro OMURA was keep winning by many forces hard work that Kiheitai Army was as main, Oshima-guchi and Kokura-guchi also won by sudden attack of Shinsakau TAKASUGI, the force of shogunate was keep crushing defeat.
sen.cmt: 大村益次郎→Masujiro OMURA[http://kotobank.jp/word/大村益次郎]高杉晋作→Shinsaku TAKASUGI[http://dic.yahoo.co.jp/dsearch?enc=UTF-8&p=高杉晋作&dtype=0&dname=0na&stype=0&pagenum=1&index=13135711334900]
sen.e: The battle was was waged at four different locations, that is, ay Oshima-guchi, Geishu-guchi, Sanin-guchi and Kokura-guchi, and Geishu-guchi remained deadlocked, but the forces at Sanin-guchi, which commanded by Masujiro OMURA won through the hard work of many of the forces there, of which the Kiheitai Army was the foresmost; Oshima-guchi and Kokura-guchi were also won by means of sudden attacks oby Shinsakau TAKASUGI, and the force of shogunate suffered a crushing defeat.

The battle was was waged at four different locations, that is, ay Oshima-guchi, Geishu-guchi, Sanin-guchi and Kokura-guchi, and Geishu-guchi remained deadlocked, but the forces at Sanin-guchi, which commanded by Masujiro OMURA won through the hard work of many of the forces there, of which the Kiheitai Army was the foresmost; Oshima-guchi and Kokura-guchi were also won by means of sudden attacks oby Shinsakau TAKASUGI, and the force of shogunate suffered a crushing defeat.

sen.j: 鹿児島にいた西郷は、7月9日に朝廷に出す長州再征反対の建白を起草し、藩主名で幕府へ出兵を断る文書を提出させた。
sen.e: Saigo who was in Kagoshima drafted of a petition which against the punitive re-expedition to Choshu, and made them to submit the document which is the decline of going to military that named by the lord of domain.

Saigo, who was in Kagoshima, drafted a petition against the punitive re-expedition to Choshu, and made them submit to the document, which stipulated that the lord of the domain can refuse to send soldiers.
sen.cmt: This is my translation, please verify
sen.e: Saigo, who was in Kagoshima, drafted a petition against the punitive re-expedition to Choshu, and made them submit to the document on July 9, which stipulated that the lord of the domain can refuse to send soldiers.

sen.j: 一方、幕府は、7月30日に将軍徳川家茂が大坂城中で病死したので、喪を秘し、8月1日の小倉口での敗北を機に、敗戦処理と将軍継嗣問題をかたづけるべく、朝廷に願い出て、21日に休戦の御沙汰書を出してもらった。
sen.e: On the other hand, shogunate was stayed for funeral because the Shogun Iemochi Tokugawa died from an illness inside of Osaka castle on July 30, the opportunity of defeat at Kokura-guchi on August 1, he tendered an imperial words document of cease-fire to the Imperial court for dispose of defeat and the problem of Shogun Ietsugu.

However, because Shogun Iemochi Tokugawa had died due to illness in Osaka castle on July 30, and due to the defeat at Kokura-guchi on August 1, the Shogunate was delayed while mourning him, he issued an imperial order of cease-fire to the Imperial Court to buy time necessary to deal with the problems of being defeated and Shogun Iemitsu's demise.
sen.cmt: 2 things… we lack a antecedent for "he" and I rewrote the en of the sentence.
sen.e: However, because Shogun Iemochi Tokugawa had died due to illness in Osaka castle on July 30, and due to the defeat at Kokura-guchi on August 1, the Shogunate was delayed while mourning him, he issued an imperial order of cease-fire to the Imperial Court to buy time necessary to deal with the problems of being defeated and Shogun Iemitsu's demise.

sen.j: 将軍の遺骸を海路江戸へ運んだ幕府は、12月25日の孝明天皇の崩御を機に解兵の御沙汰書を得て公布し、この戦役を終わらせた。
sen.e: Shogunate carried Shogun's ashes to sea route Edo, and promulgated an imperial words documents of dissolution of military and ended a battle by the opportunity of demise of Imperial Takaaki

The Shogunate carried Shogun Iemitsu's ashes by the Edo sea route, and promulgated an Imperial order by which the military was dissolved, and ended batte with the demise of Emperor Takaaki on December 25th.
sen.cmt: Added date. Imperial --> emperor. Capitalization. Phrasing.
sen.e: The Shogunate carried Shogun Iemitsu's ashes by the Edo sea route, and promulgated an Imperial order by which the military was dissolved, and ended batte with the demise of Emperor Takaaki on December 25th.

sen.j: この間、西郷は、7月12日、西郷に嫡男寅太郎が誕生し、9月に大目付・陸軍掛・家老座出席に任命された。
sen.e: While this time, Saigo's heir, Torataro was born in July 12, and Saigo was appointed to have the Ometsuke title/ the Rikugun-kakari (department of army)/ the attendance at chief retainer's office.
At this time, Saigo's heir, Torataro was born on July 12, and Saigo was granted the title of Ometsuke/Rikugun-Kakari (Department of the Army)/Attendant at the Chief Retainer's Office.
sen.cmt: Not certain about all the capitalization.
sen.e: At this time, Saigo's heir, Torataro was born on July 12, and Saigo was granted the title of Ometsuke, Rikugun-Kakari (Department of the Army) and Attendant at the Chief Retainer's Office.

sen.j: 大目付役は返上した。
sen.e: He returned the Ometsuke title.
He returned the title of Ometsuke.
He returned the title of Ometsuke.

tit.j: 大政奉還と王政復古の号令
tit.e: command of Returning political power to the emperor Restoration of monarchy
Command to return political power to the emperor and restore monarchy.
Command to return political power to the emperor and restore monarchy.

sen.j: 慶応3年（1867年）3月上旬、村田新八・中岡慎太郎らを先発させ、大村藩・平戸藩などを遊説させた。
sen.e: In beginning of March, 1867, he made Shinpachi MURATA and Shintaro NAKAMURA started first, and canvassed at domain of Omura and domain of Hirado.
In the beginning of March, 1867, starting with Shinpachi MURATA and Shintaro NAKAMURA he campaigned at domain of Omura and domain of Hirado.
In the beginning of March, 1867, starting with Shinpachi MURATA and Shintaro NAKAMURA he campaigned at domain of Omura and domain of Hirado.

sen.j: 3月25日、西郷は久光を奉じ、薩摩の精鋭700名（城下1番小隊から6番小隊）を率いて上京した。
sen.e: In March 25, Saigo obeyed Hisamitsu, and went to Kyoto with seven hundred the picked soldiers (Joka #1 commander group to #6 commanders group)
On March 25, obeying orders from Hisamitsu, Saigo went to Kyoto with seven hundred the picked soldiers (Jfrom the first to 6th Joka command groups).

sen.e: On March 25, obeying orders from Hisamitsu, Saigo went to Kyoto with seven hundred the picked soldiers (from the first to 6th Joka command groups).

sen.j: 5月に京都の薩摩藩邸と土佐藩邸で相次いで開催された四侯会議の下準備をした。
sen.e: In June 15, he prepared the Shiko-kaigi (four major lords' meeting) that held at the residence of domain of Satuma, and the residence of domain of Tosa in Kyoto.
On June 15, he prepared the Shiko-kaigi (the four major lords' meeting), which was held at the residence of the domain of Satuma, and the residence of the domain of Tosa in Kyoto.
In May, he prepared the Shiko-kaigi (the four major lords' meeting), which was held at the residence of the domain of Satuma, and the residence of the domain of Tosa in Kyoto.

sen.j: 6月15日、西郷は山縣有朋を訪問し、初めて倒幕の決意を告げた。
sen.e: He visited Aritomo YAMAGATA on June 15, and told him the resolution to overthrow the Tokugawa shogunate first time.
sen.cmt: 山縣有朋→Aritomo YAMAGATA[http://kotobank.jp/word/山県有朋]
sen.e: He visited Aritomo YAMAGATA on June 15th, and told him of the resolution to overthrow the Tokugawa shogunate first time.
He visited Aritomo YAMAGATA on June 15th, and told him of the resolution to overthrow the Tokugawa shogunate first time.

sen.j: 16日、西郷・小松帯刀・大久保利通・伊地知正治・山縣有朋・品川弥二郎らが会し、改めて薩長同盟の誓約をした。
sen.e: On 16th, Saigo, Tatewaki KOMATSU, Toshimichi OKUBO, Masaharu ICHIJI, Aritomo YAMAGATA and Yajiro SHINAGAWA pledged for Satsuma-Choshu Alliance once more.
sen.cmt: 小松帯刀→Tatewaki KOMATSU[http://kotobank.jp/word/小松帯刀]品川弥二郎→Yajiro SHINAGAWA[http://kotobank.jp/word/品川弥二郎]
sen.e: On the 16th, Saigo, Tatewaki KOMATSU, Toshimichi OKUBO, Masaharu ICHIJI, Aritomo YAMAGATA and Yajiro SHINAGAWA pledged to form the Satsuma-Choshu Alliance once more.
On the 16th, Saigo, Tatewaki KOMATSU, Toshimichi OKUBO, Masaharu ICHIJI, Aritomo YAMAGATA and Yajiro SHINAGAWA pledged to form the Satsuma-Choshu Alliance once more.

sen.j: その後、江戸市内へ伊牟田尚平・益満休之助・相楽総三らを派遣し、破壊工作（江戸や近辺の放火・強盗による人心攪乱）を行わせ幕府を挑発した。
sen.e: After that, he sent Shohei IMUTA, Kyunosuke MASUMITSU, Sozo SAGARA and others to city of Edo for subversive activities (make people upset by arson and robbery in Edo and the neighborhood) and provoked shogunate.
sen.cmt: 伊牟田尚平→Shohei IMUTA[http://kotobank.jp/word/伊牟田尚平]益満休之助→Kyunosuke MASUMITSU[http://kotobank.jp/word/益満休之助]相楽総三→Sozo SAGARA[http://kotobank.jp/word/相楽総三]
sen.e: After that, he sent Shohei IMUTA, Kyunosuke MASUMITSU, Sozo SAGARA and others to the city of Edo to commit subversive acts (the intention was to upset the people using acts of arson and robbery in Edo and the neighborhood), and provoked the shogunate.
sen.cmt: added "the" changed phrasing and added words to make more natural
sen.e: After that, he sent Shohei IMUTA, Kyunosuke MASUMITSU, Sozo SAGARA and others to the city of Edo to commit subversive acts (the intention was to upset the people using acts of arson and robbery in Edo and the neighborhood), and provoked the shogunate.

sen.j: 22日には西郷が坂本龍馬・後藤象二郎・福岡孝悌らと会し、薩土盟約が成立した。
sen.e: On 22nd, Saigo gathered together with Ryoma SAKAMOTO, Shojiro GOTO and Takachika FUKUOKA and formed the Satsudo Meiyaku (the alliance with Satsuma and Tosa).
sen.cmt: 薩土盟約→Satsudo Meiyaku (the alliance with Satsuma and Tosa)[http://kotobank.jp/word/薩土盟約]
sen.e: On the 22nd, Saigo gathered together with Ryoma SAKAMOTO, Shojiro GOTO and Takachika FUKUOKA and formed the Satsudo Meiyaku (the alliance with Satsuma and Tosa).
On the 22nd, Saigo gathered together with Ryoma SAKAMOTO, Shojiro GOTO and Takachika FUKUOKA and formed the Satsudo Meiyaku (the alliance with Satsuma and Tosa).

sen.j: 9月7日、久光の三男・島津珍彦（うずひこ）が兵約1000名を率いて大坂に着いた。
sen.e: In September 7, Uzuhiko Shimazu who is the third son of Hisamitsu arrived in Osaka with about one thousand soldiers.
On September 7th, Uzuhiko Shimazu, who was the third son of Hisamitsu, arrived in Osaka with about one thousand soldiers.
On September 7th, Uzuhiko Shimazu, who was the third son of Hisamitsu, arrived in Osaka with about one thousand soldiers.

sen.j: 9月9日、後藤が来訪して坂本龍馬案にもとづく大政奉還建白書を提出するので、挙兵を延期するように求めたが、西郷は拒否した（後日了承した）。
sen.e: On September 9, he asked to postpone to raise an army because Goto came to visit and submitted the Petition to transfer the power back to the Emperor which based on Ryoma SAKAMOTO's idea, but Saigo was denied (later, he approved).

On September 9th, Saigo asked permission to postpone raising an army, because Goto came to visit and submitted a Petition to transfer the power back to the Emperor, which was based on Ryoma SAKAMOTO's idea, and though he was denied permission, he later received.

On September 9th, Saigo asked permission to postpone raising an army, because Goto came to visit and submitted a Petition to transfer the power back to the Emperor, which was based on Ryoma SAKAMOTO's idea, and though he was denied permission, he later received.

sen.j: 土佐藩（前藩主山内容堂）から提出された建白書を見た将軍徳川慶喜は、10月14日に大政奉還の上奏を朝廷に提出させた。
sen.e: Shogun Yoshinobu TOKUNAGA who read the petition from domain of Tosa (former lord of domain Yado YAMAUCHI) was submitted Joso (memorial to the throne) of returning political power to the emperor to Imperial court.
sen.cmt: 土佐藩→domain of Tosa[http://100.yahoo.co.jp/detail/土佐藩/]山内容堂→Yodo YAMAUCHI [http://kotobank.jp/word/山内容堂]
sen.e: Shogun Yoshinobu TOKUNAGA, who read the petition from the domain of Tosa (former lord of domain Yado YAMAUCHI) submitted Joso (memorial to the throne) of returning political power to the emperor to Imperial court.

Shogun Yoshinobu TOKUNAGA, who read the petition from the domain of Tosa (former lord of domain Yodo YAMAUCHI) submitted Joso (memorial to the throne) of returning political power to the emperor to Imperial court.

sen.j: ところが、同じ14日に、討幕と会津・桑名誅伐の密勅が下り、西郷・小松・大久保・品川らはその請書を出していた（この請書には西郷吉之助武雄と署名している）。
sen.e: But, same day on 14th, secret Imperial command of anti-Shogunate army and the attack and kill of Aizu and Kuwana was issued, Saigo, Okubo, Shinagawa and others were submitted the acknowledgement of order (this acknowledgement of order was signed by Takeo (Kichinosuke) SAIGO)

The 14th witnessed many events, namely the secret Imperial command against the Shogunate army, the issuance of the order to assassinate Aizu and Kuwana, and the submission of the acknowledgement of this order to Saigo, Okubo, Shinagawa and others (the acknowledgement of the order was signed by Takeo (Kichinosuke) SAIGO.
sen.cmt: Badly translated yougo --> 会津・桑名誅伐→To attack and kill of Aizu and Kuwana
sen.e: The 14th witnessed many events, namely the secret Imperial command against the Shogunate army, the issuance of the order to assassinate Aizu and Kuwana, and the submission of the acknowledgement of this order to Saigo, Okubo, Shinagawa and others (the acknowledgement of the order was signed by Takeo (Kichinosuke) SAIGO.

sen.j: 15日、朝廷から大政奉還を勅許する旨の御沙汰書が出された。
sen.e: On 15th, the report that was approved by Imperial sanction about returning political power to the emperor was submitted from Imperial court.
On 15th, the imperially sanctioned report to return political power to the emperor was submitted by Imperial court.
On 15th, the imperially sanctioned report to return political power to the emperor was submitted by Imperial Court.

sen.j: 密勅を持ち帰った西郷は、桂久武らの協力で藩論をまとめ、11月13日、藩主・島津忠義を奉じ、兵約3000名を率いて鹿児島を発した。
sen.e: Saigo who brought a secret Imperial command was finished the report of the domain which worked with Hisatake KATSURA and others, on November 13, he obeyed the load of domain Tadayoshi SHIMAZU with three thousand soldiers and left Kagoshima.

Saigo, who brought a secret Imperial command, put together the report of the domain which worked with Hisatake KATSURA and others, on November 13, he obeyed the lord of the domain Tadayoshi SHIMAZU and left Kagoshima with three thousand soldiers.
sen.cmt: Not certain about this one. VERIFY
sen.e: Saigo, who brought a secret Imperial command, put together the report of the domain which worked with Hisatake KATSURA and others, on November 13, he obeyed the lord of the domain Tadayoshi SHIMAZU and left Kagoshima with three thousand soldiers.

sen.j: 途中で長州と出兵時期を調整し、三田尻を発して、20日に大坂、23日に京都に着いた。
sen.e: On the way, he adjusted the time for sending soldiers with Choshu, and left Mitajiri, and arrived Osaka on 20th, and to Kyoto on 23rd.
On the way, he changed departure date of the soldiers with Choshu, then he left Mitajiri, and arrived Osaka on 20th, and to Kyoto on 23rd.
On the way, he changed departure date of the soldiers with Choshu, then he left Mitajiri, and arrived Osaka on 20th, and to Kyoto on 23rd.

sen.j: 長州兵約700名も29日に摂津打出浜に上陸して、西宮に進出した。
sen.e: About seven hundred Choshu soldiers were landed at Settsu Uchidehama on 29th, and moved to Nishinomiya.
About seven hundred Choshu soldiers landed at Settsu Uchidehama on 29th, then moved to Nishinomiya.
About seven hundred Choshu soldiers landed at Settsu Uchidehama on 29th, then moved to Nishinomiya.

sen.j: またこの頃、芸州藩も出兵を決めた。
sen.e: Also at that time, domain of Geishu decided to send the soldiers.
Also at that time, the domain of Geishu decided to send the soldiers.
Also at that time, the domain of Geishu decided to send the soldiers.

sen.j: 諸藩と出兵交渉をしながら、西郷は、11月下旬頃から有志に王政復古の大号令発布のための工作を始めさせた。
sen.e: Saigo let volunteer to started maneuvering to issue the Oseifukko no Daigorei (Imperial court's declaration of Restoration of monarchy) while negotiate about sending soldiers with other domains.
sen.cmt: 王政復古の大号令→Oseifukko no Daigorei (Imperial court's declaration of Restoration of monarchy)[http://kids.gakken.co.jp/jiten/1/10020690.html]
sen.e: Saigo was made to start maneuvering with regard to the issue of the Oseifukko no Daigorei (Imperial court's declaration of Restoration of monarchy) while negotiating to send soldiers to other domains.
sen.cmt: Please verify this portion: "Saigo was made to start maneuvering with regard to the issue"
sen.e: Saigo was made to start maneuvering with regard to the issue of the Oseifukko no Daigorei (Imperial Court's declaration of Restoration of monarchy) while negotiating to send soldiers to other domains.

sen.j: 12月9日、薩摩・安芸・尾張・越前に宮中警護のための出兵命令が出され、会津・桑名兵とこれら4藩兵が宮中警護を交替すると、王政復古の大号令が発布された。
sen.e: On December 9th, starting were issued to the guards of the Imperial Courts of Satuma, Aki, Owari and Echizen, and Aizu, Kuwanahama and these four soldier of domain changed to guard the Imperial Court, then the seifukko no Daigorei (Imperial court's declaration of Restoration of monarchy) was promulgated.

On December 9th, marching orders were issued to the guard of the Imperial Court of Satuma, and as a result the four armies of the domain Aki, Owari, Echizen, and Aizu, Kuwanahama changed to guard the Imperial Court, then the seifukko no Daigorei (Imperial court's declaration of Restoration of monarchy) was promulgated.

On December 9th, marching orders were issued to the guard of the Imperial Court of Satuma, and as a result the four armies of the domain Aki, Owari, Echizen, and Aizu, Kuwanahama changed to guard the Imperial Court, then the seifukko no Daigorei (Imperial court's declaration of Restoration of monarchy) was promulgated.

sen.j: 明治元年（1868年）1月3日、大坂の旧幕軍が上京を開始し、幕府の先鋒隊と薩長の守備隊が衝突し、鳥羽・伏見の戦いが始まった（戊辰戦争開始）。
sen.e: January 3, 1868, former shogunate army of Osaka started to come to Kyoto, the spearhead convoy of shogunate and garrison of Saccho crashed each other, then the Battle of Toba and Fushimi was started.
sen.cmt: 鳥羽・伏見の戦い→the Battle of Toba and Fushimi[http://100.yahoo.co.jp/detail/鳥羽・伏見の戦い/]
sen.e: January 3, 1868, the former shogunate army of Osaka set out to Kyoto, the spearhead convoy of the shogunate and garrison of Saccho had an encounter each other, and the Battles of Toba and Fushimi started.

January 3, 1868, the former shogunate army of Osaka set out to Kyoto, the spearhead convoy of the shogunate and garrison of Saccho had an encounter each other, and the Battles of Toba and Fushimi started.

sen.j: 西郷はこの3日には伏見の戦線、5日には八幡の戦線を視察し、戦況が有利になりつつあるのを確認した。
sen.e: Saigo confirmed that situation about the war is getting advantageous, when inspected the Fushimi battle line on 3rd, and Yawata battle line on 5th.
Saigo confirmed that circumstances surrounding the were becoming advantageous after inspecting the Fushimi battle line on 3rd, and the Yawata battle line on 5th.
sen.cmt: "Confirmed that situation about" --> X added words to improve phrasing
sen.e: Saigo confirmed that circumstances surrounding the were becoming advantageous after inspecting the Fushimi battle line on 3rd, and the Yawata battle line on 5th.

sen.j: 6日、徳川慶喜は松平容保・松平定敬以下、老中・大目付・外国奉行ら少数を伴い、大坂城を脱出して、軍艦開陽に搭乗して江戸へ退去した。
sen.e: On 6th, Yosninobu TOKUGAWA escaped from Osaka castle with Katamori MATSUDAIRA, councilor Sadaaki MATSUDAIRA, Gaikoku-bugyo Title and others few people together, and got on the Kaiyo, warship and left to Edo.
On the 6th, Yosninobu TOKUGAWA escaped from Osaka castle with councilor Katamori MATSUDAIRA, and Gaikoku-bugyo Sadaaki MATSUDAIRA, and a few others, and got on the Kaiyo warship and left for Edo.
sen.cmt: nd others few people together--> NO.. changed
sen.e: On the 6th, Yosninobu TOKUGAWA escaped from Osaka castle with councilor Katamori MATSUDAIRA, and Gaikoku-bugyo Sadaaki MATSUDAIRA, and a few others, and got on the Kaiyo warship and left for Edo.

sen.j: 新政府は7日に慶喜追討令を出し、9日に有栖川宮熾仁親王を東征大総督（征討大総督）に任じ、東海・東山・北陸三道の軍を指揮させ、東国経略に乗り出した。
sen.e: New government issued the decree to search and kill Yoshinobu on 7th, and on 9th, Imperial Prince Taruhito, Arisugawa-no-miya was appointed to Tosei-daitokufu, and let him take command of Tokai, Higashiyama and Three Roads of Hokuriku to work for Togoku-keiryaku (govern the eastern countries).
sen.cmt: 有栖川宮熾仁親王→Imperial Prince Taruhito, Arisugawa-no-miya[http://kotobank.jp/word/有栖川宮熾仁親王]
sen.e: The new government issued the decree to find and kill Yoshinobu on the 7th, and on the 9th, Imperial Prince Taruhito, Arisugawa-no-miya was appointed to Tosei-daitokufu, and was allowed to take command of Tokai, Higashiyama and the Three Roads of Hokuriku to work for Togoku-keiryaku (the government of the eastern countries).

The new government issued the decree to find and kill Yoshinobu on the 7th, and on the 9th, Imperial Prince Taruhito, Arisugawa-no-miya was appointed to Tosei-daitokufu, and was allowed to take command of Tokai, Higashiyama and the Three Roads of Hokuriku to work for Togoku-keiryaku (the government of the eastern countries).

sen.j: 西郷は2月12日に東海道先鋒軍の薩摩諸隊差引（司令官）、14日に東征大総督府下参謀（参謀は公家が任命され、下参謀が実質上の参謀）に任じられると、独断で先鋒軍（薩軍一番小隊隊長中村半次郎・二番小隊隊長村田新八・三番小隊隊長篠原国幹らが中心）を率いて先発し、2月28日には東海道の要衝箱根町を占領した。
sen.e: Saigo was appointed the Satsuma groups Sashihiki commander of Tokaido spearhead army in February 12, and he was appointed the Shimo-sambo staff of Tosei-daitokufu (Kuge was appointed staff officer, shimo-sambo office was the actual staff officer), then left first with spearhead army (Hanjiro NAKAMURA who is the Ichiban-shotai Taicho (commander of Ichiban platoon), Shinpachi MURATA who is the Niban-shotai Taicho (commander of Niban platoon) and Kunimoto SHINOHARA who is the Samban-shotai Taicho (commander of Samban platoon)), and they occupied an important point Hakone Town of Tokaido.

Saigo was appointed the Satsuma group's Sashihiki commander of the Tokaido spearhead army on February 12th, and he was appointed the Shimo-sambo staff of Tosei-daitokufu (Kuge was the appointed staff officer, the office of shimo-sambo was the actual staff officer), then left first with the spearhead army (Hanjiro NAKAMURA, who was the Ichiban-shotai Taicho (commander of Ichiban platoon), Shinpachi MURATA, who was the Niban-shotai Taicho (commander of Niban platoon), and Kunimoto SHINOHARA, who was the Samban-shotai Taicho (commander of Samban platoon)), and they occupied an important part of the Hakone Town of Tokaido.
sen.cmt: First second and third instead of ichiban niban sanban? This adds more information than a word that our readers will not know the meaning of.
sen.e: Saigo was appointed the Satsuma group's Sashihiki commander of the Tokaido spearhead army on February 12th, and he was appointed the Shimo-sanbo staff of Tosei-daitokufu (Kuge was the appointed staff officer, the office of shimo-sanbo was the actual staff officer), then left first with the spearhead army (Hanjiro NAKAMURA, who was the Ichiban-shotai Taicho (commander of the first platoon), Shinpachi MURATA, who was the Niban-shotai Taicho (commander of the second platoon), and Kunimoto SHINOHARA, who was the Sanban-shotai Taicho (commander of the third platoon), and they occupied an important part of the Hakone Town of Tokaido.
sen.cmt: 注釈補足)削除sambo →sanbo に変更しました。Samban→Sanbanに変更しました。

sen.j: 占領後、三島を本陣としたのち、静岡市に引き返した。
sen.e: After occupation, he made Mishima as headquarters, then returned to Shizuoka City.
After occupation, he moved the headquarters to Mishima, then returned to Shizuoka City.
After occupation, he moved the headquarters to Mishima, then returned to Shizuoka City.

sen.j: 3月9日、静岡で徳川慶喜の使者山岡鉄舟と会見し、徳川処分案7ヶ条を示した。
sen.e: In March 9, he had an interview with Tesshu YAMAOKA who is an envoy of Yoshinobu TOKUGAWA, and showed an action draft of Tokugawa, seven articles.
On March 9, he had an interview with Tesshu YAMAOKA, who was an envoy of Yoshinobu TOKUGAWA, and showed an action draft of Tokugawa, seven articles.
sen.cmt: "showed an action draft of Tokugawa, seven articles." that is the only part I would change, but apparently it is translated like this?
sen.e: On March 9, he had an interview with Tesshu YAMAOKA, who was an envoy of Yoshinobu TOKUGAWA, and showed an action draft of Tokugawa, seven articles.

sen.j: その後、大総督府からの3月15日江戸総攻撃の命令を受け取ると、静岡を発し、11日に江戸に着き、池上本門寺の本陣に入った。
sen.e: After that, he received a command of all-out assault of Edo, then left Shizuoka, and arrived at Edo on 11th, and joined headquarters of army of Ikegami Hommon-ji Temple.

After that, he received a command to carry out an all-out assault of Edo on March 15, then left Shizuoka, and arrived at Edo on 11th, and joined the rest of the army at the army headquarters of Ikegami Hommon-ji Temple.

After that, he received a command to carry out an all-out assault of Edo on March 15, then left Shizuoka, and arrived at Edo on 11th, and joined the rest of the army at the army headquarters of Ikegami Honmon-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: 3月15日訳抜け池上本門寺→Ikegami Hoｎmon-ji Temple

sen.j: 3月13日、14日、勝海舟と会談し、江戸城無血開城についての交渉をした。
sen.e: In March 13, 14, he had interview with Kaishu KATSU, and had negotiated about the bloodless surrender of Edo Castle.
On March 13th, 14, he had an interview with Kaishu KATSU, and had negotiated the bloodless surrender of Edo Castle.
On March 13, 14, he had an interview with Kaishu KATSU, and had negotiated the bloodless surrender of Edo Castle.

sen.j: 当時、“薩摩藩の後ろ盾”となっていたイギリスは日本との貿易に支障が出ることを恐れて“江戸総攻撃に反対”していたため、「江戸無血開城」は新政府の既定方針だった。
sen.e: At that time, England was "against the all-out assault of Edo" because they were "a supporter of domain of Satsuma" who was afraid of trouble of trading with Japan, so 'bloodless surrender of Edo Castle' was the fixed plan of new government.

At that time, England was "against the all-out assault of Edo" because she was "a supporter of the domain of Satsuma" and was afraid of trading trouble with Japan, thus, the 'bloodless surrender of Edo Castle' became the fixed plan of the new government.

At that time, England was "against the all-out assault of Edo" because they were "a supporter of the domain of Satsuma" and was afraid of trading trouble with Japan, thus, the 'bloodless surrender of Edo Castle' became the fixed plan of the new government.

sen.j: 橋本屋での2回目の会談で勝から徳川処分案を預かると、総攻撃中止を東海道軍・東山道軍に伝えるように命令し、自らは江戸を発して静岡に赴き、12日、大総督有栖川宮熾仁親王に謁見して勝案を示し、さらに静岡を発して京都に赴き、20日、朝議にかけて了承を得た。
sen.e: He received an action draft of Tokugawa from Katsu at second interview at Hashimoto-ya, he commanded to Tokaido army and Higashiyama-do army that discontinuance of the all-out assault, and he left Edo and went to Shizuoka, on 12th, he showed winning plan and audience with Daitokufu-Imperial Prince Taruhito, Arisugawa-no-miya, and also brought the Imperial court's deliberation and got an approval.

He received an action draft of Tokugawa from Katsu upon his second meeting at Hashimoto-ya, he ordered Tokaido army and Higashiyama-do army to discontinue the all-out assault, then he left Edo and went to Shizuoka; on the 12th, he showed the winning plan with Daitokufu-Imperial Prince Taruhito Arisugawa-no-miya as his audience, and also got the approval of the Imperial Court after deliberation.
sen.cmt: "He received an action draft of Tokugawa" I am not sure about how best to treat this given the manner in which action draft was translated previously.
sen.e: He received an action draft of Tokugawa from Katsu upon his second meeting at Hashimoto-ya, he ordered Tokaido army and Higashiyama-do army to discontinue the all-out assault, then he left Edo and went to Shizuoka; on the 12th, he showed the winning plan with Daitokufu-Imperial Prince Arisugawanomiya Taruhito as his audience, and also got the approval of the Imperial Court after deliberation.

sen.j: 江戸へ帰った西郷は、4月4日、勅使橋本実梁らと江戸城に乗り込み、徳川慶頼に勅書を伝え、4月11日に江戸城開城が成った。
sen.e: Saigo returned to Edo, and on April 4, he marched into Edo castle with Imperial envoy Saneyana HASHIMOTO, and told about document from Emperor to Yoshiyori TOKUGAWA, and on April 11, surrender of Edo Castle was happened.
sen.cmt: 橋本実梁→Saneyana HASHIMOTO[http://kotobank.jp/word/橋本実梁]
sen.e: Saigo returned to Edo, and on April 4, he marched into Edo castle with Imperial envoy Saneyana HASHIMOTO, and announced the document from the Emperor to Yoshiyori TOKUGAWA, and on April 11, Edo Castle was surrendered.

Saigo returned to Edo, and on April 4, he marched into Edo castle with Imperial envoy Saneyana HASHIMOTO, and announced the document from the Emperor to Yoshiyori TOKUGAWA, and on April 11, Edo Castle was surrendered.

sen.j: 江戸幕府を滅亡させた西郷は、仙台藩（伊達氏）を盟主として樹立された北部政府（奥羽越列藩同盟）との「東北戦争」に臨んだ。
sen.e: Saigo destroyed Edo shogunate, he tried have 'Tohoku War' with North Government which established with domain of Sendai (Date clan) as a leader.
sen.cmt: 仙台藩→domain of Sendai[http://100.yahoo.co.jp/detail/仙台藩/]奥羽越列藩同盟→Ouetsu-reppan alliance[http://www.e-aizu.jp/j/yukari/rekishi/boshin.html]
sen.e: Saigo destroyed the Edo shogunate, and he tried have 'Tohoku War' with North Government, which was established with domain of Sendai (Date clan) as a leader.
Saigo destroyed the Edo shogunate, and he tried have 'Tohoku War' with North Government, which was established with domain of Sendai (Date clan) as a leader.

sen.j: “南部政権”たる新政府と“北部政権”たる北部政府との、事実上の“南北戦争”である。
sen.e: New government as "West Government" and North Government as "North political power" was actual "Namboku War".
The new government of the "West regime" and the North Government of the "North regime" were in effect, "the Namboku War."
The new government of the "West regime" and the North Government of the "North regime" were in effect, "the Nanboku War."

sen.j: 「東北戦争」が長引けば、日本は再び“南北朝時代”に突入する可能性があった。
sen.e: It was possible to have "Nanbokucho era" again in Japan if "Tohoku War" was extended.
It would have been possible to revert to the "Nanbokucho era" again in Japan if "Tohoku War" were extended.
sen.cmt: need conditional due to condition contrary to fact; grammar.
sen.e: It would have been possible to revert to "the period of the Northern and Southern Courts" again in Japan if 'Tohoku War' were extended.
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合わせ"を'にNanbokucho era→the period of the Northern and Southern Courtsに変更しました。

sen.j: 5月上旬、上野の彰義隊の打破と東山軍の奥羽白河城攻防戦の救援のどちらを優先するかに悩み、江戸守備を他藩にまかせて、配下の薩摩兵を率いて白河応援に赴こうとしたが、大村益次郎の反対にあい、上野攻撃を優先することにした。
sen.e: In beginning of May, he was concerned about which army should support first, between the abolish of Shogitai in Ueno and the fierce battle of Ou-Shirakawa Castle, he was entrusted to secure Edo to other domain, and try to support Shirakawa with direct soldier of Satsuma, but he took attack Ueno first because of Masujiro OMORI's opposition.

In the beginning of May, he was concerned about what the army should do first, the abolition of Shogitai in Ueno or the fierce battle of Ou-Shirakawa Castle, and he was depended upon to secure Edo for the other domain, and try to support Shirakawa with direct soldier of Satsuma, but he took attack Ueno first because of Masujiro OMORI's opposition.

sen.j: 5月15日、上野戦争が始まり、正面の黒門口攻撃を指揮し、これを破った。
sen.e: In May 15, Ueno War was started, and he commanded of attack the front gate, Kuromonguchi, and broke in to it.
In May 15, Ueno War broke out, and he commanded the assult of the front gate, Kuromonguchi, and stormed it.
In May 15, Ueno War broke out, and he commanded the assult of the front gate, Kuromonguchi, and stormed it.

sen.j: 5月末、江戸を出帆。
sen.e: End of May, sailed from Edo.
At the end of May, he sailed from Edo.
sen.cmt: sentence is not grammatical in Jse, but it sounds better as a grammatical sentence in the English.
sen.e: At the end of May, he sailed from Edo.

sen.j: 京都で戦況を報告し、6月9日に藩主忠義に随って京都を発し、14日に鹿児島に帰着した。
sen.e: He informed the situation about the war in Kyoto, and June 9, he left Kyoto that followed by load of domain Tadayoshi and returned to Kagoshima on 14th.
He reported the state of the war in Kyoto, and on June 9, he left Kyoto followed by load of domain Tadayoshi, and returned to Kagoshima on 14th.
sen.cmt: Load of domain? Once above I changed load to lord, but now that I am seeing it twice I am not sure what to do with it.
sen.e: He reported the state of the war in Kyoto, and on June 9, he left Kyoto followed by load of domain Tadayoshi, and returned to Kagoshima on 14th.

sen.j: この頃から健康を害し、日当山温泉で湯治した。
sen.e: Around this time, he hurt his health, and treated himself in Hinatayama Onsen Hot Spring.
Around this time, he his deteriorated and he treated himself in Hinatayama Onsen Hot Spring.
Around this time, he was deteriorated and he treated himself in Hinatayama Onsen Hot Spring.

sen.j: 北陸道軍の戦況が思わしくないため、西郷の出馬が要請され、7月23日、薩摩藩北陸出征軍の総差引（司令官）を命ぜられ、8月2日に鹿児島を出帆し、10日に越後国柏崎に到着した。
sen.e: Running of Saigo was requested because situation of the war wasn't going well, in July 23, he was appointed the Sosasihiki commander of Satsuma domain army going to Hokuriku, and August 2, sailed from Kagoshima and arrived at Kashiwazaki, Echigo-no-kuni on 10th.

Saigo was asked to take command because the war was not progressin well, and on July 23 he was appointed the Sosasihiki commander of the Satsuma domain army going to Hokuriku, and on August 2, he sailed from Kagoshima and arrived at Kashiwazaki, Echigo-no-kuni on 10th.
sen.cmt: Running of Saigo --> XXXXX very bad phrasing.. Lots of changed
sen.e: Saigo was asked to take command because the war was not progressin well, and on July 23 he was appointed the Sosasihiki commander of the Satsuma Domain army going to Hokuriku, and on August 2, he sailed from Kagoshima and arrived at Kashiwazaki, Echigo Province on 10th.

sen.j: 来て間もない14日、新潟市五十嵐戦で負傷した二弟の吉二郎の死亡を聞いた。
sen.e: On the 14th, right after his arrival, he heard that the second brother Yoshijiro's death that hurt at the battle at Ikarashi, Niigata City.
On the 14th, right after his arrival, he heard of his brother Yoshijiro's death, which resulted from wounds received at the battle at Ikarashi, Niigata City.
sen.cmt: "which resulted from wounds " added lots of natural phrasing,
sen.e: On the 14th, right after his arrival, he heard of his brother Yoshijiro's death, which resulted from wounds received at the battle at Ikarashi, Niigata City.

sen.j: 藩の差引の立場から北陸道本営（新発田市）には赴かなかったが、総督府下参謀の黒田清隆・山縣有朋らは西郷のもとをしばしば訪れた。
sen.e: He didn't go to headquarters of Hokurikudo (Shibata City) because of his position which is the command of the domain, but Shimo-sambo staff, Kioytaka KURODA and Aritomo YAMAGATA came to visit Saigo sometimes.

He did not go to headquarters of Hokurikudo (Shibata City) because of his position, which was to command the domain, but Shimo-sambo staff, Kioytaka KURODA and Aritomo YAMAGATA came to visit Saigo sometimes.

He did not go to headquarters of Hokurikudo (Shibata City) because of his position, which was to command the domain, but Shimo-sanbo staff, Kioytaka KURODA and Aritomo YAMAGATA came to visit Saigo sometimes.

sen.j: 新政府軍に対して連戦連勝を誇った庄内藩も、仙台藩、会津藩が降伏すると9月27日に降伏し、ここに「東北戦争」は新政府の勝利で幕を閉じた。
sen.e: After the domain of Shonai, domain of Sendai and domain of Aizu capitulated, and the domain of Shonai that won the all battles against new government army was also capitulated on September 27, and 'Tohoku War' was finished by winning of the new government.
sen.cmt: 庄内藩→domain of Shonai[http://100.yahoo.co.jp/detail/庄内藩/]会津藩→domain of Aizu[http://kotobank.jp/word/会津藩]
sen.e: After the domain of Shonai, the domain of Sendai and the domain of Aizu capitulated, and the domain of Shonai that won the all battles against the new government's army also capitulated on September 27, and the 'Tohoku War' ended with the victory of the new government.

After the domain of Shonai, the domain of Sendai and the domain of Aizu capitulated, and the domain of Shonai that won the all battles against the new government's army also capitulated on September 27, and the 'Tohoku War' ended with the victory of the new government.

sen.j: このとき、西郷は黒田に指示して、庄内藩に寛大な処分をさせた。
sen.e: At that time, Saigo gave a lenient entrustment to domain of Shonai which instructed to Kuroda.
At that time, Saigo gave instructions to Kuroda and gave a lenient entrustment to the domain of Shonai.
At that time, Saigo gave instructions to Kuroda and gave a lenient entrustment to the domain of Shonai.

sen.j: この後、庄内を発し、江戸・京都・大坂を経由して、11月初めに鹿児島に帰り、日当山温泉で湯治した。
sen.e: After that, he left Shonai and through Edo, Kyoto and Osaka and returned to Kagoshima, and treated himself at Hinatayama Onsen Hot Spring.
After that, he left Shonai, and returned to Kagoshima through Edo, Kyoto and Osaka, and treated himself to the Hinatayama Onsen Hot Spring.
After that, he left Shonai, and returned to Kagoshima through Edo at the beginning of November, Kyoto and Osaka, and treated himself to the Hinatayama Onsen Hot Spring.

tit.e: The period of Satsuma domain's participation in government
The period of the Satsuma domain's participation in the government
The period of the Satsuma Domain's participation in the government

sen.j: 明治2年（1869年）2月25日、藩主忠義が自ら日当山温泉まで来て要請したので、26日、鹿児島へ帰り、参政・一代寄合となった。
sen.e: In February 25, 1869, load of domain Tadayoshi himself came to Hinatayama Onsen Hot Spring and requested, on 26tn he returned to Kagoshima and became a Sansei (job to participate in national administration) and Ichidai-yoriai (personal-to-a person family rank).

On February 25, 1869, because load of domain Tadayoshi himself came to Hinatayama Onsen (a Hot Spring) and requested it, on 26th he returned to Kagoshima and became a Sansei (a job entailing participation in national administration) and Ichidai-yoriai (personal-to-a person family rank).
sen.cmt: Onsen Hot Spring (redundant) (personal-to-a person family rank). Almost certainly incorrect
sen.e: On February 25, 1869, because load of domain Tadayoshi himself came to Hinatayama Onsen (a Hot Spring) and requested it, on 26th he returned to Kagoshima and became a Sansei (a job entailing participation in national administration) and Ichidai-yoriai (personal-to-a person family rank).

sen.j: 以来、藩政の改革（藩政と家政を分け、藩庁を知政所、家政所を内務局とし、一門・重臣の特権を止め、藩が任命した地頭（役人）が行政を行うことにした）や兵制の整備（常備隊の設置）を精力的に行い、戊辰参戦の功があった下級武士の不満解消につとめた。
sen.e: After that, he worked energetically for revolution of domain duties(divide the domain duties and the domestic economy, change the government building of domain to Chiseisho prefecture government, domestic economy service changed as Interior Ministry, stop the prerogative for sept and main retainers, Jiao (officer) who appointed by domain takes administration), and reorganized the system of soldier (installment of Jobutai (regular armu)), and tried to cancellation of complaint of samurai in the lower grade who contributed at Boshin War.

After that, he worked energetically for redivision of the domain duties (to divide the domain duties and the domestic economy, to change the government building of the domain to Chiseisho prefecture government, to move the domestic economy services to the Interior Ministry, to stop the prerogative for sept and main retainers, and a Jiao (officer) who is appointed by the domain as an administrator), and reorganized the division of soldiers (i.e. the creation of the Jobutai (regular army)), finally, he tried to of complaint of samurai in the lower grade who contributed at Boshin War.
sen.cmt: It says "sept" is verified on the web … but it does not sound plausible
sen.e: After that, he worked energetically for redivision of the domain duties (to divide the domain duties and the domestic economy, to change the government building of the domain to Chiseisho prefecture government, to move the domestic economy services to the Interior Ministry, to stop the prerogative for sept and main retainers, and a Jiao (officer) who is appointed by the domain as an administrator), and reorganized the division of soldiers (i.e. the creation of the Jobutai (regular army)), finally, he tried to of complaint of samurai in the lower grade who contributed at Boshin War.

sen.j: 文久2年（1862年）に沖永良部島遠島・知行没収になって以来、無高であった（役米料だけが与えられていた）が、3月、許されて再び高持ちになった。
sen.e: He was Mutaka (no crop yields) since 1862, exiled to Okinoerabu-jim island and forfeited the Chigyo fief(received only salary for the lowest ranked retainer) but, he was permitted and became Takamochi (farmer resisted in Kenchi book) on March.

Because the fields had been Mutaka, or barren, since 1862, he was exiled to Okinoerabu-jima island and made to forfeit the Chigyo fief (thus, he received only the salary of a lowest ranking retainer) but, he was reinstated and became Takamochi (farmer resisted in Kenchi book) on March.
sen.cmt: substantial revision "(farmer resisted in Kenchi book)" definitely seems wrong.
sen.e: Because the fields had been Mutaka, or barren, since 1862, he was exiled to Oki-no-erabujima island island and made to forfeit the Chigyo fief (thus, he received only the salary of a lowest ranking retainer) but, he was reinstated and became Takamochi (farmer resisted in Kenchi book) on March.

sen.j: 5月1日、箱館戦争の応援に総差引として藩兵を率いて鹿児島を出帆した。
sen.e: In May 1, he sailed from Kagoshima with soldiers of domain to support Hakodate War as Sosasihiki commander.

sen.e: On May 1st, he sailed from Kagoshima with some soldiers of the domain to assist in the Hakodate War as the Sosasihiki commander.
On May 1st, he sailed from Kagoshima with some soldiers of the domain to assist in the Hakodate War as the Sosasihiki commander.

sen.j: 途中、東京で出張許可を受け、5月25日、箱館に着いたが、18日に箱館・五稜郭が開城し、戦争はすでに終わっていた（戊辰戦争の終了）。
sen.e: On the way, he received permission of travel to Tokyo, and arrived in Hakodate in May 25, but, Hakodate and Goryokaku opened castle on 18th, the war was already finished (end of Boshin War).

On the way, he received permission to travel to Tokyo, and arrived in Hakodate on May 25th, but, Hakodate and Goryokaku castle had already reopened (on the 18th), the war was already finished (this was the end of Boshin War).

On the way, he received permission to travel to Tokyo, and arrived in Hakodate on May 25th, but, Hakodate and Goryokaku castle had already reopened on the 18th, the war was already finished (this was the end of Boshin War).

sen.j: 帰路、東京に寄った際、6月2日の王政復古の功により、賞典禄永世禄2000石を下賜された。
sen.e: On the way back, when he stopped at Tokyo, he received 2000 goku (crop yields) as Shotenroku and Eiseiroku (premiums) for the contribution of the restoration of monarchy in June 2.
On the way back, when he stopped in Tokyo and received 2000 goku (a crop yield measurement) as Shotenroku and Eiseiroku (premiums) for his contribution to the restoration of monarchy in June 2.
On the way back, when he stopped in Tokyo and received 2000 goku (a crop yield measurement) as Shotenroku and Eiseiroku (premiums) for his contribution to the restoration of monarchy in June 2.

sen.j: このときに残留の命を受けたが、断って、鹿児島へ帰った。
sen.e: At that time he got an order of stay but he declined and returned to Kagoshima.
At that time, he was ordered to stay there, but he refused and returned to Kagoshima.
sen.cmt: If he can simply "decline" is "order" the right word? Changed to refused.
sen.e: At that time, he was ordered to stay there, but he refused and returned to Kagoshima.

sen.j: 7月、鹿児島郡武村に屋敷地を購入した。
sen.e: In June, he purchased the land for house in Take-mura, Kagoshima-gun.
In June, he purchased land for a house in Take-mura, Kagoshima-gun.
sen.cmt: Consider changing mura to village and gun to county..

sen.j: 9月26日、正三位に叙せられた。
sen.e: He received the Shosammi rank in September 26.
He received the rank of Shosammi on September 26.
He received the rank of Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank) on September 26.
sen.cmt: 説明補足Shosammi→Shosanmiに変更しました。

sen.j: 12月に藩主名で位階返上の案文を書き、このときに隆盛という名を初めて用いた。
sen.e: He wrote a draft of returning of order which named by load of domain, and he used name Takamori first time.
He wrote a draft of an order to return which named by load of domain, and he used the name Takamori for the first time at this time.
sen.cmt: IMPORTANT: is "order to return " the correct term here?
sen.e: He wrote a draft of an order to return which named by load of domain in December, and he used the name Takamori for the first time at this time.

sen.j: 明治3年（1870年）1月18日に参政を辞め、相談役になり、7月3日に相談役を辞め、執務役となっていたが、太政官から鹿児島藩大参事に任命された（辞令交付は8月）。
sen.e: In January 18, 1870, he resigned participation in the government and became an adviser, and in July he resigned adviser and became Shitsumu-yuaku, but he was appointed the Daisanji (second to a governor) of Kagoshima domain from Dajokan (Grand Council of state) (the date of announcement was August).

On January 18th, 1870, he resigned from his position in the government and became an advisor, and in July he resigned his position as advisor and became a Shitsumu-yuaku, but he was appointed the Daisanji (second to a governor) of the domain of Kagoshima by the Dajokan (The Grand Council of state) (the date of announcement was in August).
sen.cmt: basic misspellings, grammar, and phrasing issues, like always.
sen.e: On January 18, 1870, he resigned from his position in the government and became an advisor, and in July 3, he resigned his position as advisor and became a Shitsumu-yuaku, but he was appointed the Daisanji (second to a governor) of the domain of Kagoshima by the Dajokan (The Grand Council of state) (the date of announcement was in August).

tit.cmt: Although sometimes it is better to translate it differently, as above in 331

tit.e: The reformation of the nation's government and the abolition of clans and establishment of prefectures.

sen.j: 明治3年（1870年）2月13日、西郷は村田新八・大山巌・池上四郎 (薩摩藩士)らを伴って長州藩に赴き、奇兵隊脱隊騒擾の状を視察し、奇兵隊からの助援の請を断わり、藩知事毛利広封に謁見したのちに鹿児島へ帰った。
sen.e: In February 13, 1870, Saigo went to domain of Choshu with Shimpachi MURATA, Iwao OYAMA and Shiro IKEGAMI (feudal retainer of Satsuma), and inspected the situation of the mayhem of dropping out of Kiheitai troop, and declined the request of support from Kiheitai Army, and after visit governor of domain Hiroatsu MORI, returned to Kagoshima.

On February 13th, 1870, Saigo went to the domain of Choshu with Shimpachi MURATA, Iwao OYAMA and Shiro IKEGAMI (a feudal retainer of Satsuma), and inspected the chaotic situation of the Kiheitai troops, and declining the request of support from the Kiheitai Army, he visited governor of the domain Hiroatsu MORI, then returned to Kagoshima.

On February 13th, 1870, Saigo went to the domain of Choshu with Shinpachi MURATA, Iwao OYAMA and Shiro IKEGAMI (a feudal retainer of Satsuma), and inspected the chaotic situation of the Kiheitai troops, and declining the request of support from the Kiheitai Army, he visited governor of the domain Hiroatsu MORI, then returned to Kagoshima.

sen.j: 同年7月27日、鹿児島藩士・集議院徴士横山安武（森有礼の実兄）が時勢を非難する諫言書を太政官正院の門に投じて自刃した。
sen.e: In July 27 in same year, feudal retainer of Kagoshima and member of Shugi-in Yasutake YOKOYAMA (real older brother of Arinori MORI) threw the Kangensho (document to say advices to the higher ranked people) that was about criticism for situation to the gate of Dajokan-Sei'in (chief of Grand Council of state) and suicide with a sword.
sen.cmt: 横山安武→Yasutake YOKOYAMA[http://kotobank.jp/word/横山安武]森有礼→Arinori MORI[http://kotobank.jp/word/森有礼]
sen.e: On July 27 of that same year, the feudal retainer of Kagoshima and member of the Shugi-in, Yasutake YOKOYAMA, (the truel older brother of Arinori MORI) threw the Kangensho (a document containing advice to the highly ranked people) that criticized the times to the gate of the Dajokan-Sei'in (chief of Grand Council of state) and committed suicide with his sword.
sen.cmt: might require further clean up depending on your reading
sen.e: On July 27 of that same year, the feudal retainer of Kagoshima and member of the Shugi-in, Yasutake YOKOYAMA, (the truel older brother of Arinori MORI) threw the Kangensho (a document containing advice to the highly ranked people) that criticized the times to the gate of the Dajokan-Seiin (chief of Grand Council of state) and committed suicide with his sword.

sen.j: これに衝撃を受けた西郷は、役人の驕奢により新政府から人心が離れつつあり、薩摩人がその悪弊に染まることを憂慮して、薩摩出身の心ある軍人・役人だけでも鹿児島に帰らせるために、9月、池上を東京へ派遣した。
sen.e: Saigo was shocked about that, and he was concerned about the people's feeling is leaving from the new government by officer's luxury, and Satsuma citizen might get a bad habit from that, and sent Ikegami to Tokyo to bring the thoughtful soldiers from Satsuma and officers back to Kagoshima.

Saigo was shocked about that, and he was concerned about distancing the people due to the extravagance of the officers of the new government, and that the Satsuma citizens might develop bad habits as a result, and therefore he sent Ikegami to Tokyo to bring back only the thoughtful soldiers and officers from Satsuma back to Kagoshima.
sen.cmt: peoples feelings leaving --> distancing the people..
sen.e: Saigo was shocked about that, and he was concerned about distancing the people due to the extravagance of the officers of the new government, and that the Satsuma citizens might develop bad habits as a result, and therefore he sent Ikegami to Tokyo to bring back only the thoughtful soldiers and officers from Satsuma back to Kagoshima.

sen.j: 12月、危機感を抱いた政府から勅使岩倉具視・副使大久保利通が西郷の出仕を促すために鹿児島へ派遣され、西郷と交渉したが難航し、欧州視察から帰国した西郷従道の説得でようやく政治改革のために上京することを承諾した。
sen.e: In December, Imperial envoy Tomomi Iwakura and vice envoy Toshimichi OKUBO were sent to Kagoshima by government who had sense of crisis to urge of serving of Saigo, and they negotiated with Saigo but it ran into difficulties, and finally approved to come to Kyoto for revolution of politics by persuasion of Judo SAIGO who came home by inspection of Western countries.

In December, the Imperial envoy Tomomi Iwakura and vice envoy Toshimichi OKUBO were sent to Kagoshima by the government, which sensed a crisis and urged Saigo to serve them, and they negotiated with Saigo to that end, but ran into difficulties, and finally persuaded Judo SAIGO, who had come home after inspection of Western countries, to come to Kyoto due to the political turmoil.

In December, the Imperial envoy Tomomi IWAKURA and vice envoy Toshimichi OKUBO were sent to Kagoshima by the government, which sensed a crisis and urged Saigo to serve them, and they negotiated with Saigo to that end, but ran into difficulties, and finally persuaded Judo SAIGO, who had come home after inspection of Western countries, to come to Kyoto due to the political turmoil.

sen.j: 明治4年（1871年）1月3日、西郷と大久保は池上を伴い「政府改革案」を以て上京するため鹿児島を出帆した。
sen.e: In January 3, 1871, Saigo and Okubo sailed from Tokyo with Ikegami with 'draft of reinventing government'.

sen.j: 8日、西郷・大久保らは木戸を訪問して会談した。
sen.e: Saigo and Okubo visited Kido and had a conference on 8th.
Saigo and Okubo visited Kido and had a meeting there on the 8th.
Saigo and Okubo visited Kido and had a meeting there on the 8th.

sen.j: 16日、西郷・大久保・木戸・池上らは三田尻を出航して土佐に向かった。
sen.e: Saigo, Okubo, Kido and Ikegami sailed from Mitajiri to Tosa on 16th,
Saigo, Okubo, Kido and Ikegami sailed from Mitajiri to Tosa on the 16th.

sen.j: 17日、西郷一行は土佐に到着し、藩知事山内豊範・板垣退助と会談した。
sen.e: Saigo group arrived to Tosa, and had a conference with governor of domain Toyonori YAMAUCHI and Taisuke ITAGAKI on 17th.

sen.j: 22日、西郷・大久保・木戸・板垣・池上らは神戸に着き、大坂で山縣有朋と会談し、一同そろって大坂を出航し東京へ向かった。
sen.e: Saigo, Okubo, Kido, Itagaki and Ikegami arrived in Kobe and had a conference with Aritomo YAMAGATA and sailed from Osaka to Tokyo all together on 22nd.
Saigo, Okubo, Kido, Itagaki and Ikegami arrived in Kobe and had a conference with Aritomo YAMAGATA, then sailed from Osaka to Tokyo together on the 22nd.

sen.j: 東京に着いた一行は2月8日に会談し、御親兵の創設を決めた。
sen.e: The group arrived to Tokyo and had a conference on February 8, and decided to establish the Goshimpei (army to convoy the Emperor).
The group arrived in Tokyo and had a conference on February 8th, then decided to establish the Goshimpei (army to convoy the Emperor).

sen.j: 2月13日に鹿児島藩・山口藩・高知藩の兵を徴し、御親兵に編成する旨の命令が出されたので、西郷は忠義を奉じ、常備隊4大隊約5000名を率いて上京し、4月21日に東京市ヶ谷旧尾張藩邸に駐屯した。
sen.e: On February 13, the soldier was collected from domain of Kagoshima, domain of Yamaguchi and domain of Kochi because the order was announced to organize the Goshimpei, Saigo went to Kyoto with four Jobitai that was about five thousand of soldiers by Tadayoshi's order.

sen.j: この御親兵以外にも東山道鎮台（石巻）と西海道鎮台（小倉）を設置し、これらの武力を背景に、6月25日から内閣人員の入れ替えを始めた。
sen.e: In addition to this Goshimpei, it established Tosando Chindai Army (Ishinomaki) and Saikaido Chindai Army (Kokura), and started to exchange the cabinet from June 25, with background of military power.

sen.j: 7月5日、制度取調会の議長となり、6日に委員の決定権委任の勅許を得た。

sen.j: これより新官制・内閣人事・廃藩置県等を審議し、大久保・木戸らと公私にわたって議論し、朝議を経て、14日、天皇が在京の藩知事（旧藩主）を集め、廃藩置県の詔書を出した。
sen.e: These of the reason, he deliberate on system of new bureaucracy, personnel changes of cabinet and abolition of clans and establishment of prefectures, and discussed with Okubo and Kido both officially and privately, and approved by Imperial court and issued an Imperial prescript of abolition of clans and establishment of prefectures.

For these reasons, he deliberated on the system of the new bureaucracy, personnel changes in the cabinet, and on the abolition of clans and establishment of prefectures, and he also held discussions with Okubo and Kido both officially and privately, and issued an Imperial prescript of the abolition of clans and the establishment of prefectures that was approved by the Imperial court.
sen.cmt: lots of changes to phrasing; grammar
sen.e: For these reasons, he deliberated on the system of the new bureaucracy, personnel changes in the cabinet, and on the abolition of clans and establishment of prefectures, and he also held discussions with Okubo and Kido both officially and privately, and issued an Imperial prescript of the abolition of clans and the establishment of prefectures that was approved by the Imperial Court on the 14th.

sen.j: また、この間に新官制の決定や内閣人事も順次行い、7月29日頃には以下のような顔ぶれになった（ただし、外務卿岩倉の右大臣兼任だけは10月中旬にずれ込んだ）。

sen.e: This is how it came about, which supplied power of soldier as Goshimpei to each load of domain, and suddenly carried out an abolition of clans and establishment of prefectures with took everything out from them, it was similar to tricked attack.

The reorganization was carried out as follows: soldiers were supplied as Goshimpei to each load of domain, and then suddenly clans were abolished and prefectures were established; thus, it was similar to sneak attack.

tit.e: Rusu-naikaku (acting cabinet while heads of government are away)
Rusu-naikaku (acting cabinet while heads of government are away)
Rusu-naikaku (acting cabinet while heads of government are away)

sen.j: 明治4年（1871年）11月12日、三条・西郷らに留守内閣（留守政府）をまかせ、特命全権大使岩倉具視、副使木戸孝允・大久保利通・伊藤博文・山口尚芳ら外交使節団が条約改正のために横浜から欧米各国へ出発した（随員中に宮内大丞村田新八もいた）。
sen.e: In November 12, 1871, Sanjo and Saigo was entrusted with Rusu-naikaku (cabinet while heads of government are away), the group of the ambassador which is ambassador extraordinary and plenipotentiary Tomomi IWAKURA, vice ambassador Takayoshi KIDO, Toshimichi OKUBO, Hirobumi ITO and Naoyoshi YAMAGUCHI went to Europe and the North America for revision of treaty (Kunai-taijo (post of Imperial Household Ministry) Shinpachi MURATA was one of the attendant).
sen.cmt: 伊藤博文→Hirobumi ITO[http://kotobank.jp/word/伊藤博文]山口尚芳→Naoyoshi YAMAGUCHI[http://kotobank.jp/word/山口尚芳]
sen.e: On November 12th, 1871, Sanjo and Saigo were entrusted with the duty of Rusu-naikaku (the acting cabinet while the heads of government are away), because a group of ambassadors, namely the ambassador who is the ambassador extraordinary and plenipotentiary Tomomi IWAKURA, vice ambassadors Takayoshi KIDO, Toshimichi OKUBO, Hirobumi ITO and Naoyoshi YAMAGUCHI went to Europe and the North America for revision of a treaty (Kunai-taijo (a post in the Imperial Household Ministry), and Shinpachi MURATA was one of the attendant).
sen.cmt: in --> on the XXth S/V grammar and phrasing
sen.e: On November 12, 1871, Sanjo and Saigo were entrusted with the duty of Rusu-naikaku (the acting cabinet while the heads of government are away), because a group of ambassadors, namely the ambassador who is the ambassador extraordinary and plenipotentiary Tomomi IWAKURA, vice ambassadors Takayoshi KIDO, Toshimichi OKUBO, Hirobumi ITO and Naoyoshi YAMAGUCHI went to Europe and the North America for revision of a treaty (Kunai-taijo (a post in the Imperial Household Ministry), and Shinpachi MURATA was one of the attendant).

sen.j: 西郷らは明治4年（1871年）からの官制・軍制の改革および警察制度の整備を続け、5年（1872年）2月には兵部省を廃止して陸軍省・海軍省を置き、3月には御親兵を廃止して近衛兵を置いた。
sen.e: Saigo and others kept maintaining the reform of the system of bureaucracy, the system of military, and also system of police, in February 1872, they abolished the Ministry of Hyobu and installed the Ministry of War and Ministry of the Navy, and in March the Goshimpei was abolished and installed guardee.

Saigo and others kept maintaining the reform of the system of bureaucracy, the system of military, and also system of police, in February 1872, they abolished the Ministry of Hyobu and installed the Ministry of War and Ministry of the Navy, and in March the Goshimpei was abolished and installed guardee.
sen.cmt: lots of changes to prhasing and unnatural text
sen.e: Saigo and others kept maintaining the reform of the system of bureaucracy from 1871, the system of military, and also system of police, in February 1872, they abolished the Ministry of Hyobu and installed the Ministry of War and Ministry of the Navy, and in March the Goshimpei was abolished and installed guardee.

sen.j: 5月から7月にかけては天皇の関西・中国・西国巡幸に随行した。
sen.e: From May to July, he attended tours Kansai, Chugoku, Saigoku for Emperor.
From May to July, he attended processions in Kansai, Chugoku, Saigoku for the Emperor.
From May to July, he attended processions in Kansai, Chugoku, Saigoku for the Emperor.

sen.j: 鹿児島行幸から帰る途中、近衛兵の紛議を知り、急ぎ帰京して解決をはかり、7月29日、陸軍元帥兼参議に任命された。
sen.e: On the way home from Kagoshima which was the Emperor's visit, he found out the complicated discussion of guardee, and hurried to Kyoto to settle the problem, and he was appointed to be the Marshal of Army, concurrently Sangi councilor in July 29.

On the way home from Kagoshima, where he had been visiting the Emperor, he heard of the complicated discussion of guardee, and hurried to Kyoto to settle the problem, and he was appointed to be the Marshal of the Army, and concurrently Sangi councilor in July 29.
sen.cmt: The reader will probably not know anything about the "guardee" consider adding context..
sen.e: On the way home from Kagoshima, where he had been visiting the Emperor, he heard of the complicated discussion of guardee, and hurried to Kyoto to settle the problem, and he was appointed to be the Marshal of the Army, and concurrently Sangi councilor in July 29.

sen.j: このときに山城屋事件で多額の軍事費を使い込んだ近衛都督山縣有朋が辞任したため、薩長の均衡をとるために三弟西郷従道を近衛副都督から解任した。
sen.e: At that time, Konoe-totoku (regulator of Konoefu) Aritomo YAMAGATA resigned because he spent a lot of expense of military affair, the third brother Judo SAIGO was discharged from Fuku Konoe-totoku (vice regulator of Konoefu) to take balance of Saccho.

At that time, Konoe-totoku (the regulator of Konoefu) Aritomo YAMAGATA resigned due to high expenses relating to military affairs, and his brother Judo SAIGO was discharged from Fuku Konoe-totoku (vice regulator of Konoefu) to take control of Saccho.
sen.cmt: No good way to incorporate the information "3rd".. Nor is it as important in English. Balance --> control
sen.e: At that time, Konoe-totoku (the regulator of Konoefu) Aritomo YAMAGATA resigned due to high expenses relating to military affairs, and his brother Judo SAIGO was discharged from Fuku Konoe-totoku (vice regulator of Konoefu) to take control of Saccho.

sen.j: 明治6年5月に徴兵令が実施されたのに伴い、元帥が廃止されたので、西郷は陸軍大将兼参議となった。
sen.e: In May 1873, the marshal was abolished with the conscription ordinance was effected, Saigo became a General of Army, concurrently Sangi councilor.
In May of 1873, the position of marshal was abolished along with the conscription ordinance being effected, Saigo became a General in the Army, and was concurrently Sangi councilor.

sen.e: In May 1873, the position of marshal was abolished along with the conscription ordinance being effected, Saigo became a General in the Army, and was concurrently Sangi councilor.

sen.j: なお、明治4年（1871年）11月の岩倉使節出発から明治6年（1873年）9月の岩倉帰国までの間に西郷主導留守内閣が施行した主な政策は以下の通りである。
sen.e: But, from departure of Iwakura Mission in November 1871, to Iwakura returned in September 1873, Saigo organized Rusu-naikaku that was enforced the policies is as below.
However, after departure for the Iwakura Mission in November 1871, to Iwakura returned to Japan in September 1873, and Saigo organized the Rusu-naikaku and the policies below were enacted.
