sen.j: 対朝鮮（当時は李氏朝鮮）問題は、明治元年（1868年）に李朝が維新政府の国書の受け取りを拒絶したことに端を発しているが、この国書受け取りと朝鮮との修好条約締結問題は留守内閣時にも一向に進展していなかった。
sen.e: Against Korea (at the time it was Yi Dynasty Korea) problem was started that Yi Dynasty Korea refused the sovereign's message for restoration government in 1868, this accepting the sovereign's message and the conclusion problem of treaty of amity with Korea didn't developed when Rusu-naikaku was working.

In Korea trouble arose (at the time Korea was ruled by the Yi Dynasty) in that Korea under the Yi Dynasty refused the sovereign's message for restoration of the government in 1868; however, neither the acceptance of the sovereign's message nor the conclusion of the problem of the treaty of amity with Korea progressed when the Rusu-naikaku was in power.
sen.cmt: in power… consider also "in session" etc.
sen.e: In Korea trouble arose (at the time Korea was ruled by the Yi Dynasty) in that Korea under the Yi Dynasty refused the sovereign's message for restoration of the government in 1868; however, neither the acceptance of the sovereign's message nor the conclusion of the problem of the treaty of amity with Korea progressed when the Rusu-naikaku was in power.

sen.j: そこで、進展しない原因とその対策を知る必要があって、西郷・板垣退助・副島種臣らは、調査のために、明治5年（1872年）8月15日に池上四郎・武市正幹・彭城中平を清国・ロシア・朝鮮探偵として満洲に派遣し（鹿児島県史料・忠義公史料』第7巻）、27日に北村重頼・河村洋与・別府晋介（景長）を花房外務大丞随員（実際は変装しての探偵）として釜山に派遣した。
sen.e: They need to know the source that doesn't develop and measures for that, Saigo, Taisuke ITAGAKI and Taneomi SOEJIMA sent Shiro IKEGAMI, Seikan TAKEICHI, and Chuhei SAKAKI to Manchuria as a spy of Russia/ Korea for research (#7 of Tadayoshi's historical data (historical data of Kagoshima Prefecture)) in August 15, 1872,
sen.cmt: 副島種臣→Taneomi SOEJIMA[http://kotobank.jp/word/副島種臣]彭城中平→Chuhei SAKAKI[http://kotobank.jp/word/彭城中平]北村重頼→Shigeyori KITAMURA[http://kotobank.jp/word/北村重頼]河村洋与→Hiroyo KAWAMURA (河村洋与)[定訳不明,該当する読み方を見つけることができませんでした。]別府晋介（景長）→Shinsuke (Kagenaga) BEPPU[http://kotobank.jp/word/別府晋介]
sen.e: Thus, it was necessary to know why they were not progressing and how to counteract that, so Saigo, Taisuke ITAGAKI and Taneomi SOEJIMA sent Shiro IKEGAMI, Seikan TAKEICHI, and Chuhei SAKAKI to Manchuria to spy on Russia/Korea so they could better understand this (volume 7 of Tadayoshi's historical data (the historical data of Kagoshima Prefecture)) on August 15, 1872,
sen.cmt: Basically retranslated. Was impossible to tell what was going on from trans. 1
sen.e: Thus, it was necessary to know why they were not progressing and how to counteract that, so Saigo, Taisuke ITAGAKI and Taneomi SOEJIMA sent Shiro IKEGAMI, Seikan TAKEICHI, and Chuhei SAKAKI to Manchuria to spy on Qing, Russia and Korea so they could better understand this (volume 7 of Tadayoshi's historical data (the historical data of Kagoshima Prefecture)) on August 15, 1872,

sen.j: 明治6年（1873年）の対朝鮮問題をめぐる政府首脳の軋轢は、6月に外務少記森山茂が釜山から帰って、李朝政府が日本の国書を拒絶したうえ、使節を侮辱し、居留民の安全が脅かされているので、朝鮮から撤退するか、武力で修好条約を締結させるかの裁決が必要であると報告し、それを外務少輔上野景範が内閣に議案として提出したことに始まる。
sen.e: Discord of the government and the executives for the problem against Korea in 1873 was started after Shigeru MORIYAMA with Gaimu-shoki rank returned from Busan, Yi Dynasty Korea insulted ambassador, after refused Japanese sovereign's message, so he reported to need a decision which is evacuate from Korea, or conclude the conclusion problem of treaty of amity by force, and Kagenori UENO with Gaimu-sho title submitted these report as a bill to ministry.
sen.cmt: Discord in the government and amongst the executives regarding the problem in Korea in 1873 began after Shigeru MORIYAMA, who held the rank of Gaimu-shoki, returned from Busan, and the Yi Dynasty Korea insulted the ambassador after refusing the Japanese sovereign's message, so he reported that it would be necessary to either decide to evacuate from Korea, or conclude the conclusion problem of treaty of amity by force, and Kagenori UENO with Gaimu-sho title submitted these report as a bill to ministry.
sen.e: Discord in the government and amongst the executives regarding the problem in Korea in 1873 began after Shigeru MORIYAMA, who held the rank of Gaimu-shoki, returned from Busan, and the Yi Dynasty Korea insulted the ambassador after refusing the Japanese sovereign's message, so he reported that it would be necessary to either decide to evacuate from Korea, or to conclude the conclusion problem of treaty of amity by force, and Kagenori UENO with Gaimu-sho title submitted these reports to the ministry as a bill.
sen.cmt: sovereign's message for 国書 appears to be correct
sen.e: Discord in the government and amongst the executives regarding the problem in Korea in 1873 began after Shigeru MORIYAMA, who held the rank of Gaimu-shoki, returned from Busan, and the Yi Dynasty Korea insulted the ambassador after refusing the Japanese sovereign's message, so he reported that it would be necessary to either decide to evacuate from Korea, or to conclude the conclusion problem of treaty of amity by force, and Kagenori UENO with Gaimu-sho title submitted these reports to the ministry as a bill.

sen.j: この議案は6月12日から7参議により審議された。
sen.e: This bill was discussed by seven councilors from June 12.
This bill was discussed by seven councilors starting on June 12.
sen.cmt: the translator should learn how to translate basic phrases like 6月12日から
sen.e: This bill was discussed by seven councilors starting on June 12.

sen.j: 議案は当初、板垣が武力による修好条約締結（征韓論）を主張したのに対し、西郷は武力を不可として、自分が旧例の服装で全権大使になる（遣韓大使論）と主張して対立した。
sen.e: At that time the bill was, Itagaki asserted the conclusion problem of treaty of amity (the theory to subdue Korea) by force, against that, Saigo asserted to be an ambassador plenipotentiary with antecedent costume, not by force (Kenkan Taishi-ron (theory to be ambassador sent to Korea).

At first Itagaki asserted in the bill that the conclusion of the problem of the treaty of amity (a machination to subdue Korea) should be done by force, but contrary to this Saigo asserted that he would become an ambassador plenipotentiary with antecedent costume, and not use force (Kenkan Taishi-ron (theory in which an ambassador is sent to Korea).

At first Itagaki asserted in the bill that the conclusion of the problem of the treaty of amity (a machination to subdue Korea) should be done by force, but contrary to this Saigo asserted that he would become an ambassador plenipotentiary with antecedent costume, and not use force (Kenkan Taishi-ron (theory in which an ambassador is sent to Korea)).

sen.j: しかし、数度に及ぶ説得で、方法・人選で反対していた板垣と外務卿の副島が8月初めに西郷案に同意した。
sen.e: Itagaki and Fukushsima of Gaimukyo were opposite of the method and selection of person, but they agreed Saigo's plan with talked them many times in beginning of August.
Itagaki and Fukushima of Gaimukyo were initially opposed to the method and to the selection of Saigo, but they to Saigo's plan after talking together many times in beginning of August.
sen.cmt: changed person --> Saigo. It felt necessary to add "initially" and "after: but they are not explicitly in the text, so remove them if you wish.
sen.e: Itagaki and Fukushima of Gaimukyo were initially opposed to the method and to the selection of Saigo, but they to Saigo's plan after talking together many times in beginning of August.

sen.j: 西郷派遣については、16日に三条の同意を得て、17日の閣議で決定された。
sen.e: About dispatch of Saigo was agreed with Sanjo in 16th, and decided by Cabinet meeting in 17th.
It was agreed to dispatch Saigo with Sanjo on the 16th, and approved by Cabinet meeting on the 17th.
It was agreed to dispatch Saigo with Sanjo on the 16th, and approved by Cabinet meeting on the 17th.

sen.j: しかし、三条が天皇に報告したとき、「岩倉具視の帰朝を待って、岩倉と熟議して奏上せよ」との勅旨があったので、発表は岩倉帰国まで待つことになった。
sen.e: But when Sanjo reported to Emperor, he received an Imperial prescript which is 'wait until Tomomi IWAKURA returns from Korea and discuss with him and then report to me' so the announcement had to wait until Iwakura's return.

But when Sanjo reported to the Emperor, he received an Imperial prescript saying 'wait until Tomomi IWAKURA returns from Korea, and meet with him, and then report to me' so the announcement had to wait until Iwakura's return.
sen.cmt: added "the" which --> saying … improved the phrasing
sen.e: But when Sanjo reported to the Emperor, he received an Imperial prescript saying 'wait until Tomomi IWAKURA returns from Korea, and meet with him, and then report to me' so the announcement had to wait until Iwakura's return.

sen.j: 以上の時点までは、西郷・板垣・副島らは大使派遣の方向で事態は進行するものと考えていた。
sen.e: Up to that point, Saigo, Itagaki and Fukushima thought the situation moves to sending an ambassador.
Up to that point, Saigo, Itagaki and Fukushima had thought to advance the situation by sending an ambassador.
Up to that point, Saigo, Itagaki and Fukushima had thought to advance the situation by sending an ambassador.

sen.j: ところが、9月、岩倉が帰国すると、先に外遊から帰国していた木戸孝允・大久保利通らの内治優先論が表面化してきた。
sen.e: But, after Iwakura returned in September, Takayoshi KIDO and Toshimichi OKUBO who returned from abroad began to show the theory of priority to domestic security.
But, after Iwakura returned in September, Takayoshi KIDO and Toshimichi OKUBO, who returned from time abroad, began to espouse the 'theory of priority of domestic security.'
sen.cmt: commas around relative clause. Show --> espouse.
sen.e: But, after Iwakura returned in September, Takayoshi KIDO and Toshimichi OKUBO, who returned from time abroad, began to espouse the theory of priority of domestic security.

sen.j: 大久保らが参議に加わった9月14日の閣議では大使派遣問題は議決できず、15日の再議で西郷派遣に決定した。
sen.e: The problem of sending ambassador couldn't decide at the Cabinet meeting that Okubo and others joined in September 14, and they decided to send Saigo at the second Cabinet meeting in 15th.

The problem of whether to dispatch an ambassador could not be decided at the Cabinet meeting that Okubo and others went to on September 14, and they decided to send Saigo at the second Cabinet meeting on the 15th.

The problem of whether to dispatch an ambassador could not be decided at the Cabinet meeting that Okubo and others went to on September 14, and they decided to send Saigo at the second Cabinet meeting on the 15th.

sen.j: しかし、これに反対する木戸・大久保・大隈・大木らの参議が辞表を提出し、右大臣岩倉も辞意を表明する事態に至った。
sen.e: But, the councilors Kido, Okubo, Okuma and Oki who were against the decision submitted resignation, and the situation was result in the Udaijin Iwakura also announced the resignation.
But, the councilors Kido, Okubo, Okuma and Oki who were against the decision submitted resignation, and the situation was result in the Udaijin Iwakura also announced the resignation.
sen.cmt: commas around relative clause. Grammar / phrasing
sen.e: But, the councilors Kido, Okubo, Okuma and Oki who were against the decision submitted resignation, and the situation was result in the Udaijin Iwakura also announced the resignation.

sen.j: これを憂慮した三条は18日夜、急病になり、岩倉が太政大臣代行になった。
sen.e: Sanjo who was apprehensive about it was suddenly taken ill on 18th at night, Iwakura became the acting grand minister of state.
Sanjo who was apprehensive about it, suddenly became ill on the night of the 18th, so Iwakura became the acting grand minister of state.
sen.cmt: commas around relative clause. taken --> became
sen.e: Sanjo who was apprehensive about it, suddenly became ill on the night of the 18th, so Iwakura became the acting grand minister of state.

sen.j: そこで、西郷・板垣・副島・江藤らは岩倉邸を訪ねて、閣議決定の上奏裁可を求めたが、岩倉は了承しなかった。
sen.e: Then Saigo, Itagaki, Fukushima and Eto visited to residence of Iwakura to ask the approbation of Joso (memorial to the throne) which is the decision of cabinet meeting, but Iwakura didn't approved.

Then Saigo, Itagaki, Fukushima and Eto visited the residence of Iwakura to ask for the approbation of Joso (memorial to the throne), which was the decision of cabinet meeting, but Iwakura did not approve of it.

Then Saigo, Itagaki, Fukushima and Eto visited the residence of Iwakura to ask for the approbation of Joso (memorial to the throne), which was the decision of cabinet meeting, but Iwakura did not approve of it.

sen.j: 9月23日、西郷が陸軍大将兼参議・近衛都督を辞し、位階も返上すると上表したのに対し、すでに宮中工作を終えていた岩倉は、閣議の決定とは別に西郷派遣延期の意見書を天皇に提出した。
sen.e: Saigo resigned General of Army, concurrently Sangi councilor, and Konoe-totoku in September 23, and announced to returning the rank, but Iwakura who finished maneuvering of Imperial Court was submitted the document of opinion about indefinite postponement of sending Saigo without the decision from Imperial Court.

Saigo resigned as General of the Army, and as concurrent Sangi councilor, and as Konoe-totoku on September 23, and announced that he would return these ranks, but Iwakura, who finished maneuvering in the Imperial Court, submitted an opinion document for the indefinite postponement of dispatching Saigo separetely from a decision of the Imperial Court.
sen.cmt: Check "opinion document" I am not sure of how this is usually phrased.
sen.e: Saigo resigned as General of the Army, and as concurrent Sangi councilor, and as Konoe-totoku on September 23, and announced that he would return these ranks, but Iwakura, who finished maneuvering in the Imperial Court, submitted an opinion document for the indefinite postponement of dispatching Saigo separetely from a decision of the Imperial Court.

sen.j: 翌24日に天皇が岩倉の意見を入れ、西郷派遣を無期延期するとの裁可を出したので、西郷は辞職した。
sen.e: The next day, on 24th, Saigo resigned because the Emperor accepted the opinion from Iwakura, and approved the indefinite postponement of sending Saigo.
The next day, on the 24th, Saigo resigned because the Emperor accepted the opinion document from Iwakura, and approved the indefinite postponement of sending Saigo.
sen.cmt: added "document" for consistency with the above.
sen.e: The next day, on the 24th, Saigo resigned because the Emperor accepted the opinion document from Iwakura, and approved the indefinite postponement of sending Saigo.

sen.j: このとき、西郷の参議・近衛都督辞職は許可されたが、陸軍大将辞職と位階の返上は許されなかった（岩倉・木戸・大久保らは、これらを許可しないことによって、西郷ら遣韓派をいずれ政府に復帰させる意図があることを示したのであろう）。
sen.e: At the time, resigning councilor and Konoe-totoku from Saigo was approved, but resigning of full general, and returning the rank was not approved (Iwakura, Kido and Okubo showed plan to make Saigo and the supporter of sending ambassador to Korea return to government without approving these things.)

At the time, Saigo's resignation of the position of councilor and Konoe-totoku was approved, but his resignation of the title of full general was not approved, nor was he allowed to return that rank (based on this failure to receive approval, Iwakura, Kido and Okubo had plans to restore Saigo and the supporters of those in favor of sending an ambassador to Korea return to government).
sen.cmt: bad phrasing; e.g. "resigning councilor and Konoe-totoku "
sen.e: At the time, Saigo's resignation of the position of councilor and Konoe-totoku was approved, but his resignation of the title of full general was not approved, nor was he allowed to return that rank (based on this failure to receive approval, Iwakura, Kido and Okubo had plans to restore Saigo and the supporters of those in favor of sending an ambassador to Korea return to government).

sen.j: 翌25日になると、板垣・副島・後藤・江藤らの参議も辞職した。
sen.e: And next day on 25th, Otagaki, Fukushima, Goto and Eto resigned councilor.
The next day, on the 25th, Otagaki, Fukushima, Goto and Eto resigned as councilors.
The next day, on the 25th, Otagaki, Fukushima, Goto and Eto resigned as councilors.

sen.j: この一連の辞職に同調して、征韓論・遣韓大使派の林有造・桐野利秋・篠原国幹・淵辺群平・別府晋介・河野主一郎・辺見十郎太をはじめとする政治家・軍人・官僚600名余が次々に大量に辞任した。
sen.e: People sided with chain of this resigning, Yuzo HAYASHI of Seikanron and Kenkan Taishi-ha (supporter for sending army and ambassador to Korea), Toshiaki KIRINO, Kunimoto SHINOHARA, Gumpei FUCHIBE, Shuichiro KONO, Shuichiro KONO and Jurota HEMMI, and politician, soldier and governor that was about six hundred people resigned one after another.
sen.cmt: 林有造→Yuzo HAYASHI[http://kotobank.jp/word/林有造]河野主一郎→Shuichiro KONO[http://kotobank.jp/word/河野主一郎]辺見十郎太→Jurota HEMMI[http://kotobank.jp/word/辺見十郎太]
sen.e: Many other sided with those who resigned, and Yuzo HAYASHI of Seikanron and Kenkan Taishi-ha (supporters for sending both an army and ambassadors to Korea), Toshiaki KIRINO, Kunimoto SHINOHARA, Gumpei FUCHIBE, Shuichiro KONO and Jurota HEMMI, and about 600 other politicians, soldiers and governors resigned one after another.

Many other sided with those who resigned, and Yuzo HAYASHI of Seikanron and Kenkan Taishi-ha (supporters for sending both an army and ambassadors to Korea), Toshiaki KIRINO, Kunimoto SHINOHARA, Gumpei FUCHIBE, Shuichiro KONO and Jurota HEMMI, and about 600 other politicians, soldiers and governors resigned one after another.

sen.j: この後も辞職が続き、遅れて帰国した村田新八・池上四郎らもまた辞任した（明治六年政変）。
sen.e: After that the resigning was continued, Shimpachi MURATA and Shiro IKEGAMI who returned late also resigned (political change in 1873)
During these extensive resignations, Shimpachi MURATA and Shiro IKEGAMI, who returned late, also resigned (the political change of 1873)
During these extensive resignations, Shinpachi MURATA and Shiro IKEGAMI, who returned late, also resigned (the political change of 1873)

sen.j: このとき、西郷の推挙で兵部大輔大村益次郎の後任に補されながら、能力不足と自覚して、先に下野していた前原一誠は「宜シク西郷ノ職ヲ復シテ薩長調和ノ実ヲ計ルベシ、然ラザレバ、賢ヲ失フノ議起コラント」という内容の書簡を太政大臣三条実美に送り、明治政府の前途を憂えた。
sen.e: At the time, Issei MAEHARA who was appointed the successor of Hobu-taifu, Masujiro OMURA, but he resigned earlier because he was conscious about sufficient of his ability, and he sent a letter to grand minister of state, Sanetomi SANJO which is 'Saigo should be back on his work to attempt at harmonization of Satsuma and Choshu. If not, there will be some debates about wise lost', and he was concerned about future of Meiji Government.
sen.cmt: 前原一誠→Issei MAEBARA[http://kotobank.jp/word/前原一誠]
sen.e: At the time, Issei MAEHARA (who was appointed the successor of Masujiro OMURA, the Hobu-taifu, who had resigned earlier because he was doubtful of the sufficiency of his ability) sent a letter to the grand minister of state, Sanetomi SANJO saying 'Saigo should be reassigned to his work of attempting the harmonization of Satsuma and Choshu. If not, there will be some debates about wise lost', because he was concerned about the future of the Meiji Government.
sen.cmt: IMPORTANT "If not, there will be some debates about wise lost" -- I do not know how best to change this clause.
sen.e: At the time, Issei MAEHARA (who was appointed the successor of Masujiro OMURA, the Hobu-taifu, who had resigned earlier because he was doubtful of the sufficiency of his ability) sent a letter to the grand minister of state, Sanetomi SANJO saying 'Saigo should be reassigned to his work of attempting the harmonization of Satsuma and Choshu. If not, there will be some debates about wise lost', because he was concerned about the future of the Meiji Government.

sen.j: 下野した西郷は、明治6年11月10日、鹿児島に帰着し、以来、大半を武村の自宅で過ごした。
sen.e: Saigo who resigned returned to Kagoshima in November 10, 1873, since then spent most of time at home in Takemura.
Saigo, who resigned, returned to Kagoshima on November 10, 1873, had spent most of time since then at home in Takemura.
Saigo, who resigned, returned to Kagoshima on November 10, 1873, had spent most of time since then at home in Takemura.

sen.j: 猟に行き、山川の鰻温泉で休養していた明治7年（1874年）3月1日、佐賀の乱で敗れた江藤新平が来訪し、翌日、指宿まで見送った（江藤は土佐で捕まった）。
sen.e: When he went hunting and rest at Unagi Onsen Hot Spring in Yamakwa in March 1, 1874, Shimpei Eto who was eliminated in Saga-no-ran War came to visit him, and next day he saw Eto to Ibusuki (Eto was arrested in Tosa).

When he went hunting and rested at Unagi Onsen Hot Spring in Yamakawa, but on March 1, 1874, Shimpei Eto, who was defeated in the Saga-no-ran War, came to visit him, and the next day he saw Eto to Ibusuki (Eto had been arrested in Tosa).

When he went hunting and rested at Unagi Onsen Hot Spring in Yamakawa, but on March 1, 1874, Shimpei ETO, who was defeated in the Saga-no-ran War, came to visit him, and the next day he saw Eto to Ibusuki (Eto had been arrested in Tosa).

sen.j: これ以前の2月に閣議で台湾征討が決定した。
sen.e: Before that, Taiwan conquest was decided at Cabinet meeting in February.
Before that, the conquest of Taiwan has been decided in a Cabinet meeting in February.
sen.cmt: Taiwan conquest --> the conquest of Taiwan etc.
sen.e: Before that, the conquest of Taiwan has been decided in a Cabinet meeting in February.

sen.j: この征討には木戸が反対して参議を辞めたが、西郷も反対していた。
sen.e: Kido resigned councilor with against this conquest, and also Saigo was against to it.
Kido resigned councilor due to this conquest, and Saigo was also against it.
Kido resigned councilor due to this conquest, and Saigo was also against it.

sen.j: しかし、4月、台湾征討軍の都督三弟西郷従道の要請を入れ、やむなく鹿児島から徴募して、兵約800名を長崎に送った。
sen.e: But in April, he received a request from Totoku governor general and the third brother of Saigo, Judo SAIGO who was in Taiwan conquest force, and reluctantly enlisted from Kagoshima, and sends about eight hundred soldier to Nagasaki.

But in April, he received a request from Judo SAIGO, who was Totoku governor general and the younger brother of Saigo, who had been in the Taiwan conquest force, and reluctantly agreed to recruiment from Kagoshima, and sent about eight hundred soldiers to Nagasaki.
sen.cmt: I think "agreed to recruitment" is closer to what actually happened.
sen.e: But in April, he received a request from Judo SAIGO, who was Totoku governor general and the younger brother of Saigo, who had been in the Taiwan conquest force, and reluctantly agreed to recruiment from Kagoshima, and sent about eight hundred soldiers to Nagasaki.

sen.j: 西郷の下野に同調した軍人・警吏が相次いで帰県した明治6年末以来、鹿児島県下は無職の血気多き壮年者がのさばり、それに影響された若者に溢れる状態になった（この状態が私学校創設後も続いたことは『西南役前後の思出の記』に詳しい）。
sen.e: Since soldiers and the Keri police officers who concerted with resigning of Saigo returned to the prefecture one after another in 1873, and there were packed with many unemployed hot-blooded men and young men who inspired from them in Kagoshima, (that situation continued to after established a private school that details in 'the diary of before and after Seinan-eki (Seinan War)).

Since soldiers and the Keri police officers who resigned along with Saigo returned to the prefecture one after another in 1873, Kagoshima became filled with many unemployed hot-blooded men and young men who were inspired by them (a situation that continued after a private school was established, the details of which are in 'the diary of before and after Seinan-eki (Seinan War)).

Since soldiers and the Keri police officers who resigned along with Saigo returned to the prefecture one after another in 1873, Kagoshima became filled with many unemployed hot-blooded men and young men who were inspired by them (a situation that continued after a private school was established, the details of which are in "the diary of before and after Seinan-eki (Seinan War)").

sen.j: 募兵、新兵教練が終わった13日、大隊編制が行われ、一番大隊指揮長に篠原国幹、二番大隊指揮長に村田新八、三番大隊指揮長に永山弥一郎、四番大隊指揮長に桐野利秋、五番大隊指揮長に池上四郎が選任され、桐野が総司令を兼ねることになった。

sen.j: 薩軍は浜町で大隊を中隊に編制し直し、隊名を一新したのち、椎葉越えして、新たな根拠地と定めた人吉へ移動した。
sen.e: Satsu-gun was reorganized a battalion to a company, and renewed the name of the company, then went over Shiba to moved to Hitoyoshi where they decided as the new base.
Satsu-gun was reorganized from a battalion to a company, and once the name of the company was renewed, they went over Shiba and moved to Hitoyoshi, which they established as the new base.

sen.e: Satsu-gun was reorganized from a battalion to a company, and once the name of the company was renewed, they went over Shiba and moved to Hitoyoshi, which they established as the new base.

sen.j: 4月27日、一日遅れで桐野利秋が江代に着くと、翌28日に軍議が開かれ、各隊の部署を定め、日を追って順次、各地に配備した。
sen.e: Toshiaki KIRINO arrived to Eshiro on April 27, the day after them, then next day, on 28th, the army meeting was held to set the department for each party, and arranged them at each placed, day by day.

sen.j: これ以来、人吉に本営を設け、ここを中心に政府軍と対峙していたが、衆寡敵せず、徐々に政府軍に押され、人吉も危なくなった。
sen.e: After that, they established the base at Hitoyoshi, and facing each other with Government army from a base, but it was hopelessly outnumbered, and it was pushed by Government army little by little, then Hitoyoshi also was in danger.

After that, they established the base at Hitoyoshi, and they faced the Government army from their base, but they were hopelessly outnumbered, and were pushed back by the Government army little by little, and then Hitoyoshi also fell into danger.

sen.j: そこで本営を宮崎に移すことにした。

sen.j: 西郷は池上四郎に護衛され、5月31日、桐野利秋が新たな根拠地としていた軍務所（もと宮崎支庁舎）に着いた。
sen.e: Saigo was guarded by Shiro IKEGAMI and arrived at the army office (Government branch office of Miyazaki) where the Toshiaki KIRINO was based on.

sen.j: ここが新たな本営となった。

sen.j: この軍務所では、桐野の指示で、薩軍の財政を立て直すための大量の軍票（西郷札）がつくられた。

sen.j: 人吉に残った村田新八は、6月17日、小林に拠り、振武隊、破竹隊、行進隊、佐土原隊の約1000名を指揮し、1ヶ月近く政府軍と川内川を挟んで小戦を繰り返した。
sen.e: In June 17, Shimpachi MURATA who stayed at Hitoyoshi supported Kobayashi, and he directed Shimbutai Army, Shimbutai Army, Hachiku-tai troop, march convoy, and march convoy which was about one thousand of soldiers, they repeated small battles with Government army across the Sendai-gawa River about for a month.

sen.j: 7月10日、政府軍が加久藤・飯野に全面攻撃を加えてきたので、支えようとしたが支えきれず、高原麓・野尻方面へ退却した。
sen.e: In July 10, the Government army tried to all-out attack to Kakuto and Iino and they tried to hold that but they couldn't, then withdraw to the direction to Kogen-roku and Nojiri.

sen.j: 小林も11日に政府軍の手に落ちた。

sen.j: 17日と21の両日、掘与八郎が延岡方面にいた薩兵約1000名を率いて高原麓を奪い返すために政府軍と激戦をしたが、これも勝てず、庄内、谷頭へ退却した。
sen.e: Hachiro HORIYO who was at direction to Nobeoka had fierce battle to Government army with one thousand of Satsu soldiers to get back the Kogen-roku on 17th and 21st, but they lost again and withdrew to Shonai and Tanigashira.

sen.j: 24日、村田は都城で政府軍六箇旅団と激戦をしたが、兵力の差は如何ともしがたく、これも大敗して、宮崎へ退いた（都城の戦い）。
sen.e: In 24th, Murata had fierce battle to Rokka-ryodan brigade of Government army, but the difference of soldiers between each other was difficult to compare, then also they suffered a crushing defeat in the battle and withdrew to Miyazaki (the Battle of Miyakonojo).

sen.j: 宮崎から退却した西郷は、2日、延岡大貫村に着き、ここに9日まで滞在した。

sen.j: 7日、池上の指示で火薬製作所・病院を熊田に移し、ここを本営とした。

sen.e: Same day Toshiaki KIRINO, Shimpachi MURATA an Shiro IKEGAMI came from Nagai-mura and made the plan of attack Nobeoka, and they directed at the main roads, but they failed Betsudo-Daini-ryodan (the second stand-alone brigade), Daisan-ryodan (the third brigade), Daiyon-ryodan (the fourth brigade), Shinsen Ryodan brigade and Daiichi-ryodan (the first brigade), and left all from Nobeoka and stayed in Wada-toge.

sen.j: 8月15日、和田峠を中心に布陣し、政府軍に対し、西南戦争最後の大戦を挑んだ。

sen.e: The early in the morning, Saigo took the lead for the first time, and directed commanders who were Kirino, Murata, Ikegami and Beep at the top of Wada-togem, but they couldn't restore Nobeoka because they suffered a crushing defeat, and left to Nagai village.

sen.j: 残兵とともに、三田井まで脱出してから今後の方針を定めると決し、17日夜10時、長井村を発し、可愛嶽（えのたけ）に登り、包囲網からの突破を試みた。
sen.e: He decided to make decision after they escape to Mitai with the rest of soldiers, then they left Nagai village around 10 p.m. on 17th, and climbed Enotake and tried to leave from the encircling net.

sen.j: 突囲軍は精鋭300～500名で、前軍は河野主一郎・辺見十郎太、中軍は桐野・村田、後軍は中島健彦・貴島清が率い、池上と別府が約60名を率いて西郷隆盛を護衛した（『大西郷突囲戦史』に依る。
sen.e: The breaking through army was about three hundred to five hundred soldiers, and the first army was lead by Shuichioro KONO and Jurota HENMI, the middle army was lead by Kirino, Murata, and the last army was lead by Takehiko NAKAJIMA and Kiyoshi KIJIMA, and Ikegami and Beppu led sixty soldiers to guard Takamori SAIGO ("Daisaigo Totsui Senki (war chronicle of Great Saigo breaking through the besieging armies)").

sen.j: 9月1日、突囲した薩軍は鹿児島に入り、城山 (鹿児島市)を占拠した。

sen.j: 一時、薩軍は鹿児島城下の大半を制したが、上陸展開した政府軍が3日に城下の大半を制し、6日には城山包囲態勢を完成させた。

sen.j: 19日、山野田一輔・河野主一郎が西郷の救命のためであることを隠し、挙兵の意を説くためと称して、軍使となって参軍川村純義のもとに出向き、捕らえられた。
sen.e: Kazusuke YAMANODA and Syuichiro Kono kept a secret which was the life saver for Saigo, and called themselves as a parson who explains the meaning of raising the army, and visited Sumiyoshi KAWAMURA of Sangun (commander of Sangun department of army) and they were captured on 19th.

sen.j: 22日、西郷は城山決死の檄を出した。
sen.e: Saigo issued the exhortation of desperate battle at Shiroyama on 22nd.

sen.j: 23日、西郷は、山野田が持ち帰った川村からの返事を聞き、参軍山縣からの自決を勧める書簡を読んだが、返事を出さなかった。
sen.e: Saigo heard the response from Kawamura which Yamanoda brought back, and read a letter from Sangun Yamagata which was recommendation of suicide, but he didn't reply to a letter on 23rd.

sen.j: 9月24日、午前4時、政府軍が城山を総攻撃したとき、西郷・桐野・桂久武・村田・池上・別府・辺見十郎太ら将士40余名は洞前に整列し、岩崎口に進撃した。

sen.j: 明治10年（1877年）2月25日に「行在所達第四号」で官位を褫奪（ちだつ）され、死後、賊軍の将として遇されたが、黒田清隆らの努力や明治天皇直々の働きがあって明治22年（1889年）2月11日、大日本帝国憲法発布に伴う大赦で赦され、正三位を追贈された。
sen.e: In February 25, 1887, the official rank was deprived from "Anzaisho Tatsu, dai 4 go (message of provisional palace for Gyoko, Emperor's outing, No. 4)" and after the death, he was treated as the commander of the rebel army, and he was conferred the Shosammi rank by the issuance of the Constitution of the Empire of Japan which was pardoned with amnesty by effort from Kiyotaka KURODA and others, and the support of the Emperor Meiji himself.

On February 25th, 1887, he was deprived of his official rank, as in "Anzaisho Tatsu, dai 4 go (message of provisional palace for Gyoko, Emperor's outing, No. 4)" and after his death, he was treated as the commander of the rebel army, and he was conferred the Shosanmi rank by the issuance of the Constitution of the Empire of Japan, which pardoned him with amnesty due to the efforts of Kiyotaka KURODA and others, and the support of the Emperor Meiji himself.

On February 25th, 1887, he was deprived of his official rank, as in 'Anzaisho Tatsu, dai 4 go (message of provisional palace for Gyoko, Emperor's outing, No. 4)' and after his death, he was treated as the commander of the rebel army, and he was conferred the Shosanmi rank by the issuance of the Constitution of the Empire of Japan, which pardoned him with amnesty due to the efforts of Kiyotaka KURODA and others, and the support of the Emperor Meiji himself.

sen.j: 西郷は水戸学派や国学の皇国史観に止まってはおらず、開国して富国強兵をし、日・清・韓の三国同盟をするという島津斉彬の持論の影響で、東アジアと欧米諸国の対置という形の世界観を持っていた。
sen.e: Saigo's world view wasn't only Mitogaku School group and the Kokoku Shikan (historical perspective) of Kokugaku (study of ancient Japanese literature and culture), it was forms contraposition of East Asia and Europe and the North America, he opened nation and then made a prosperous country and strong army, and made the tripartite alliance of Japan, Qing and Korea which inspired by theory of Saiakira SHIMADU.

sen.e: Saigo's world view was not only that of the Mitogaku School and the Kokoku Shikan (historical perspective) of Kokugaku (study of ancient Japanese literature and culture), rather his views incorporated contraposition of East Asia and European and the North American ideals; he opened the nation and then made a prosperous country and strong army, and forged the tripartite alliance of Japan, Qing and Korea which was inspired by the ideals of Saiakira SHIMAZU.

sen.e: At the time, Qing was under invasion of the powerful countries, he was describing the image of the future East Asia which was, at first, the three countries completely independence with situation that based on the Sakuho-koku (countries to confer a peerage with a Saku paper) of Qing is Korea, and then aim for the tripartite alliance of Japan, Qing and Korea.

sen.j: 高島鞆之助の言では西郷は大島潜居の頃から肥満になったとしているが、おそらく沖永良部島流罪当時は痩せこけて死にそうになっていたというから、沖永良部在島後半期に座敷牢にいて運動不足から肥満し始めたというのが真相だろう。
sen.e: According to Tomonosuke TAKASHIMA, Saigo was over weight since when he was refuge at Oshima, perhaps he lost a lot of weight and almost died when he had transportation to Oki-no-erabujima island, so the truth might be that he started to gain weight when he was in zashikiro because of lack of exercise in the late time of Oki-no-erabujima island.

sen.j: グイド・フルベッキの写真は撮影されたのが慶応2、3年と特定されているが（明治初年の説もある）、比定された西郷ら明治維新の元勲がこの時期に一堂に会したことは史料的にも有り得ぬし、西郷本人に限っても、既に肥満体になっていたのに、頬骨が出、普通の身躯をしているなど疑問点だらけで、副島種臣とフルベッキ、さらに無名の佐賀士族の若者たちを写した写真を元勲たちの写真とこじつけたにすぎない。
sen.e: The picture which was taken by Guido Herman Fridolin Verbeek was specified in 1866 or 1867, but as their suggestion, Saigo and other achievement to serve country of Meiji Restoration who get together around that time is impossible by the document, and Saigo himself was already had obese body, but his cheek bone was out and he had a normal sized body on the picture which has many questions, the picture was distorted by Taneomi SOEJIMA, Guido Herman Fridolin Verbeek and also no-named young men of warrior class of Saga, instead the achievement to serve country.

sen.e: The picture was supposedly taken by Guido Herman Fridolin Verbeek in 1866 or 1867, but the notion that Saigo and others who had made achievements serving the country in the Meiji Restoration got together around that time is historically impossible, and Saigo himself was already obese by this point, but in the picture his cheek bones show and he had a normal sized body, so there are many problems with it; moreover, the picture was distorted by Taneomi SOEJIMA and Guido Herman Fridolin Verbeek, so it is likely to be nothing more than unnamed men of the warrior class in Saga, instead those who had achievements serving their country.

sen.j: 公開の際に招かれた西郷夫人糸子は「宿んし（うちの主人）はこげんなお人じゃなかったこてえ（あら、こんな人ではなかったですよ）」と腰を抜かし（この発言を銅像の顔が本人に似てない事と解釈する説もある）、また「浴衣姿で散歩なんてしなかった」といった意の言葉（薩隅方言）を漏らし周囲の人に窘められたという。

Saigo had no more descendants after his grandchildren's generation.
Saigo had no more descendants after his grandchildren's generation.

sen.j: 幼少期、近所に使いで水瓶（豆腐と言う説もある）を持って歩いている時に、物陰に隠れていた悪童に驚かされた時、西郷は水瓶を地面に置いた上で、心底、驚いた表現をして、その後何事も無かったかのように水瓶を運んで行った。
sen.e: When he was little, he was walking with water bottle (its another theory it was a tofu soybean curd), the naughty boy who got under cover terrified him, Saigo put the water bottle on the ground, and expressed like he was absolutely surprised, but after that, he carried a water bottle as nothing happened.

There was one time, when he was little, that he was walking with a water bottle (another theory has it that it was a soybean curd) and a mischevious boy surprised him from a hiding place, and Saigo, terrified and dropped the water bottle on the ground, but then thereafter he picked up the water bottle as if nothing had happened.

There was one time, when he was little, that he was walking with a water bottle (another theory has it that it was a soybean curd) and a mischevious boy surprised him from a hiding place, and Saigo, terrified and dropped the water bottle on the ground, but then thereafter he picked up the water bottle as if nothing had happened.

sen.j: 身長182cm、体重114kg。
sen.e: Height 182 cm, weight 114 kg.
He was 182 cm tall, and weighed 114 kg.
He was 182 cm tall, and weighed 114 kg.

sen.j: 血液型はB型。
sen.e: Blood type was B.
His blood type was B.
His blood type was B.

sen.j: 喫煙者であるが酒は弱く下戸であった。
sen.e: He smoked but he wasn't strong with alcohol, he was lightweight drinker.
He smoked, but he was not a heavy drinker and would become drunk easily.
He smoked, but he was not a heavy drinker and would become drunk easily.

sen.j: 青年、壮年期においては妻のほか愛人を囲うなど享楽的な側面も見せたが、晩年は禁欲的な態度に徹した。
sen.e: He showed the side of pleasure-seeking which having lovers other than his wife when he was young and mid age, but he had continence attitude in his later year.
He showed a hedonistic side in his earlier days, and when he was middle aged, he had lovers other than his wife, but he was continent in his latter years.
sen.cmt: improved word choice pleasure seeking --> hedonistic, etc.
sen.e: He showed a hedonistic side in his earlier days, and when he was middle aged, he had lovers other than his wife, but he was continent in his latter years.

sen.j: 西郷隆盛が士族兵制論者か徴兵制支持者なのか、当時の政府関係者ですら意見が分かれており、谷干城や鳥尾小弥太は前者を、平田東助は後者であったとする見解を採っている。
sen.e: Takamori SAIGO was the supporter for military system of warrior class or the supporter of conscription, even the government related people divided the opinion, it adopted an opinion that Tateki TANI and Koyata TORIO had the first opinion, and Tosuke HIRATA had the later opinion.
sen.cmt: 谷干城→Tateki TANI[http://kotobank.jp/word/谷干城]鳥尾小弥太→Koyata TORIO[http://kotobank.jp/word/鳥尾小弥太]平田東助→Tosuke HIRATA[http://kotobank.jp/word/平田東助]
sen.e: Takamori SAIGO was a supporter of a military system having a warrior class or conscription, and even government officials were divided on this issue, some adopted the former opinion, like Tateki TANI and Koyata TORIO, and others like Tosuke HIRATA had the latter opinion.

Takamori SAIGO was a supporter of a military system having a warrior class or conscription, and even government officials were divided on this issue, some adopted the former opinion, like Tateki TANI and Koyata TORIO, and others like Tosuke HIRATA had the latter opinion.

sen.j: 御親兵導入の経緯などからすれば、士族兵制論者と見るのが妥当であるが、山縣有朋の失脚後も西郷は山縣の徴兵制構想をそのまま継続させたことから、親兵・近衛を通じて形成された山縣に対する西郷の個人的信頼から徴兵令実施を受け入れたと考えられている。
sen.e: Its proper that as a supporter for military system of warrior class from the situation of introduction of Goshimpei (army to convoy the Emperor), After Aritomo YAMAGATA lost his position, Saigo continued Yamagata's plan of the conscription system, so it concerned that Saigo himself trusted Yamagata who formed Goshimpei (army to convoy the Emperor) and Konoe, then accepted to effect the Conscription Ordinance.

As a supporter of the military system of a warrior class, it is proper that, due to the situation involving the introduction of the Goshimpei (army to form a convoy to the Emperor) Saigo continued Yamagata's plan of the conscription system after Aritomo YAMAGATA lost his position, so it is of concern that Saigo himself trusted Yamagata, who formed the Goshimpei (army to convoy the Emperor) and Konoe, then accepted the effects of the Conscription Ordinance.

As a supporter of the military system of a warrior class, it is proper that, due to the situation involving the introduction of the Goshimpei (army to form a convoy to the Emperor) Saigo continued Yamagata's plan of the conscription system after Aritomo YAMAGATA lost his position, so it is of concern that Saigo himself trusted Yamagata, who formed the Goshimpei (army to convoy the Emperor) and Konoe, then accepted the effects of the Conscription Ordinance.

sen.j: ちなみに廃藩置県導入の際に西郷を最終的に同意させたのも山縣であった。
sen.e: By the way, when introduce the abolition of clans and establishment of prefectures, Yamagata was the person who has let Saigo agree.
Incidentally, when introducing the abolition of clans and establishment of prefectures, the person who finally agreed with Saigo was Yamagata.
sen.cmt: by the was--> incidentally, verb form issus, phrasing
sen.e: Incidentally, when introducing the abolition of clans and establishment of prefectures, the person who finally agreed with Saigo was Yamagata.

sen.j: 没年月日（1877年9月24日）がグレゴリオ暦なので、一部の西郷研究者からは生年月日も天保暦からグレゴリオ暦に直して1828年1月23日にすべきだと言う声も上がっている。
sen.e: The year and date of death (September 24, 1877) is the Gregorian calendar, some of the researcher of Saigo has opinion that should have corrected to the date of death from the Tempo calendar to the Gregorian calendar which is January 23, 1828.

The year and date of his death was September 24, 1877 on the Gregorian calendar, some researchers who study Saigo's life hold the opinion that the date of his death should be changed from the Tempo calendar to the Gregorian calendar, and thus to January 23, 1828.
sen.cmt: I do not understand the nuances of these calendars but I think this is correct.
sen.e: The year and date of his death was September 24, 1877 on the Gregorian calendar, some researchers who study Saigo's life hold the opinion that the date of his death should be changed from the Tempo calendar to the Gregorian calendar, and thus to January 23, 1828.

sen.j: 郷土の名物、黒豚の肉が大好物だったが、特に好んでいたのが今風でいう肉入り野菜炒めと豚骨料理と呼ばれる鹿児島の郷土料理であったことが、愛加那の子孫によって『鹿児島の郷土料理』という書籍に載せられている。
sen.e: His favorite was local specialty, meat of Kurobuta swine, and he was especially preferred the stir-fried vegetable with pork that calls modern way, and pork and Tonkotsu (Pork bone) dishes which was published in "the Local Dishes of Kagoshima" from descendant of Aiguna.

His favorite foods were the local specialties, especially Kurobuta pork, and he preferred it in a dish like modern day stir-fried vegetables with pork, and and also Tonkotsu pork (Pork bone) dishes such as those published in "The Local Dishes of Kagoshima" by descendant of Aiguna.
sen.cmt: improved phrasing, made it sound natural.
sen.e: His favorite foods were the local specialties, especially Kurobuta pork, and he preferred it in a dish like modern day stir-fried vegetables with pork, and and also Tonkotsu pork (Pork bone) dishes such as those published in "The Local Dishes of Kagoshima" by descendant of Aikana.

sen.j: 日本放送協会の世論調査で、今でも西郷は鹿児島県人に人気が絶大に高く、年長者になるほど神格化されているほど。
sen.e: Even now Saigo is very popular among people in Kagoshima prefecture, elders deify him which is the survey of public opinion by Japan Broadcasting Corporation.
Even now Saigo is very popular among people in Kagoshima prefecture, and according to a public survey conducted by the Japan Broadcasting Corporation, elders deify him.
sen.cmt: last clause was off, corrected it and made it sound like standard english.
sen.e: Even now Saigo is very popular among people in Kagoshima Prefecture, and according to a public survey conducted by the Japan Broadcasting Corporation, elders deify him.

sen.j: 県民性の本では「鹿児島県人に、西郷とかごしま黒豚の悪口を言ったら、生麦事件のイギリス人みたいな目にあう」とまで書かれている。
sen.e: In the book of character of people in prefecture 'if you said bad about Saigo and Kurobuta swine, you suffer like a British in Incident of Namamugi'
In the book of character of people in prefecture 'if you speak ill of Saigo or Kurobuta swine, you will suffer something like the British in Incident of Namamugi'
In the book of character of people in prefecture 'if you speak ill of Saigo or Kurobuta swine, you will suffer something like the British in Incident of Namamugi'
